review: If I could give this bank no stars I would, we made a few purchases that were then returned to merchant and once merchant sent us a refund receipt US Bank claims that the money was refunded yet there was never an increase on our account for the money that was suppose to be put back or refund showing on our end and soon as you call these people they have an attitude or don’t know what the hell theyre talking about

name: Michael Tokman
review: Stay Away from US Bank Lyndhurst, Ohio branch (5154 Wilson Mills Rd, Richmond Heights, OH 44143) or from US Bank altogether.  Incompetent at best, this is the worst, most mismanaged bank branch I have ever visited.   I needed to access my safety deposit box and was told by one of the account representatives to get into the regular line and wait for the teller, which I did.  When I reached the teller, I was told to go back and wait for an account representative.  Waited for about an hour, without anyone even looking in my direction, while the branch manager was running around micromanaging every employee and taking over every job slowing things down to a snail's pace.  After an hour, I have had enough and decided to close my account.  Again, I went through the teller line but was told that they could not close the account at the time and have to come back another day.  I have never seen anything like this in any other bank and will definitely say goodbye to US Bank as soon as I am able to close this account.  With Huntington Bank across the street, Citizens Bank around the corner and Chase bank few blocks away I am extremely sorry that I ever considered US Bank in general and this branch in particular.

name: flygirl0507
review: This card is a useless card - and the bank servicing the card (US BANK) is useless as well.  I was a long standing card holder, and received a note in the mail that they were closing my account due to inactivity.  They gave me no options to keep the account open.  How do they make that decision for me?  They don't know what my financial needs are.  I recommend staying away from US BANK and any cards they service!!

name: Michael Feriole
review: Well, Well, I've had an Ace Rewards visa for years. Was a Great card for shopping at Ace Stores where I regularly spent $3000 - $10000/mo. Then Ace let their agreement with Visa Card Bank go bad! Now no more Ace Rewards, Sad state of affairs for a retail giant like Ace not to have a Branded Reward card in this day and age when most All retail stores and more offer Store Branded cards. I will be looking for a Retail store that Appreciates my Business more in the future... Get On The Ball Ace!!!

name: mldbayernfb
review: Closed on home 4 months ago, and lender sold loan to USBANK. USBANK is HORRIBLE! Antiquated service in EVERY regard. I'm always attempting to pay my mortgage 3-5 days EARLY, but login and receive this message: "Sorry, our system is currently unavailable. Please try again later." I literally try several times a day, up until the first day of the month when  - after the 1st of every month - they apply $5.00 fee. When I call to explain what's happening to their customer service reps, offering to email them every print screen I've taken at each login attempt, they don't care and will not waive a fee. Hoping to join a class action lawsuit against USBANK for dishonest business practices in forcing customers into a late fee after the 1st of each month, after preventing customers of having the ability to pay online & on time! It's just plain wrong. Had no choice who my lender sold my loan to, and can't wait to switch from USBANK at the first opportunity! If you have a choice, do not choose US BANK!

name: Rebecca Willoughby
review: I have a credit score of over 800 and have my pick of the very best credit cards.  I have a card endorsed by my labor union through Bank of America, for which has excellent balance transfer offers and rates, Citi Bank Visa (used to be my Costco card too) which has a low revolving interest rate in case I need to carry a balance for a month or two, 2 Discover cards that provides balance transfer offers with no transaction fees for low interest on an almost which is almost always avaliable when I need it, A Gesa Platinum Visa card allowing me to transfer money to my checking at any time I need the extra money with no transaction fee transferring the money instantly as I wait on the phone, a Bank of America Cash rewards cards with excellent cash back,an Old Navy Rewards Visa card, which provides reward points for Old Navy, Athletica, Banna Republic, Gap and Gap factory and each dollar I spent I get a dollar back in reward points and has Excellent! Customer service so when the reward bucks expire they graciously reinstate to me within 3 billing cycles.So that leads me into my review for Fred Meyer rewards Visa card. I am so mad about the bank that  I signed up with Wallet Hub just so I could write thisreview.  I signed up because I was under the impression I would be get rewards dollars back just as I do for my Old  Navy Card with perk periods such as double point periods, special coupons etc. But this bank only allows you to get reinstated points one time for the life of the card. I carried a balance and paid a HUGE interest rate for a billing cycle and just in that one billing cycle the interest I paid alone was more then all of the rewards I collected for the entire time I had the card. I always pay my bills but some months I have to carry a balance and since I was grocery shopping there It was a bigger balance then most of my cards. All I can say is after having almost 40 years of good credit and my pick of the very best credit cards this one has has left a bad taste in my mouth and bad memories, which is why we live our lives is for the good memories.

name: aslmc360
review: I've been a loyal customer of the Fred Meyer credit card for over a year, all on time payments, always more than my minimum, some very large payments made many times. I started a business that grew very fast and my spending habits changed, my payments got bigger and more frequent AND SUDDENLY THE DROP MY CREDIT LIMIT WITHOUT ASKING ME IF MY INCOME HAS CHANGED OR ANYTHING ABOUT MY LIFE. CARD CANCELLED AND I WILL NEVER RECOMMEND IT.

name: Adrianne Harden
review: Been with them for a few years now, every time I call in and speak with a teller I get  told different information and dont bother using online banking because the information dont be current. I'm sick  of them and their high unknown fees

name: mynameisshane77
review: I've owned the Harley Davidson visa card for over 2 years now. In 2016 when i purchased my street bob i was also approved for a Harley visa card at the same time. Was mainly excited about the bike but hey ill take another card to thicken my credit profile.... well got the card in the mail and big whop 500 dollar limit.... you'd figure if they let you finance a $16,000 dollar bike they would give you a half decent CL.... So I've been more vigilant with my scores lately as I'm hoping to buy a home in the coming months and could not for the life of me figure out the reporting date. One would assume they would report the closing date balance like every other card I've ever owned....WRONG they not only could not tell me when they report but it hasn't been the same date for the past 3 months. I called to try and get an actual reporting date since it wasn't my statement closing date or my due date. Was first met with a rude woman who insisted that they report between the 1st and the 6th of every month which i replied mine reported the 28th so that's not true. Finally was able to talk to a supervisor after more rude attitude and less answers from the first woman. He replied that they are not allowed to disclose the reporting date to their customers because they don't want people to "game" the credit score....... 1st off how is this even legal?! That they can just throw a dart at a calendar and go that day works for reporting,and secondly "gaming" the credit score???? I don't follow, i use the card heavily every month which credit companies want for the fees and or interest and then i should be rewarded via credit score for paying monthly (in full) those charges on time....how is this gaming??? So ultimately unless i carry a zero balance or low balance at all times i risk the chance of them choosing a day to report me while I'm carrying a high balance. Yes could i sit here for the next 6 months and try and figure out a pattern sure but that's not worth my time for a 500 limit card with points that i couldn't use to buy a pair of gloves... Save your time and get AMEX or discover or just any other card that actually will give you a decent limit and report your balance on your statement closing date.

name: princetonepps5
review: Horrible BankI've been a customer in 3 different branches of this bank in 2 different states. My experience has been that they are very very negligent and unfriendly people to deal with. Exceedingly careless and less than average competent. Believe me, you will regret going there. If I could I would give negative stars!

name: Ivon Zayas Hernandez
review: I am having the weirdest experience with US Bank customer service. Unfortunately, I have two car loans with this bank and when one of my car loans was paid in full the account simply disappeared from their bank portal. The paid off check was sent on September 11, 2018 and still no news from them. Therefore, I decide to call customer service to inquire about it, and after waiting for a long time to talk to a representative, in two occasions they hang up the phone alleging that my personal information provided didn’t match their records. Useless to ask which other information I could provide to validate my identity. They simply repeated as robots that they had no option other than terminating the conversation right away, that I needed to walk in a US bank branch with ID’s; well I would like to but there is no branch in the state of FLORIDA, where I live. I SIMPLY DON’T UNDERSTAND THEIR POLICY.  Now, I don’t know if they received the check, or what is happening with my supposedly closed account. I am deeply disappointed with US Bank customer service and I don’t know what to do to but for sure the existing will account will soon be refinanced with a more professional institution.

name: Jean Cushenberry
review: DO NOT GET THIS CARD!!! Unless you enjoy spending money expecting points and then make endless phone calls to US Bank and Kroger to get no help, no resolution... but always politely being told “ yes next quarter you will get those points”.   Then repeat cycle - spend- call - and be told to wait till next quarter for rewards mailed.

name: Natalia Stuart
review: Completely agree, and the customer service is terrible . Rood , unprofessional people

name: Paulo Sellitti
review: This bank charges fees for statements. And if you include check images on your eStatement, you get charged again. I was charged. I worked with a customer rep to fix the problem. Then was charged again and not allowed to fix the fee. I'm moving my money to a better bank.

name: rameriz4
review: I got the card 3 months back.... HUGE mistake!!! Only reason I kept it is no intrest on my purchases right now. They have blocked the card 3 times for "Suspicious Activity" all without contacting me before they did so. Including one that stopped a balance transfer that would have saved me money.... After I found out it was too late to take advantage of the 30 grace period on balance transfers. The card has already broke and had to be replaced. I have yet to get the additional 25 cents off a gallon, tried it again less than hour ago... No Discount!!! I have yet to see any additional points on any reciept I get from Kroger. Used it there and on clicklist orders several times. I have had more trouble from this one card than all 4 of my others over the last 10 years!!!

name: ashleehenderson7995
review: One star does no justice as to how awful the customer service is with this particular company. My husband is a part of our US Army and called to update his change of address as his debit card was to expire at the end of September 2018. When he called, he was told that they had sent a replacement card to our old address on August 20, 2018. They never deactivated his current card he had on-hand. However, today, Sept. 16, 2018, when he called to update our change of address and was notified they had sent the new card to the wrong address, the man on the phone said he was going to "fast track" a new card to our current address and it should be here in 2-3 days. The man never mentioned he would be deactivating my husband's current card, therefore he never took money out of the ATM to get us through the next few days. We have two children to feed and send lunches to school with, he has no gas to get to work and our fridge is empty. Now, upon finding out his card had been deactivated, he spent 3+ hours on the phone with different customer service representatives and had nothing but rude, inconsiderate, incompetent assholes. One never even attempted to contact a manager/higher ranking employee, another transferred him to the "Authorization Department" which you have to visit your local branch to get a card authorized, and another one had him on the phone for over an hour until they finally said "I can activate it for gas but that's it." So, after being given the run-around for hours on end, he is told that the card he has in his hand was reported "lost/stolen." The card was not reported "lost/stolen". His mother works with multi-million dollar stock market accounts and things like that with this company and she notified him that that stunt was to cover their own ass. These people did not care to notify him his card was being deactivated so therefore he did not prepare to not have access to his money for the next 2-3 days. They did not care to let him know that he should pull money before they deactivated the card. They did not make the effort to rectify this situation at all. They are incompetent asshats, give no shits about their customers or their families, and make no effort to own up to their own wrong doings. They did not deactivate when the first replacement was sent to the wrong address, so why deactivate after the fact? This company has the worst customer care I have ever seen in all my years of dealing with banking systems. I would not recommend this company to my worst enemy and if you care about your financial well being, I would not EVER give this company access to my money or personal information. THEY DO NOT CARE ABOUT THEIR SO CALLED "VALUED" CUSTOMERS. THEY DO NOT CARE TO OWN UP TO THEIR MISTAKES. THEY DO NOT CARE TO RECTIFY ANY WRONG DOING AND DO ANY AND EVERYTHING AT ALL COSTS TO COVER THEIR OWN ASS. DO NOT DO IT. RUN FAR FAR AWAY AND DON'T LOOK BACK.

name: judithbcochran
review: My experience with US Bank has been a nightmare. I have a home that was partially damaged by another home that burned down next to me. Nine months later I have all the repairs done, my insurance company has been fine and my constant problem has been US Bank. Every time I get a check for reimbursement I have to send it to them and then it takes forever to get it sent back to me. Every time there are new excuses about why they can’t release the funds. I  have sent reams of material to them but it is an ever-changing standard. I will never have anything to do with them again in my life .

name: Cory Meng
review: 1900 1st Capitol DrSt. Charles, MO 63301-1609US Bank 10:50 PM | 9/12/18 (Deposit $880 - Increments 100's (4), 20's (24)ATM made a loud beeping sound after attempting to Deposit more cash from first transaction, after that it attempted to process the transaction stuck on the "Processing" screen for 2-4 minutes and then "Network Error Message" Appeared.ATM began to restart and reset, at that point the screen went Blank and made noises internally, and eventually after 10 minutes turned back on ready for use. At that point, I realized it took my Debit Card and my Funds I deposited with no receipt provided by the ATM to address the amount I deposited... before and after it turned off. At that point, I wrote a note on the First Capitol Schnucks U.S Bank location desk and also put a "Out of Order" sign on the ATM.

name: Quinton Erickson
review: I have been a loyal customer with usbank for 7 or 8 years. I had a fee applied to my account and was denied the request to have it refunded. This is the first fee I have had since I first found out about excessive transactions on a savings account when I had just opened the account. I was staying with this bank because they had great customer service and have helped me when I have gone into a location to make a deposit or request a check. A mistake was made and it cost me $36. I will be closing my accounts and taking my business elsewhere, to a bank that would be more understanding.

name: lyonsmauri
review: Here we go again, day number 3 since I posted my last review and still no resolution. I have received a call about my last post and was told that someone would contact me other then the fraud Dept. So I go to use my credit card again today mind you for the past 2 days I have not gotten to use it and the day before that I used it once, my card keeps getting shutdown because the "system suspects fraud" today was the 48th time to call over a 5 day period because of this issue and now I get told "give the card a rest" mind you for the record this card is NOT maxed out but I am extremely frustrated in the fact that I was told this I never once thought that I would have to call every single purchase I make in order to use the card and then get told I CAN'T use it when I need it that defeats the purpose of having a credit card and last I checked absolutely nowhere in the agreement was any of this mentioned. Also I would like to add that when you are charging 24% interest that I agreed to I expect that I should be able to use this credit card however I please and absolutely no bank should ever have the right to tell you when and where you can use your own credit card this is ridiculous and absurd and I will continue to post these reviews untill this is resolved.

name: Mareshah Daniels
review: I have had an account for 6months and have had so many issues. I highly recommend not using Us bank. I had lost my card, ordered a new one and it never came. I called to get a new one again, still never came, finally got it 4weeks later after 3 calls.I had elected to 'opt-in' for overdraft protection. On more than one occasion they will return the payment and charge me a "returned check" fee, and a couple days later go ahead and pay it and charge me another fee for "overdraft". So basically they are getting two fees for the same payment because the "system" decided to not pay it one day but pay it the next day, and technically they can do that as it's labeled as two separate fees. When asking the Customer Service rep why this happened and if one fee can be waived(just one), she said no it's a "system" decision. So I asked for a manager, she said there were none available!Absolutely the worst bank I've ever felt with. They can't even tell me the logic, rules or stipulations of how my account works.

name: Wayne Vaughan
review: Still waiting for the 15000 reward points...got my card in MARCH here it is the middle of AUGUST with no rewards...several calls to the number and they always say the checks are going out this week in the mail...I guess Kroger gets a cut or owns the bank but as far as the rewards go...it is worthless.

name: amiablesades
review: When you open with a brick & mortar bank, you have customer service expectations. You expect representative to be able to help you, you expect them to listen to your concerns & respond appropriately, you expect them to have a level of concern, awareness, & reliability that only a living person can often provide. Furthermore, when you choose a large, older brick & mortar bank, you expect consistency, the opportunity for growth, & a trustworthiness that can often only be found with years of wisdom garnered from past mistakes.You get none of this US Bank & to add insult to injury, it is your fault entirely for even placing them on such a figmented pedestal. Imagine my surprise to hear that there is nothing they can do to intervene in the automated actions of their 3rd party managed ATM’s. Imagine my shock when their glorified sales rep (they refer to themselves as “Banker’s”) place the blame solely on me for expecting to be warned (JUST warned) about a $1200 check suddenly being reversed & overdrafting my account simply because I’m in the middle of a name change (nevermind the fact that it still had my husband’s name on it as well & that our account is joint). Imagine my utter shock to discover than when I vehemently denied overdraft protection, I didn’t quite pick THE CORRECT option that would not only deny just Visa transactions, but RECURRING Visa transactions as well!Gosh, I must just be SO LAZY to not have realized all these rules about my account THAT WERE NEVER EXPLAINED in the last 4 years I’ve owned this account & NEVER OVERDRAFTED, or even the last time just this year I called regarding this same matter & was explicitly told that ONLY ACH transactions would be put through. What’s crazy is that these people honestly believe that because of $90 worth of transactions going through (which again, should have been declined- oh don’t worry, they now made sure to click that option for me this time! So no big!/s) it’s entirely justified to STEAL $180 even though it sat negative for all of TWO FUCKING DAYS.Ladies & gentlemen, not even WELLS FARGO, the king of banking horror stories, did this to me. My account could sit negative for a total of 3 day’s & I would maybe incurr ONE fee. Yup.So think TWICE folks, this is not the bank for you, trust me. I expect to be treated like a number, I expect fees when I make mistakes, what I DO NOT expect from a PHYSICAL BANK that I can go into is the lack of help, transparency, & theft I’ve been provided with despite the 4 years of WEEKLY direct deposits (every Friday) my husband & I have made!Oh, this is rich too, one day, for no particular reason at all, US Bank closed our savings account even though we’d just had about $1k in it a couple weeks prior & were about to put more in. Oh! & while we’re at it, let’s mention the fact that our account is supposed to be FREE with a qualifying direct deposit, ask me why we’ve suddenly been charged every month this last year... guess what? I have no idea & neither do any of the reps! I would ask a qualified banker, but the THREE times I’ve put in a request, nobody calls us back! & remember, those “bankers” they have at each location... they’re sterile sales people! Last, but certainly not least, the rep I JUST spoke to (she’s the FIRST kind rep I’ve ever spoken to through them) said that customer service reps are completely neutered. They can ONLY reverse fraudulent transactions, no bank fees, just fraudulent transactions... you need a “Banker” to do everything else... but they don’t call you back!So yeah... I recommend looking elsewhere. This is one pile of crap you do not want to have a relationship with.

name: brandtwolf32
review: I would give 0 rating if possible, by far worst company I’ve ever dealt with in my entire life. Opened a money market, checking, and savings account due to $200 offer for new accounts. Between dealing with the branches and customer service had multiple issues from the start. Ended up closing all 3 accounts and switched banks before I even qualified for the $200 offer they sent me, because of the mind boggling poor service I received from the beginning. Stay far away from US Bank!!!

name: hammadrawan
review: Their customer service is terrible. Their techniques are outdated. Their mobile banking options are very behind. Very slow service. They made so many errors with creating my account. I am always traveling so US Bank isn't available everywhere for me to go in to a branch to discuss these issues. Very inconvenient.

name: Davishia Towns
review: After making three calls the first one 59 minutes then hanging up on me the second one 22 minutes and never coming back on the line the third one I finally reach a Minnesota branch and I get Ron on the phone who was hella awesome he helped me out so much he had my back and that's the type of person that needs to be running the whole company because he knows what to do and how to make a customer feel comfortable and Ron if you see this I'm out of Los Angeles California you can call me if you're not married at 551-247-4979 you're the only reason why I'm giving this 5 stars

name: Bib Bobbersin
review: Imagine that you’re 2100 miles from home with your family on an extended business trip.  Before leaving you grabbed the wrong ATM card for your business checking account and you don’t have any checks.  When you call your bank desperately in need of help getting access to your funds, they cut you off at the knees and completely disable your account with no notice instead of calling you.  They then don’t call you back for two weeks letting all your payments bounce and ruining your credit, THEN they tell you they can’t help you and you need to fly 2100 miles to walk into a branch, which you can’t do because the only funds you have left are in your business checking account.  This is what Randy Knotson (the manager at the business “service” center) and Tawnie Finn (branch manager at the La Brea branch in LA) did to me and they’ve yet to fix it.  I’m an IT contractor who travels for work and uses his business checking account to get paid.  Sometimes I work as a W2 employee so my business checking account goes unused for long periods of time between contracts.  Before leaving my home, I could not find my debit card or checks, but I checked google and it looked like there was a US Bank branch near my work in Manhattan.  Clients are regularly slow to pay me for the first time and travel is expensive (I was traveling with my family this time as I have a new 1 year old), so it’s regular for my funds to be depleted to a critical state and my credit cards nearing their max by the first payment.  To my dismay, it was two months before this first payment, plus Google was outdated and there is no branch in New York at all, or any state I could drive to in a reasonable amount of time.I called the business “service” center in a state of panic needing new check books or a check card or something as I really needed to pay bills at this point.  They said I’d have to change my address, so I changed my address.  Then the business “service” center then told me I’d have to wait 30 days now to get checks (would have been nice if they told me this before…could have had someone go to my house on the west coast and send them to me).  I’m with my wife, child, and just spent $20K moving us to New York…I don’t have 30 days to wait, I’m out of money now.  So I asked if they could wire transfer or ACH money to people I’m desperately behind with.  This is not an unusual request for most banks, but apparently the “service” center at US Bank saw this as some sort of security breech so they locked my account.  I can no longer use Pay Pal or anything from the account…it’s totally locked.  I cannot fly to a state with a branch, I’m almost completely out of money.  I’ve been able to buy over a million dollars’ worth of property with bank funds with notarized identification…I’ve never met a mortgage banker personally.  I spent countless hours calling the business “service” center.  Randy Knotson is the manager there and I was told several times he was the one who made the decision to keep my account locked these past two weeks.  I’ve left countless messages with him and he has yet to call me back.  Tawnie Finn tells me I can walk into the branch in Los Angeles with my ID and she’d un-freeze my account, but if she has the power to do this, why can’t she accept a notarized letter like EVERY OTHER BANK ON THE PLANET?  Why can I buy a house this way, but I can’t unlock my own funds?  Tawnie tells me repeatedly that it’s Randy’s decision, but she won’t conference in Randy so we can get to the bottom of it.  So my checks bounce, my e-mail fills with notifications from Experian that I have new negative items impacting my credit, can’t pay for my short term rental in New York so me and my family are about to be homeless, and I can’t afford to fly home.  A complete nightmare.

name: teewinders
review: I have been with US bank for over a year and my past experience with them was great UNTIL recently. I have gotten charged 200.00 dollars late fee for my rent because my check was denied even though I have over draft. I have not once gone past 30 days without my account being positive nor have I gone past being negative 1000.00 dollars. I have contacted customer service about this and the response has been that the bank can just decide not to cover the check. Even though I haven't had a problem for over a year with my checks being covered. I suggest not banking with US bank and finding a bank that can actually answer your questions instead of "I don't know - they just decided not to".

name: Melanie Humphryes
review: I used to love this bank until today. I haven't been able to sign into my account for over an hour and when I called customer support, they said it would be another hour. They did maintaince from 7pm to 9pm (or later, its still not even up yet), on a Saturday night? What genius decided that would be a good idea? Ridiculous! I expected more from the 5th largest bank in the US. A lot more.

name: pblalock48
review: I received an application for this credit card in the mail with a confirmation code on it.  I thought, that since I was rebuilding my credit with a 655 credit score, that I would call the Kroger credit card approval number first at phone number 1-800-947-144  and check to see if my credit score was high enough to receive approval for this card before applying for it.  I was informed by the customer service representative that my approval would depend on a number of factors.  These factors were: The length of time I have lived at my home address (11 yrs, 9 mo),  annual income ($30,000), my monthly house note I make each month ($875.00)  and the length of time of employment with my present employer (2 yrs).  This representative did not give me a straight answer of yes or no, she just said that I would have to apply for the credit card and see.  So I did, and did not get approved.  My credit score took a hit of -3 points for Transunion and -2 points for Equifax for applying.  I don\'t feel that they handle business fairly for people who apply for their credit card.  I believe they should be more honest regarding how a persons credit score will affect the aproval to receive their card first.  I have no negative histories on my credit report, except for 1 old accound in which I owe a small amount I am in dispute of.  I would suggest no one apply for this credit card, unless you have excellent credit.  My credit score is considered fair.

name: bill_yan07
review: FRAUDULENT AND INCONSISTENT ANSWERS from them every single timeTheir practices run like this (for home loans):The 1st banker will almost agrees to all the questions you propose and tell you darling you're perfect and qualify for whatever you want.Once you're LURED into the trap, the 1st crook will push you to the 2nd crook whom might or MIGHT NOT work for the bank (but has a US BAnk email address to look like he/she works for the bank). The 2nd crook probably cheated on his series 7 exam cuz he could never calculate the mortgage rate right (each time gives you different rate, like 6-7 times).For simple issues such as 'can you lock the rate tomorrow', the 2nd crook will tell you Yes Yes Yes and will never follow up. YOU are the ONE they EXPECT TO FOLLOW UP WITH OR DISAPPEAR FROM them because please don't bother the bank, it's busy drinking vodka shots or playing with their fingers at work.Then, if you follow up for an answer, it will drag on for 10 times more than a normal bank would need. If you DARE TO CALL and FOLLOW UP, sorry the voice messages have problems, they can't hear unless you copy some supervisors, then the next second, they suddenly can hear the messages. But, they will avoid your questions and call you at 4:59pm just so they can leave at 5pm and tell you they would give an answer on Monday. Next time you hear from them is in 2080.'PLEASE JUST DISAPPEAR YOURSELF' - is all they ask for. So, we disappear and find another bank.BTW, 2nd crook has never responded or followed up after the initial contact.Now, the bank is living happily ever after.Let it stay in a fairy tale and wait for another financial crisis' kiss to wake it up.

name: Sally Sanders
review: My account was hacked 3 times in 1 month...they handled it horribly. Took almost 2 weeks to revieve any refund on fraudulent charges, before i could even get the new cards in the mail, it was hacked again, then again. In 1 month i went through 7 cards, my original, 3 temp cards & 3 permanent cards. Then my online checking was hacked, so that was disabled. For 2 weeks i couldnt even check my balance & had to wait daily on the phone to get things sorted out, isually 30 min on hold before anyone even answers.  Due to the online hacking i had to completely close out my account & get an entire new acct #. They were supposed to at least give free checks for the new acct bc it wasnt my fault it was switched. My last straw with them is finding a $17 charge on my brand new acct for checks. Done with US bank. They are no where near worth this much hassle. Literally took over my life for a month with this headache. Now banking with Wells Fargo...thank God!!!

name: Sharon Williams
review: I have been with US Bank for over 8 years now. I used there Zelle service to transfer money to my fiance's account about a month ago everything went fine the first time. I went to do another and unlike the first transaction it did not instantly get put into his account. I call the bank they said it was rejected would take a couple days to return to me. I was told monday or tuesday. Thursday came and still no money. I  call again and the next representative told me that the payment didnt have time to be returned that by the end of friday. Now it is Saturday and USbank tells me to contact Zelle but Zelle doesnt even have an option to talk to a person. It says to talk to my bank. Now I am out money that is nowhere to be found. I have a trip i want to make and cant go thanks to this wonderful screwed up bank of mine that obviously offers services through companies and doesnt take the time to figure out how they function. I am looking for a new bank and until then i will be calling every day until my money is located.

name: jean s
review: US Bank charged my 18 yr old college student $25 a week for being overdrwn $15.  His amount owed grew to over $200 from excessive fees, and they did not attempt to contact him except they sent emails.  US bank refused to remove fees.

name: Miguel Barragan
review: Best credit card I have, no hidden fees and good credit lines.I truly recommend this card better yet this bank.great car loans with super low interest rates.Lots of banking options with  great customer service representatives.

name: Stephanie Jensen
review: I’ve had this card over 5 years. Just went through a divorce and they couldn’t take my ex’s name off the existing account...they had to cancel my card. That totally messed up my credit history and they list a loyal customer.

name: Carly Stokstad
review: I recently met with a personal banker regarding a loan. I was unsure of the loan process due to the type of loan. I expected a banker would be able to walk me through the process, instead she shoved a piece of paper in my face, and anytime I had a question told me to read it. She was more interested in running my credit, than actually helping me to understand the process. Her name was Mala, which was fitting, because that is exactly what she was. I 100% recommend going to another bank with bankers that actually care.

name: usmanjob
review: If you want peace of mind, do NOT do business with USBANK. I have been a customer with them for years to know that they are the MOST unethical and not there to support any customer.USBANK is typically a business and they run their business like robots. They will overdraft you and report missed payment to ruin your credit while not providing you any opportunity to resolve your situation. STAY AWAY.

name: brittney guzman
review: HORRIBLE! I paid my balance off of $293 and they took double out of my account! $586 instead of the $293 ....called and they said they couldn't just put it back in my account, that they have to issue it via check in 7-10 business days like I don't have other bills to pay.

name: Joshua Kaplan
review: Recently I visited a U.S. Bank in my community, Washington Iowa , while there i had the worst experience i have ever personally had at any bank or in any professional setting. I do not have an account with the bank but because of an emergency had to use the ATM. I Pulled into the atm lane I was the only customer so made eye contact and exchanged a smile and wave with the employee through the window. As I was using the ATM i received a call and my card was in the machine for over 15 seconds which resulted in the machine keeping it and not returning my card. In a panic, I immediately went inside and explained the situation to the very same young woman. She replied with a smile on her face " Your card has been destroyed and there is absolutely nothing else you can do." I do understand the security aspect but the treatment and lack of compassion, respect, and empathy i received hurt and was not deserved. In the future I will be doing everything i can to spread the word not to use, affiliate, or support your bank in anyway.

name: Dimitri Andreenko
review: Horrible bank. The checking account was the worst I ever seen. I tried to deposit a check... Nope 200$ daily limit. My check was just for $205!!! Like a fool I applied for their credit card cause of the 150$ bonus and got a useless $500 card with a 760 FICO.... When I applied for a cli 3 months later got denied and had my TU pulled 2 times just 1 day in between!!! I'm just going to close it too. What am I suppose to do with a $500 card? I got multiple cards with 10k+ limits on my report. Why not at least give me 2000 or something reasonable? Nope looks like this bank is on par with Credit One... To be avoided!!!

name: m16bit
review: WARNING: HORRIBLE SERVICE AND OVERDRAFT FEES So, long story short, next to zero customer service at US Bank, $120 in fees over two weeks, and zero opportunity to upgrade your credit card. Five years, absolutely nothing, and believe me, I have tried. I'm still stuck at a measly $500 limit. I work a job where I'm paid almost entirely in cash, so I forget to go to the bank sometimes to deposit, which is my fault. I still pay my bills with my card, which are over $500 per month, and this leads me to being overdrafted. However, I've signed up for email and text alerts for being overdrafted over twenty times, and have never received a single alert. Every single time I go into a bank, they tell me sorry, they sign me up for alerts, and tell me they can't refund me at all. I'm a college student, and US Bank is killing me financially. Im going to a new bank in order to avoid having to take out a loan. Avoid the headache, go to another bank before you choose this one. I know I won't ever be using them again, I've got a new card from a different provider coming in the mail.

name: elutus
review: Problems with online banking. When you log into your account it will show you your current account balance (based on the pending transactions) the next day when you log in those pending transactions have been processed and now negative in the account. I don't get it. I have NEVER had this issue with other banks. Everything went through that same day not days and days of 'PENDING TRANSACTIONS" they tell you they are processed everyday at 6PM, thats BS!!…

name: Dimitri Andreenko
review: Horrible is putting it NICELY, they open my checking and i try to deposit a check oops there is a 200$ daily limit for check deposits and 400 monthly limit!!!! IS THIS A JOKE???? WHAT kind of horrible bank is this.... instantly closed account and will close the shitty credit cards also 500$ LIMIT for a 760 fico and lowest limit on ANY OTHER card is 3500.... avg limit 5-6k.... what a shitty bank.....

name: nateb_8_1
review: It is my opinion that this card is greatly underrated. Probably because US Bank is the quieter of the largest banks, and that many aren\'t motorcycle enthusiast (neither am I). However this card has NO annual fee, reports to the 3 bureaus, and you can graduate in 12 months. Use the rewards for tee-shirt or something! Highly recommended. Never a problem. A compliment to Discover It (best) and Capital One Platinum (second best).

name: pkennedy1300
review: I gave this card one star because 0 stars wasn't an option.  I closed this account because of EXTREMELY poor customer service.  When I did so, no one told me I couldn't use the rewards I had accumulated - these were all lost. I complained and was told I'd get a call back. When I did finally get someone on the line they said I would have to reapply for another card to get the rewards.  Even though they have all my info as I'd been a long time customer.  Discover, American Express, other Visas - no other card company has treated me so dismissively.  I would strongly urge anyone thinking of applying for a Visa to go elsewhere.

name: Erik V
review: Just got off the phone with "Robert" ID. RJSIL, he's a supervisor, I made an honest mistake believing I wasn't gong to be charged "foreign ATM fees. He said he wouldn't refund the $47.50 because I should have known better, he actually spoke to me in a way that escalated my tension, offered no condolences or compassion in my error, the Monthly fee is all that is waived and I understood it to be ATM fees from Us Bank as well. He spoke in the most dense and rude way, I ended up hanging up on him. I'm off to a very rocky start with US Bank. This guy says he's been there 7 years and spoke to me with the most condescending manner. He even told me "I'm putting in notes on this account so that NO ONE else can or will refund the money" HE ALSO SAID "If I give you back the money, I would actually be taking money out of the pockets of others to give to you"....WOW, Just a true HORRIBLE PERSON, I hope he doesn't own animals at home.

name: Pibe Chorro
review: I have 2 credit cards with US Bank, the only thing I didn't like was that they don't allow to reallocate credit lines between 2 different credit cards. I was disappointed because one card has 7k and then new one only has 1k, so I could not take advantage of their 18 months free of APR, and I never use the old card since I get charged interest. If you want to take advantage of your credit lines, I recommend you apply to other companies who provide this service, like Chase or American Express.

name: bert_stevenson
review: I have had US Bank personal and previous business accts for over 25 years, and still have an account.  I have dealt with them in Oregon, Nevada and Arizona. They were always top notch in service in their branches as well as the ones in grocery stores in AZ.  However, within the last few months the Goodyear, AZ Frys and Safeway bank branches have become worthless.  They seem to hire the dumbest and rudest people they can find, plus they have lied to me about their notary for the past week.  Told me when they would have a notary available, then when I go  in, "oh sorry they are on a TWO HOUR PHONE CALL"GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE US BANK.

name: Jeff Misner
review: Terrible service. The branches inside the supermarkets are anything but fast.  everytime you go in nobody is at the desk for new accounts in turn tellers have to do it makes for long wait times. getting more like the 2 worst banks everyday B of A & wells fargo  their customer service has gone downhill severely

name: Kyle T
review: So I was having issues with the new debit chip card I received from US Bank in the mail... Vendors were telling me that the chip wasn’t reading. I thought this was weird because I had just received the card only about a month prior. So I went to my local US Bank branch (Hampton ave, St.Louis, MO 63109) for help. I got there at about 10 mins before 5pm and noticed the lobby doors had been locked. So I got back in my car and drove around to the drive-thru window and asked them why the lobby was already closed and the teller told me, “she didn’t know.” I told her about my card and the situation I was dealing with... she brushed me off and told me to go to a different US Bank. I told her my debit card is what I use to pay for everything and without it I don’t have a form of payment... she didn’t seem worried in the least. I thought the way I was treated was very unprofessional. The US Bank employees are downright lazy at this location. She seemed to take pleasure in sending me on my way without being any help. I guess she was having a rough day.  This isn’t the first time I’ve had issues with this US Bank either. Anyway, the whole situation has me frustrated and wanting to change banks. Hope this helps! Have a nice day!

name: Eddie Edwards
review: 1. US Bank renders customer's  debit cards unusable without ever notifying the customers resulting in unpleasant surprises when the card is rejected during a purchase. A visit to the bank building is required to get a 'temporary' card and a reinvestment of even more time obtaining the purchase nixed by US Bank2 Said temporary card is issued to customer with a questioning smile and "Oh, you didn't get a new card in the mail?" No I didn't. And they don't explain that this card is very limited in use, a deposit can't be made with it. I was told it was for security reasons  I told them that if anyone at all wanted to deposit money in my account, I wouldn't complain about security. They are actually protecting me from my bad self, I guess. 3. The replacement card that US Bank robotic smiling reps were so surprised to discover takes  more than two weeks. I'm still waiting for mine. 4. In the meantime, I now have to spend more time going into the bank building to always wait in the long line to make a deposit. Oh, the glories of magical online electronic banking. 5. Going into the bank building yourself? Bring a sack lunch, wear a Depends and wait in the one customer service line while you watch five nicely dressed bank employees at their desks pecking on their keyboards and being totally unconcerned and oblivious about others watching them, standing in line all day long just feet from their desks.

name: supernaw4
review: Don't ever open a CD with US Bank.  First of all they pay terrible interest.  My elderly mother decided to withdraw the funds from her CD.  Since it was a CD over 1 year they had the nerve to charge 3% of the amount withdrawn ($100,000 x 3%=$3,000.00)!!  Since they pay such crappy interest she left there with $98,000.  As you can tell, she never would have earned $3,000 even at full term but they have the nerve to charge that for early withdrawal.  Can you believe they actually take away your principal??  There should be a law against US Bank praying on the elderly!  If i'd been with her I would have advised her to leave until maturity but she went ahead and withdrew just to get out of US Bank.  PLEASE BE SURE TO READ THE EARLY WITHDRAWL PENALTY AND DO THE MATH BECAUSE THEY HOPE YOU WILL NEED YOUR MONEY BECAUSE THAT IS HOW THEY MAKE THEIRS!!!  I WOULD CONSIDER THIS ELDER ABUSE!

name: barbarap_184
review: I opened a checking account for my daughter going off to college because they were on campus with a huge presence.  Big mistake.  I let them convince me to attach a credit account in case she needed and did not have funds in the checking.  Sounds like a good idea, right?  They knew what they were doing and never told me about the fees that would be charged to access it.  Every time she swiped and the balance was not there, it was a $40 fee to access this account.  Don't walk into this bank and let them sell you anything, because they only want to make money off of you.  What a nightmare.

name: Nicole Hobby
review: I have two home mortgages with US Bank and have been happy with how they have serviced the loans.  The customer service staff is super friendly and they answer calls promptly and with a good level of proficiency.  I also had a home equity loan with US Bank and paid off in full.  I kept it open, thinking it wasn't costing me anything, but it did.  They assessed a $90 annual fee on the home equity line.  Which is ridiculous given the interest fees they are making, made worse they weren't providing any administrative support or putting any resources towards the my account.  I contacted US Bank about a possible refund to no avail.  Which is unfortunate because when I am given a banking or home mortage choice, I will chose another provider.

name: DENNISw T White
review: Test comment. Test comment.

name: Thomas Shaffer
review: I assumed a US Bank lease on a car in 2015.  To begin with, their online payment system is terrible.  If you log on prior to the payment due date, the website shows $0 due.  There is no option to schedule automatic payments.  You can only make a payment at the moment you are logged on.  Its very inconvenient.  Worse, my lease allowed for 20,000 miles per year.  I paid a premium on the payment for the extra miles.  I turned the car in with 12,000 miles less that the allowance at lease end.  US Bank proceeded to bill me $7,000 for excess mileage.  I called twice and sent a letter to no avail.  They insisted I went over the allowed mileage by a completely arbitrary number and refused to acknowledge the miles stated on the lease.  It was not until I sent them a certified letter with a copy of the lease and threatened to sue that they stopped bothering me.  They badly overestimated the residual value and tried to make up some of the loss by sticking me with the mileage charge, betting that I didn't have the original lease.  To this day, they have still not acknowledged that the account is satisfied

name: Ang Desiderato
review: I've had my Checking Acct for about 6 months at USBank & I couldn't be happier! They've gone above & beyond! I appreciate their Reps & the level of service Ive recieved...I'm a customer for life! Thanks USBank!

name: pattirose2012
review: Terrible customer service. Everyone kept passing the buck.  I deposited a check for a deposit. It was a local check. It was a small amount and they put a hold on the check for 5-7 days without telling me.  I know from years of working at a bank a notification has to be made.  I am still trying to get hold off so my rent check will be paid.  It shows online that there was plenty of money days before the rent check was to go through. They still returned and no one there knows why. I get a different answer everytime.

name: Iryna Melnychenko
review: I am a member of US Bank since 2011. On January 15, 2018 I got personal loan with them and have negative experience. They lied about fees and charges which were added to my loan on the next day. They put interest rate on these fees too ( they didn't aware me about that) I am strongly not recommending this bank to anybody. I'm very frustrated.

name: Dienesia Paynes
review: I've had this card since 2015 since then my score has increased tremendously let me pay my bills and other credit cards but I am still at the same credit limit I started out with which is $300.00 I don't understand how come they won't give me a credit increase it really sucks

name: leahtroutman311
review: I was in the hospital and had a family member who was helping me with my account being over drafted. I was told I had to leave the hospital to go to the bank and deposit. I will never recommend this bank to anyone. Not even someone I hated

name: Generic Worker
review: I have had a very poor experience with US BANK customer service.  I have used the card for several years for my purchases at REI coop in order to get the 5% rewards.  I always pay the card upon receipt of the statement.  On one occasion I had a balance of $15.00 and submitted payment.  The payment arrived on the due date but according to US BANK after the cutoff time so I was charged a $35.00 late fee.  I was however not aware that a late fee was applied and did not receive statements for several months.  Apparently the company sent single page letters instead of statements since in fact there were no purchases.  Thinking the letters were solicitations or privacy notice junk mail circulars,  I did not open them and threw them away until I finally received an actual statement this month.   By this time,  the company had applied late charges upon late charges and interest on the late charges, again without sending actual statements, running up a bill by this time of almost $100 even though I had purchased nothing and in fact paid my account in full by the due date.  It is my belief that US Bank engages in this trickery to unjustly and fraudulently run up charges and gouge consumers, and was unwilling to listen to reason and reverse all the charges.  I ended up having to pay $22.21, for nothing.  I feel ripped off and intend to cancel the card and write REI,  a company I like, to complain about this disreputable company that uses their name.

name: Bradley Umbarger
review: It does what it says. It reports as a “secured card to all 3 burrows I’ve had it for a Year February 12th I’ll update then if they switch me to unsecured I’ve never been late or used more than 15% of the $300 I also have a capital one secured card $99 deposit $200 limit I’ve had for 4 months (it does not report as secured)  today I was approved for a discover it card with a $1200 limit and a capital one venture with a $300 limit so I can’t complain it did it’s job when no one else would help me. I went from a 498 to a 650 in one year.

name: jason11welker
review: Tried to prepay my 1/1/18 mortgage payment online to pull in the interest expense on my 2017 interest deductions to manage around the changing tax laws.   It has been a nightmare.  I wish I would have left it alone.  The online tool can't handle the payment.  I've called them 4 times now to fix and it still isn't fixed.  So I paid the mortgage payment in December, but my online statement still says my 1/1/18 mortgage payment is due.   To boot, I received a letter in the mail saying I still owed payment for 1/1/18.   I guess the 4 people I spoke with couldn't craft a letter stating that my 1/1/18 bill was paid.

name: Benjamin Woelk
review: I had a very poor clerical and customer service experience with US Bank. I opened an REI card with a very high credit limit back in October of 2017. I had an autopayment scheduled in November to pay the balance of the card in full that I attempted to cancel several days before the payment was due. Online it indicated the autopayment was cancelled. I then submitted a payment for nearly half of the entire statement balance of $235. U.S. Bank still processed the autopayment for the entire statement AND THEN took an ADDITIONAL $235 payment. To clarify, after the autopayment went through my balance on the statement and card was FULLY PAID. US BANK took an additional $235 beyond anything that was owed to them! I called and learned that US BANK is more than happy to take money towards "future payments" and only upon request was I issued a check in the mail that took 10 business days to arrive. Imagine that the next time you think about their Cash Advance terms.Fast forward to this month, believing everything was settled with autopayments and the whole issue, I just received a late payment. I called to complain and told them I wanted the $27 charge removed due to the entire scenario described above. They refused to remove the late payment (due on New Years Day) so I just closed a $17,500 credit limit card with the bank. I will never do business with US Bank again, REI needs to look at the financial corporations they are supporting closely.

name: Sarah Martin
review: allows extreme over the credit line charges and then charges you forever.  changes cardholder agreement terms every other month.  unethical business practices. expects a business to keep track of credit line with multiple users

name: Suhanthan Vanniyasingam
review: Charges inactivity fee monthly even before you start using a card. So you will simply lose your money by holding a gift card which is not even opened. This is not how all other prepaid gift cards work

name: Kelsey Keller
review: I have banked with numerous banks in my lifetime and worked for one for 6 years. This bank is by far the worst bank when it comes to customer service, common courtesy and customer relationships. I was in a car accident a year ago and finally received my settlement proceeds from my lawyer. I went and deposited the check in a joint account I had with my husband at US Bank. I was told because of the amount, they would need to put a hold on the check for 7 days. I was fine with this as I understood the policies and procedures that comes with check deposits. A couple of days later, I found my debit card wasn’t working and my husband realized his wasn’t either. When he called, he was told that the fraud department speculated that the check was fraud and that they were closing down all of our accounts. They did absolutely nothing to try and verify the check (which is legit.) They didn’t bother calling the bank the check was drawn on OR my lawyer to ensure that he did in fact issue this check to me. Instead, they took it upon themself to just speculate that the check was fraud and close down the accounts due to speculation, rather then verifying anything. On top of that, we weren’t notified of any of this. They were just going to close down the accounts and send us a cashier check in the mail. Because the accounts are frozen and in the process of being closed, my husband was unable to receive his direct deposit from his work, our mortgage and insurance bills have bounced and we have no access to any of our hard earned money until this is dealt with. Just save yourself the headache and find another bank to deal with your financial needs.

name: Tammy Faye
review: They've made several mistakes and when I tried to get it resolved, I get the runaround -- and that's from a loyal good standing customer.... months later I'm still dealing with it and i can't get anyone to look into it...bad

name: Cammie Pierce
review: I really can't stand this bank, I switched from Logix and I am going back - US Bank is the worst bank to have. When you log into your account it will show you your current account balance (based on the pending transactions) the next day when you log in those pending transactions have been processed and now negative in the account. I don't get it. I have NEVER had this issue with Logix. Everything went through that same day not days and days of 'PENDING TRANSACTIONS" they tell you they are processed everyday at 6PM, thats BS!!

name: ssjkenny
review: The worst experience I've ever had involving money. Absolute incompetence all around. How this company is still in business is a mystery to me. I've never had to jump through this many hoops or pay this many fees to get my own money.

name: blainemelin
review: Wanted to resupply my envelope stash of Canadian currency.  In addition to paying up front for it, was given an invoice statement showing the exchange rate and then a line item showing $0 for fees.  Problem is that the exchange rate listed was 5.29% too low for the day and time I bought it.  And then I was charged $10 for shipping.  Of course I had to come back in to pick it up.  Then when I did they just handed me the envelope (desk clerk and the branch manager) without counting it out and said sign here.  I feel I paid $20.57 US too much for my $200 Canadian.  A real inadequate service with deceitful charging.

name: mobillsimpson
review: If I could give this card a 0 I would. Have had card for over a month now & have yet to receive my 25¢ cents gas promotion discount when redeeming 100 pts at a frys fuel center. Have spent hours on the phone between fry s & us bank each co blaming the other for the error. My cards are linked fine,have verified with countless supervisors I'm doing everything correctly &have even tried different frys  fuel centers but still only receive 5¢ rather than 25¢ . Last us bank rep cancelled& reissued cards & guess what-still just get 5¢! This has been beyond frustrating-Please do not get this card -nothing is worth this hassle. If someone would just take responsibility-fix the error without blaming the other Co.& just transferring me but I guess those days are long gone.?

name: pizzalover3128
review: Cannot get my rewards. They don't arrive, then I have to call in, then they put in a request, then they put them back into my account, then I have to wait for the next redemption period. I do not recommend this card!

name: jacksoncarl415
review: My direct deposit with Green Dot bank is in my account on Wednesday.  With this card it's not there until Friday.  I'm going back to Green Dot.  123 should study their competition and get with the program.  How can they possible expect to compete with a bank who makes  customers money available to them two days earlier?

name: jpt155060
review: This bank should be close they do nothing but steel from customers!!! Reordering checks to maximize overdraft fees. All bank officers should be fired and hopefully losses billions in law suits! STAY AWAY!!!!

name: terryjohnson63
review: When making a large deposit in U S Bank please know that they will put a Hold on the majority and you will not have access to your OWN money for up to 9 days. I do not know about them, but I worked hard for the money I get and do not want to be punished for making a deposit in a "So Called BANK" . Any financial institution that thinks all of their depositors are crooks, can not be trusted with honest working peoples money. I wonder if the CEO and CFO have a hold put on their funds when they make a deposit? The PGA of America should be ashamed to have these suspicious money grabbers as a sponsor. U S Bank should not even be allowed to sponsor a Putt Putt tournament, or any sporting event. My daddy told me there were 4 people in the world you could not trust. A Doctor, A Lawyer, A Car Salesman, and anyone else who said "Trust Me", He died before he had any dealings with U S Bank or he would have added a #5

name: Cammie Pierce
review:
you have to cash the check, and then make the deposit. 
I am dealing with that now, I can't stand this bank. I made a deposit on Saturday, still hasn't gone through.. When i log into my account it shows my account balance based on the pending transactions, the next day i go in, all of those pending transactions have gone through and now I am negative, and charged me $36.00 (6 times). They were not helpful on the line. When you call into their call center it sounds like we inconveniencing them by calling. Like they are in the middle of something and we are bothering them.

I had logix previous to this, and I NEVER had this issue, things weren't pending for days.. Everything was processed that same day. I am closing this account.. They don't even deserve a 1 star

name: jerry pitsenbarger
review: just opened a gold checking with us bank and with my low score approved for this card.  Have the rewards visa and rei MasterCard with them.  never late rarely carry a balance.  No credit Limit yet.  You got to love this bank, if you are responsible card owner they will give you credit.

name: Anonymous
review: Do not get this card especially if you already have credit card. I already have credit and debit cards I thought this would be a good card for my business such as using it on line instead of using my real credit card information. Totally wait of time and my money. I put a $100.00 on this card and ask to cancel it to get my cash back and they said no I could not get my cash back. Because it is a temporary card. The customer service rep tried to play with my intelligence.  DON'T DO IT IS A WAIT OF TIME.

name: Anonymous
review: I hate us bank so much. It takes too long for my money to be sent to my significant other. I wish i had chase. I love the quick pay rogram they have. There costumer service. Other thing is checks are so expencive in us bank and other thing i dont like is that us bank dont have a lot of diferent logos for the debit or credit cards. The same logos get old. I loved the bears debit card i had in chase

name: Anonymous
review: What they did not explain was that if you already had a Kroger plus card it had to be linked to the number on the back of the new credit card in order to get the extra .25 cents per gallon of gas. So of course purchased fuel for a month and did not get the .25 cents extra per gallon. To top it off the credit card company gave me wrong instructions to begin with and then when I called back they said they do not deal with that Kroger does. Then Kroger said I can link the credit card and your shoppers card but cannot give you the .25 cents per gallon on gas back...Have not decided if I will bother with it again!!!

name: Katy Stanton
review: Could you tell me how to link my shoppers card and credit card??

name: Anonymous
review: Great card, one of my primary cards. I use it basically exclusively for my 5% categories. I was very surprised to sign on here and find that it has only 3 stars from most reviewers. It has pretty generous categories at 5% all year round with the choice to rotate them quarterly? What's to hate?

name: Anonymous
review: I applied for this card thinking it would be a good way to get some rewards and coupons on my grocery purchases.  It took over a week of phone calls and faxes from me to get identity verification to them, because they kept telling me they either could not READ information on my ID and SS Card or they did not receive my faxes. I had no one follow up with my account at all, despite having given them my mobile number and asking for follow-ups until the final day I gave up and decided to go with another debit card company.  I spent a total of 28 dollars in faxing out if my own pocket trying to prove to this company that has antiquated equipment (fax machines that cannot print a legible document) and they gave more excuses about how I was not doing what they asked, rather than spending the time to find out from their research department what was truly needed.  I will not be trusting any of my money with this company and have decided to stop shopping with Kroger/Smith's after being a loyal customer since 1995 when I lived in Nashville, TN (headquarters for Kroger).  The incompetency on the front lines of a business shows pretty clearly worse issues internally and working upward toward management.

name: Anonymous
review: my mother has a card from us bank .she was doing good until the company lied and said they sent bills that were returned .who in there right mind would return a bill or bills and chance messing up there credit .I believe the card company has found a way to screw people without them knowing it.

name: ankush_kumar
review: This is a horrible card. When I want to close the account after paying full due amount they told me it will take up to 60 days to get your money back. US Bank is running a scam where they hold customers money for that long period even though they pay off full due amount. I would avoid this card at all cost. Also to close your account you have to write a letter or fax and there is no way you can close it by phone or via e-mail or by accessing your account online.

name: Anonymous
review: While this card will help you build credit, it is very generic in that sense.  I would choose another company and here is the reason:  I had this card for over 3 years with 100% on-time payments.  US Bank will not return security deposit and upgrade the account to unsecured status.  This is touted by US Bank as something they do but it does not appear that is the case.  I ultimately closed the account.  Discover is a better option.

name: Eileen Wood
review: Getting a secured credit card boosted my credit rating by 75 points almost immediately.  After a lot of research, I chose the Harley Davidson secured card because it has no annual fee and offers rewards points. It was easy to sign up online and I got my approval and card within 10 days. Increasing my credit limit when I'm ready will be simple - the Customer Service Rep was very helpful and easy to deal with when I called.  I've had to call Customer Service for a couple things - nothing that was the bank's fault at all - and the Reps have always been helpful and kind.Overall, I have been very happy with my card and plan to keep it even when I someday no longer need a secured card.

name: Vincent Poy
review: The 3% cash back is misleading as if you actually do a statement credit, it is $16.75 for every 2,500 points which is 0.67% for every $1 at the 1 point and basically 2.01% for every $1 at the 3 point.

name: Steven Adams
review: Negative Experience: I had three accounts (business, savings, and checking) with a total of $4,500 with US Bank and accounts over 10 years old. They closed all three in one day with no notice and sent me a cashiers check for the balance that they charged me $7 dollars each to cash. I found out when I logged in online and noticed the changes and US bank will not tell me why the closed the accounts. They are charging me $30 dollar overdraft fee b/c I used the card and did not know they had canceled my account. They turned this 'overdraft fee' over to a collection agency 4 days after closing my accounts without even telling me this had occurred. How can you fix a problem you don't even know about? Worst bank ever and you should go somewhere else!

name: Susan Toth
review: STAY FAR AWAY FROM THIS CREDIT CARD COMPANY!!!!  THEY WILL SCREW YOU WHEN THEY HAVE THE CHANCE.  THEY COMPLETELY WIPED OUT MY PERSONAL CHECKING ACCOUNT AND WITHDREW MY ACCOUNT.  ON JANUARY 5TH, 2017 I HAD A $4.95 BALANCE ON MY CREDIT CARD AFTER I PAID OFF MY BALANCE.  I WENT ON THERE SITE TO PAY THE $4.95 AND I CHECKED OFF TO PAY THE BALANCE.  THEN ON FEBRUARY 7TH, 2017 I USED THE CREDIT CARD TO CHARGE A TRIP TO EUROPE.  THE NEW BALANCE WAS NOW $2053.  AS SOON AS I RECEIVED THEIR STATEMENT, I WENT ONTO THEIR SITE ON FEBRUARY 16TH AND SET UP $500 AUTO PAY PAYMENTS. (I ALSO GOT A CONFIRMATION NUMBER FOR THAT) BUT THEY DECIDED TO TAKE THE ENTIRE BALANCE INSTEAD OF THE AUTO PAY AMOUNT I SET UP BECAUSE THEY SAID I HAD CHECKED OFF TO PAY THE BALANCE IN FULL BACK IN JANUARY WHEN I PAID OFF THE $4.95.  I WOULD HAVE UNCHECKED IT THOUGH WHEN I SET UP THE $500 AUTO PAY AMOUNT.  THERE EXCUSE WAS THAT IT WOULD TAKE AN ENTIRE CYCLE TO TAKE EFFECT.  WELL THAT'S BS!  NOW  MY CHECKING ACCOUNT HAS A NEGATIVE BALANCE AND I HAVE MY MORTGAGE AND OTHER PAYMENTS I CAN'T PAY.  THEY SAID THEY CAN REFUND SOME OF THE MONEY BACK BUT IT COULD TAKE UP TO 14 DAYS!  WHAT AM I SUPPOSE TO DO IN THE MEANTIME?

name: lorid_qed
review: While no card is perfect, this company has always been diligent in monitoring my account for strange activity. They recently caught $7K in charges that occurred over a 24 hour period, and couldn't have been more professional and expedient about contacting me and resolving the issue. I'm keeping this one in my wallet.

name: Allen Jones
review: I have been an REI member for many years and have had the REI card for nearly as long.  It was my go to card for everything.  After they changed from Visa to MC, they sent a new chip card.  It came the day before I left on vacation.  While on vacation, I checked my account and discovered several fraudulent charges and notified them.  Their first response to cover their zero fraud liability was to accuse me of making the charges.  Then they would not send a replacement card for about 4 months while "investigating".  Since I had began using a different card during that time and they way I was treated, I no longer use their card.  Needless to say, it also dampened my desire to shop at REI.

name: mmiller1974
review: When this card started, I couldn't tell enough people about it. 1.5 points per $1.00 spent, bonuses for groceries, gas, air travel, UP to a $400 ticket for a meer 20,000 points and a $600 ticket for only 30,000 points. That's up to $.02 reward per point. Fabulous benefit and easy as could be. Then they dropped it to 1 point reward per $1 spent. OK, still a good deal. Book through Travelocity, you could book First class, comfort, economy or whatever your points would get you. Then somewhere in the fine print (who reads the messages on your bill, or even gets a bill anymore with Online work) US Bank got greedy. They decided to change from the reputable Travelocity to some third world travel handler, QT Travel. I tried to book a flight and found that my points were now worth up to $.01 per point, effectively cutting in half the reward I could get, and I could only book a super "cattle car" economy ticket with no seat assignment. I am taking my credit card business elsewhere, as US Bank no longer appreciates my business. Don't waste your hard earned credit transactions on a third world card!

name: y3k
review: Their site has been down for a month and THEY forced you to get a NEW user id and password and their site doesn't work and the people you talk to are clueless and say it's being updated.....worse than the obama website on day 1

name: Natalia Stuart
review: I am surprise that is the bank behind this scam . Very unprofessional and rood customer service .

name: Deanna Ingram
review: I wish I could give this card zero stars. Do not ever get this card. The company misleads it's customers. My card was stolen and I have not been sent a new card! It's been over a week now and I still have to wait! They are a scam!

name: U.S. Bank
review:
Hello Deanna323232,

We're sorry to hear that your card delivery seemed delayed. Did you receive your new card yet? If not, we encourage you to reach out to our customer care team so they can get you squared away at 1-800-USBANKS. Thanks!

name: Mason Cooper
review: Just walked in and tried to ask, I believe her name was Danielle, behind the counter if they were open. She looked up from texting on her personal phone and shushed me. So rude. After she was done texting on her phone, she had an attitude with me. All I wanted to do was deposit a check. It's people like this that have killed customer service. Terrible.Walmart Sherwood, OR

name: Dienesia Paynes
review: I like the car because it help me build credit and they gave me a card we're not too many other companies would.however I did end up getting approved for a Capital One Secured card. And a discover secured card. Without asking or requesting a unsecured card or credit increase Capital One increase my credit from $300 to $600 just for being a good customer with good payment history although I did not receive my security deposit back yet I am happy for the credit increase that was shocking for a secured card I didn't know they did that. I have not reached my 12 months with them yet but I will see what happens when that time comes. With my Discover card I just reach my 8 month I received a congratulations letter and a week later I receive my security deposit back. I officially now have an unsecured card with discover too happy  now in 2 weeks I will have been with US Bank for one year and when contacting US Bank to ask about the unsecured card i was told I would have to apply for a new card in order to receive a unsecured card and see if I qualify and they  do a hard pull so I think this is one downfall for this card.  the mere fact that i have to reapply and pull my credit instead of simply returning my security deposit after 12 consecutive months excellent payment and converting my secured into a unsecured hard had to do the whole thing as if I'm applying for a new card and that I do not like so if I had to recommend any security cards I honestly would recommend Capital One and discover before I recommend u.s. Bank they understand the value of great customers taking care of their cards and they understand the value of customers not wanting to have too many hard pulls on your credit report and they reward you in the end for being a great customer as for US Bank they do not

name: Allie McDonald
review: I received my card in the mail and activated it. But when I tried to use it it wouldn't work so I called customer service and found out my account had been closed. It had the card less than a week and was told I would have to reapply or mail in a request to reopen the account. They did not tell me why it was closed when I hadn't even used it yet.

name: brunontheweb
review: I've been banking with them for over 10 years and it is always a hassle!  I make good money and my credit score is above average, althoug when I deposit a large check they always put it on hold, as if I was a dishonest person or not trustworthy, shame on them!  They have zero criteria!

name: Darla Pitman
review: Customer service is crap, and they don't seem to care! They shorted me three months in a row on the "triple points" on Kroger family purchases. I had saved my receipts, because I was suspicious they were shorting me. One month they didn't even give me the amount I had spent on their brands, let alone triple that! The first 2 months, after calling to complain, and insisting they make it right, they did reimburse me. But the 3rd month, they said there was nothing they could do, and that there was a lapse in the amount of time from the purchase to when it shows up on my acct. Well, that was total bs! It never did show up. And you must have to use the card for thousands of dollars in purchases to reap any "rewards", as I have only gotten a $5 coupon in over a year, and that is my primary grocery! Now, I just use it for emergencies, and realize it is an incorrectly named card. There are no rewards.

name: Sipra Ray
review: Awful. They don't try to help customer. Cheat the customers. Ask the president to help. He hand over the job to somebody else. He is big & getting paid big box.

name: Donnie Henley
review: This  card  is  just  a  scam . You're  told  your  money  will  be  accessible  in  24 hours , but  once  you  sign  up  and  you  get  paid  you're  not  allowed  access  to  your  money  for  up to  3 business  days . When  I  was  researching  cards  for  my  direct  deposit  one  of  their  represented told  me  I'd  have  access  to  my  money  in 24 hours , that's  the  reason  I  chose  this  card . I guess  it's  anot her scam people  should  look  out  for .

name: Carol Lawrence
review: Be mindful that the $100 gift card is earned after making a purchase within 60 days of approval.  I assumed 'activation'.  WRONG.

name: Jason Lednum
review: Thanks for pointing that out

name: Jene Pitsenbarger
review: Love US Bank This is my 4th card with them Approved with a 630 Transunion score.  Only a 1,000 CL.  I usually never carry a balance but the 0 percent is attractive item.  Have a world MasterCard with a 5,000 limit so disappointed with only a 1,000 but considering how low my score is I guess that is fair.  I do carry an active checking with US Bank.
