Overall, not bad service for a bank, but they are just as quick as the others to charge fees whenever they are "allowed" to. I don't think you can escape that.

name: Rachael Gilligan
review: I've had a U.S bank checking account for over 4 years, For the most part i have been very happy with it. The people are friendly and very helpful. I did have one issue with it though. One day after a deposit i noticed my account was significantly high. upon talking to the person it was found out that an employee made a mistake when making a deposit and put it in mine. They fixed it. The next day when i went to use my card they said it was declined. i called my bank and they told me that the person whose account it was supposed to go to noticed it and the employee withdrew the money again from my account causing it to be overdrawn. the lack of communication between the employees is what caused the problem.

name: Jacqueline Lapham
review: I never  need to use my Hobby Lobby credit card at Hobby Lobby anymore because I use their gift cards now and everything is free to me!  I use my Hobby Lobby credit card everywhere else to earn as many gift cards as possible. I am having my online banking send them automatic payments weekly and then I use that to buy groceries etc. It is working out very nicely for me.

name: carrie williams
review: This bank is absolutely horrible and the customer service is even worse. I went through cancer and was in the hospital for 6 months. I was so sick that I couldn't walk. I had 12 surgeries. I couldn't pay my mortgage and I asked for help with that. Anything I could do to keep my home. Half of the time, I couldn't even reach someone on the phone, or after being put on hold for an hour and half (while I'm in the hospital with a feeding tube) I reached someone who raised their voice to me. It was such a mess and no one in customer service seemed to know what they were doing, or care about the issue I was having. My children and I lost our home. Since, we've switched to Community First Bank and purchased land and are building a cabin that's almost finishedl Seriously, stay away from U.S. Bank!

name: Cody Sorrell
review: US Bank has very good tellers. They helped me get the right kind of savings account setup, and even has help for students like me! They have always been nice when I have been in there, and have never given me wrong information. I also know quite a few people that have a savings account with them and are very happy with it.

name: jessica ratliff
review: I've had this account for 4 years. Nothing really stands out about it except for the annoying fee for what they deem less than their required amount (to mehttp://wallethub.com/d/us-bank-savings-account-1000740b/?r=1#rating2, I'm trying to save, charging me a fee to try to save takes away from the whole purpose of the account). I do like the ease in transferring money from my checking to savings. Phone app works well. Pretty standard, nothing fantastic or standout about the account

name: Jessica E
review: I started a checking account with U.S. Bank through my university at the start of term in August of 2014, so I haven’t been with them very long. The woman who signed me up told me I would receive free checks, so when I went to the main branch to make my first deposit and fully set up my account, I asked about said checks. The gentleman teller who was assisting me was very kind and charismatic, but he gave me the most absurd runaround regarding my checks that I have ever witnessed. Finally, because he would not stay quiet about the perks of U.S. Bank’s online bill pay options and wouldn’t stop making comments like “You don’t want checks, you guys are college students! They’ll get lost everywhere in your school stuff,” I said I’d look into online bill payment and left the branch before I wound up late to work. A week later when I called into customer service to try ordering checks that way, I received roughly the same runaround and after nearly twenty minutes of back-and-forth with the gentleman I spoke with, I had to tell him (a little snappily) that I wanted the convenience of writing a check from my own home to pay rent to my landlord that was not set up for online bill payment, and I did NOT want to have to waste gas to drive to the physical branch to receive a free money order. He was very unfriendly after that, I assume because I lost him commission on an online bill pay signup. I finally, however, received my free five checkbooks after two weeks of waiting for them in the mail.

name: Kyle Maddox
review: The Kroger 1-2-3 Rewards Credit Card is a pretty good option if you shop with them frequently and need a card.Interest rate is pretty good and competitive with other cards, good grace period which can be helpful. The big thing, of course, is if you're a big Kroger customer. If you are you'll get a lot out of the rewards and benefits. Bonus points, cheaper fuel, it's a pretty good deal.Compare it to the Walmart Store Card. Similar interest rate (Kroger is a bit better), better bonus points (though both are good for fuel savings) and otherwise similar terms. Obviously it'll depend on which place you go to more but if I had to pick, I'd go with the Kroger card.I would definitely recommend this card.

name: Fakou Namo
review: This card is limited and terrible in so many ways.  Effective 1% cash back if and only if you spend $500 a month on groceries at kroger.  Else a 0.5% on all other purchases.  This forces you to shop at kroger despite whatever competitive prices there may  be at other grocers meaning you have easily paid 20% more in the $500 groceries you buy a month in exchange for $5/month.  I think I like the $100 not spent more than the $5 back in groceries.  Laughable, so look else where as 1% is an industry standard for ALL purchases on any simple rewards credit cards.

name: Heather Hathcock
review: I visit hobby lobby often, so each purchase there earns me 5 points per dollar spent. I earn 1 point per dollar spent anywhere else I use the card. I was awarded a high credit limit, which helped add a few points to my credit score. The interest rate is a little steep, but I just make sure to pay my balance at the end of every month to avoid that fee. Overall, I am very satisfied with the card.

name: David Crichton
review: You need to be aware of how U.S. Bank operates in relation to this card.  I applied for this card, but was sent a letter asking for more information.  When I called, I was questioned by a gentleman who sounded like he came straight out of the FBI.  A week later I called about my application and discovered that I had been "approved."What was not clear, however, until later was that I had not been approved for the card I had applied for - the US Bank Flexperks Visa Signature card - but instead I got a new Flexperks "Select Rewards" card.  This card is completely useless and a waste of plastic. You get only 1 point for every $2 of spend.  To me, this is more like a bait and switch tactic.  And, yes, I now am aware that in the little bitty writing on their online application, it says that US Bank may approve you for this card.  Still - bait and switch, I say.

name: Brittany
review: The US Bank Student Checking Account was my first ever adult bank account. My parents both banked with US bank when I was growing up and I had a children's savings account there. When I moved out of state to go to college, I opened up this account with them. It has no fees and no minimum balance. I also like their debit cards are Visa making it easier to use anywhere. I have always had great customer service with this bank and will continue to bank with them in the future.

name: Chris Sorensen
review: Terrible Card. Had an emergency and NOT ONE PERSON AT THE CUSTOMER SERVICE LINE COULD ASSIST. You cannot get a hold of anyone in management unless you ask the rep to fill out a call back form and then you will not receive a call for up to 48 hours. I waited the 48 hours with ZERO call backs. Time to get out hte scissors and spread the word to not  get this CARD at all.

name: Sara Weiler
review: The SAME experience with CS!! Earned over 1500 points..nothing!!!

name: Daniel Feldt
review: I have US bank now for 3 years and even though my credit isn't that great, they are always friendly, helpful and do their best to make you feel just as important as the next guy who comes in. I called their number and was on hold for a few minutes until a nice lady came on and helped remove some fraudulent charges from my account that had been pending removal for quite some time. I had my identity stolen and was SOL for my other banks and they were less than helpful. Give US Bank a shot, they'll make you happy.

name: Lindsay Marie
review: I really love this student checking account.  It was my first checking account when I started college.  The online portal in which you can view your transactions and history is really helpful and user friendly.  For students, there is no online bill pay fee which is awesome.  The overdraft fees are costly, but that doesn't change my opinion about this account.  If you ever have anything that shows up on your account that doesn't look right, you can contact US Bank and they're really great at helping you solve the problem.  It's a great bank account!  I recommend it to any college student who wants a hassle-free checking account as they start their academic career.

name: Sebastian Niles
review: This bank provides an excellent checking account service. The application process is extremely easy; I simply went into my local bank, applied, and left in about 30 minutes. My favorite thing about the checking account from U.S. Bank is that they don't have a required minimum balance. This makes banking easier and less worrying especially since I am a student. Until recently, this bank had a reserve line of money (a sort of cash advance) that went along with the checking account. I used this often due to the expenses of college. It was a lifesaver, and it makes this bank all the better in my eyes. This bank no longer has that type of service with the checking account but it is still available in another service which I use because I can rely on it. Finally, I really enjoy customer service with U.S. Bank. I rarely call customer service (because the service rarely has any problems) but when I do, I feel as if I am a valued customer. Barring any major changes to this bank, I feel as though I will be a lifelong customer with them.

name: Michelle Sexton
review: I had US Bank account for quite a long time. It was my first checking account that I opened when I got my first job and they made an exception for opening my account because I was technically too young to even open the account. I had a great overall experience with US Bank. The only reason I had to close the account was because I moved somewhere that did not have a US Bank close by, so if I could give any suggestions, I would say expand and open up additional locations. I would've stuck with US Bank, but there weren't any close by to where I live now.

name: Irol Nosredna
review: I have a savings account at US bank. They are a great bank, and always give me good service when I go into the branch. A teller recommended that I set up a savings account one day, so I took her advice. I sat down with a banker and it was open in about five minutes. I got an auto savings plan, which helps me set aside money. In a year, I was able to save five hundred dollars! I was so happy and now have an emergency fund. I highly recommend US Bank to anyone looking to save money.

name: Christina Hoagland
review: I like the fact that this card has such high Rewards, has a better rewards than capitol one; However the interest rate is a little higher. You get 5 dollars free groceries, for every 1000 points you earn, which anything that helps increase the grocery budget is a bonus for me.  The 25 cents off gasoline is great at the pump especially now-a-days, that gas prices are so expensive.  Plus the emergency assistance services this is a well rounded card.

name: Alia Bierwag
review: I banked with US Bank for several years before moving out of state. The new town I lived in didn't have a US Bank, but I decided to leave my account open so I could use it as a harder-to-access checking account. One day I paid a bill and accidentally used the wrong checking account, and it made my US Bank account go into the negative. I was rightly charged a fee for this. Since I could not go to the bank in person to put money into the account, I had to transfer money from my other checking account at Nevada State Bank into the US Bank account. In order to do that, Nevada State had to make two small deposits and withdrawals to verify my US Bank account. Since my US Bank account with in the negative, when Nevada State withdrew those two small deposits, I was charged fees for both of those withdrawals as well! I called US Bank and talked to the manager. I told her my predicament, and told her there was no way that I could have fixed this situation any other way, being out of state, and I didn't think that it was fair that I was charged two outrageous fees for those tiny (like 5 cent) verification withdrawals. The manager told me there was nothing she could do about it, and she acted like she did not care at all about my problem. So I told her to close my account and that I was reporting them to the BBB. I did report them to the BBB, and after that, I received a credit for those two fees I had incurred. I was glad that I was reimbursed for those fees, but mad that the manager told me she couldn't do anything about my problem, when it's obvious that she could have, but it took the BBB twisting her arm to refund my money. I will never bank with them again.

name: Terri Haselwood
review: I originally loved US Bank but then a few months ago after I only overdrew my account once, they began to start purposely causing more overdraws. When I called my bank to dispute these charges, the lady I spoke to was not only condescending but she was very rude and refused to let me speak to a supervisor. Finally after awhile she had me transferred to a resolution operator. But before I was allowed to speak to him, she had put me on hold so she could tell him "her side" which was ridiculous. I spent forever on the phone with this new operator who proceeded to tell me that it is their choice if they want to charge a 36 dollar overdraft fee for a .50 cent transaction. The whole thing was ridiculous. Ever since this experience I have noticed that they will now purposely hold some of my transactions in hopes of overdrawing my account.

name: Becky Allenbaugh
review: I have been at this bank since I can remember because my parents were for the most part belonging to this bank. My husband and I got a joint account about 5 years ago when we got married and it has been wonderful since then. We walk in or go through outside and they are all so friendly and know us my name and talk to our children and ask us all how we are doing, and even are personal about things sometimes which makes me feel really good. We never need our slips to deposit or withdrawal because they just do it for us. I feel close to everyone there but recently there has been a new girl. I understand being new and you're learning the ropes and wanting to do everything exactly by the book but then there is a line to where you are just rude. Whenever I walk in she just looks rude and not very engaging or happy. I go to deposit or withdraw something and I don't have a slip because, well I never do because we have never had to. She is rude about me not having one and demands that the next time I have one (which I still never do). I just wish she would be more friendly and a little laid back. That's how she is going to get life long customers that like coming in and talking to her and feeling at home and their bank, not being rude and uptight.

name: David
review: My wife and myself have had a Premium checking account with U.S. Bank since 2007. This came as part of a package because we have our home mortgage with them. As part of that deal they give you the premium package for free if you open a checking account with direct deposit. This includes foreign ATM reversal fees, no fees for services that if I did not have a mortgage with them I would otherwise have to pay, and free checks. The most serious issues I have faced with this checking account was that there was a period of time that we did not renew our premium package and we started getting charged for services. I did not know that I had to renew anything, I thought as long as I had the mortgage that this would occur automatically. We called the bank and they reversed the fees and immediately rectified the situation. This is the only issue I had with them which I can say is not too bad. I have had other banks that will refuse to reimburse a fee at all. U.S. Bank is a great bank. Thanks for reading my review and I hope you have a good week.

name: Melissa Goodnight
review: I just called US Bank yesterday with an urgent problem with my account. The woman who I first spoke with was very nice and I felt like she really wanted to help resolve my problem. She couldn't so she gave me the number to call where they could help. My problem is complicated and I ended up having to go to a branch, but both numbers were nice, english-speaking people who were easy to understand and genuinely wanted to help me find the answers I was looking for. Thanks!

name: Peter Baldes
review: I have been a US Bank Checking Account customer for many years. I believe US Bank has the best checking account out of all of the big banks. Their fees are lower per month than other banks, and one can avoid the fees if you also have a US Bank credit card along with the checking & savings combo. Yes, they still have overdraft fees, hence the 4 star rating. However, if you are going to have a checking account, then you need to have enough there to cover your expenses.

name: Lissa Braverman
review: I love this card!  I get about $15-20 back every quarter plus so many more fuel points.  The big bonus, is when you  sign up you get an extra 25 cents off everytime you use your card at the kroger pump for the first 3 months.  After that, you always still get an additional 5 cents.  PLUS, the send you great coupons for the things that you normally would buy anyway.

name: Becky Allenbaugh
review: My Husband and I have had this card for about 2 years now. Our bank offered it to us and at first we were young and dumb and over spent but we had 0% interest rate so it was easier to pay off. We recently just got done paying it off again. Our interest rate on it was 8.99% which isn't horrible. We were first approved a spending allowance of $4,000, now we have$7,000 which is more than enough for us. This card is a great card whether you are 18 or 80.

name: Brody Kenny
review: My experience with this card has been quite solid thus far. I have been able to manage my credit sensibly and the interest rates are generally manageable.

name: Crystal Bergeron
review: U.S. Bank has by far the best customer service I have ever come across in the banking industry. The account was easy to set up, the customer service from the officer, tellers, and even the bank managers has been over the top. They have gone above and beyond to be helpful and fair.  A situation occurred not long ago where my account overdrew due to a deposit issue that was no fault of theirs.  They not only covered every transaction for me but they waived all fees and charged me nothing. An error like this could have cost me around 300 dollars at another bank but U.S. Bank understood that things happen. The only issue I have even remotely had was my debit card being lost in the mail, which U.S. Bank quickly canceled, replaced free of charge, upgraded to a customized design and sent it over night. I recommend them for anyone who has personalized banking needs or travels and needs access to their bank, they are open almost every day of the week and beyond standard "banking hours".

name: Liz Vold
review: Overall US bank has been good to me over the years and I don't have much to complain about, but I can also say they don't have the best customer service of all my banks. They are about an average bank in my mind. There is nothing that really separates them from the others. I also hate that they charge to deposit checks via picture and to transfer money to other us bank customers but allow you to mail checks to people for free. Some of their policies make no sense and this part can be frustrating at times. Other than that when I have dealt with people the service has been good and in general I have nothing to complain about.

name: Sai Sam
review: I've had this card since I was 16. At first it was great, but they've slowly been cutting away at the Rewards program and find excuses to put minimum fees. Their minimum fee at $35 is one of the highest compared to all my other credit cards. If I weren't stuck with this card as my oldest line of revolving card, I would get rid of it. At the very least, I won't be using it any longer especially when I can be spending that money on something like my Amazon card which gives me lots of rewards. I definitely recommend NOT getting this card.

name: Brutus Smith
review: I really like the Harley-Davidson brand, so I'm happy to see that they have a secured credit card available on cardhub.com.  I was going to choose the Capital One Secured card, but Capital One's card does not have a REWARDS PROGRAM.  You get 1 point for every $1 spent that can be used for Harley's gift certificates or chrome cash.    I also appreciate that the Harley-Davidson card does not have an annual fee.  I don't think we should pay a yearly fee for a card unless it's interest free.  The only other major difference beteween the two cards is that Harley-Davidson has a 3% foreign transaction fee and Capital one does not.  I really like traveling, so that might be the deal breaker for me unless I plan to buy a lot of stuff from the Harley-Davidson store soon.  They are two really great cards, but since I have the option of choosing a lessor deposit amount with the Capital One Card, I guess it's superior.

name: Hunter Phillips
review: If I could give this card a negative rating I would. I signed up for this card when I bought $8,000 worth of products in December 2013. I figured at 0% interest for 6 months and a bit of cash back it would be a good deal...boy was I mistaken. I work out of state, so signed up for electronic billing. Never got an email about my first payment being late, couldn't access my account without my card number, which I couldn't get since that was in my mail at the house. Long story short, I've paid the card off in 4 months, but not after being charged 3 months worth of late fees over a silly $30 minimum payment on a $8,000 purchase...even after explaining what the issue was, I was simply told there was nothing they could do. They also dinged my credit score with a 30 day late payment, and they tell me they are sorry and cannot remove it, which dropped my credit score 24 points. I've cancelled my card, and will not being doing business with U.S. bank ever again. I'll stick with USAA from now on, and the rewards programs can be damned. Not worth the headache. Really, really unhappy about this whole situation.

name: Thomas Hawkins
review: I had a dispute with a charge where a company took out more money then they were supposed to take.   This left me unable to pay a bill that month.  US bank quickly took care of it and reversed the charges.  I have never been happier with a bank.  US bank is so much better than TCF that it's unreal.  They have an awesome webpage where it's very easy and quick to find the information you need.

name: Holly Johnson
review: The Kroger 1-2-3 Rewards Credit Card offers some good benefits such as no annual fee and points for every dollar you spend depending on what you get. Unfortunately the rewards are low as you must get 1000 points to save $5 and there isn't a bonus.

name: Michael
review: I have been using this account as my basic day to day savings account, and it is pretty standard.  There are no outstanding features, though the ease and immediacy of transfers between accounts through the online portal and/or the phone app are nice.  I "match" myself in savings to my dining out expenses, so it is nice when I cash out at a restaurant or bar to be able to quickly pull up my phone and push some money over to savings.

name: Sharon Poole
review: I've been a customer of U.S. Bank for over ten years, and they've always provided great service.  I have a checking account, and savings account, and several credit cards through U.S. Bank and I've never had a problem with any of these services.  Their customer service is outstanding, and these wide varieties of options like the savings, checking, and credit card accounts make it easy to take care of all my financial needs in one convenient place.

name: Johnny Zimmerman
review: Horrible card, rewards points expire quickly so they never really accumulate unless you spend literally thousands of dollars a month, constantly taking unspecified $2-4 fees !!! Customer service is literally the worst I've ever dealt with, phone people are rude and not at all helpful, and while King Soopers can sell them it doesn't provide any actual in store customer service if there are problems even though they're name is on it, and it's purchased at their store.

name: Fang Tracy
review: Not much rewards or just few Kroger brand items apply to the coupons after 1000 dollars purchase, but a lots of fees. If you don't pay it off (even 50 cents balance), you could get 2 dollars minimum interest plus other fees every month, which could end up a huge cost at the end of year if you don't keep tracking them. And the customer service sucks.

name: Will Jones
review: Card really sucks. Customer service is terrible.  They can never answer any questions. They are rude. I can't believe Krogers put their name on the card.  Don't get this card . Get the! Walmart card

name: Sara Weiler
review: I am with u! Same experience!!

name: AMANDA
review: US Bank is the only bank I have ever used for my checking account.  A while ago when they began charging the $6.95 monthly fee, I was tempted to switch but since we have direct deposits over $1,000 the fee is waived.  A few times we have had to contact the fraud department and everything was taken care of and we were not responsible for any of the charges.  When I went on vacation they put a hold on my debit card so I was unable to use it until I called and verified that it was actually me who was trying to make purchases.  I was frustrated at first but was grateful that they do that to ensure that my debit card information isn't stolen.  Overall it is a basic checking account with few perks, but I don't have to pay a fee and they take care of me every time I have an issue.  Years ago when we had a couple overdraft fees, they were nice enough to waive them.

name: Jami Brawley
review: I love the US Bank Cash+ Visa Signature Credit Card! What I like most is that it lets me pick my categories that I earn 5% and 2% cash back on, plus I earn 1% cash back on everything else. I get to pick from a set list which has tons of useful things to pick from such as restaurants, furniture stores, and even my phone bill. I like to save my rewards to get my cash back and use it for vacations. It is from my own bank so I can trust it and can deposit my rewards straight into my checking account. Overall, it is my favorite credit card I've ever used.

name: Alexander Jackson
review: We have been with US Bank for over a year now.  They have been very friendly and very helpful.  They were helpful when we bought our house, when we bought our truck.  We originally had the silver package, which is a great checking account if you have the money.  Unfortunately we were not able to keep the silver account and they were very helpful in switching us to a fee free account.  They have quickly resolved any problems that we have had.  I would definitely recommend them.

name: Dashaun McManus
review: Kroger 1-2-3 Rewards credit card 3 cards in one well that is a good deal.  Ever one thousand points gets you $5 bucks in free groceries and the regular rate is 13.99% - 23.99% (V) all great features. The bad features are the 24 day grace period is a way too short people need at least 30 days and I do not like being excluded from fuel centers. When I compare this card to another card I use all the time I have gas fill up benefits and I am always at the pump I wish the Kroger 1-2-3 rewards card had that as a feature but it does not.

name: J T
review: I absolutely love my US Bank Platinum Visa. It's my do everything, go everywhere card that's with me for everyday purchases and for emergencies. The intro 0% on purchases and balance transfers for 15 months is one of the best deals out there and the APR is reasonable too. To top it off their online account management is one of the best around. I've had my card for a few years now and have never had an issue.

name: Doug Ittner
review: Despite claiming to be a Christian corporation, Hobby Lobby still charges usury payments on debts associated with their credit card.  Don't trust Hobby Lobby.

name: Emily Cole
review: Hobby Lobby doesn't claim to be a Christian corporation. It's a non-religious company run by religious people. There is no religious affiliation to HL, nor its credit card (which is not managed by HL).

name: Nimmi quadar
review: I was a customer of US Bank when i was in Idaho. It was the first bank i had a account in, in US. They were so helpful and made my life easier. Their customer service was excellent. They even gave me a box of free checks for opening an account with them and helped me with setting up the direct deposit. I would like to end my review by saying, since i moved to California, i do miss banking with US Bank.

name: Chris Le
review: I like US Bank a lot, overall. Every time I go into a branch, the tellers are extremely friendly, which shows great training and management. When I applied for a checking account, the process was a little bit rocky, I'll admit. I received my check card in the mail but it took several more days to receive the PIN to activate it, which was very inconvenient. When I tried to resolve this matter over the phone, it took an hour or so of wrangling to prove my identity, etc. Not too pleased with that, as I'm a busy person. Overall, though they did resolve it and apologized for the inconvenience. I wanted to take out the maximum amount for withdrawal one time as well and all of the written material says "daily maximum" so I assumed the counter would reset at midnight. It actually is a 24 hour maximum, so I had to wait until 11pm the next night in order to take out cash again. Also, very inconvenient and not so clear.

name: Ricky Gonzalez
review: It took me a week to link my vip card to this new credit card. If you ask for help at the store they will tell you to call 123 rewards card. If you call 123 rewards card they will tell you to walk into any frys supermarket. Its a joke I had to go 3 times to try to link these cards together and when I finally did then they mentioned that it does not apply to any purchases online and in order to receive points vendors must also scan your 123 rewards card just like you do at the supermarket. I now have a balance of over $400 dollar and have not received any points since I scanned my vip card instead of 123 visa and I made purchases online. I also put gas twice and did not receive my 25cents rewards. Feels like a scam I will call to cancel this card. I recommend you stay with the 2% on all purchases credit card this one is just not what they make it to be.

name: Mary Jo Oyen
review: This credit card company does not honor the bonus points offered after first use. I definitely do NOT recommend this credit card company. Club Carlson itself is a good, reputable organization.

name: Cecil rich
review: I have been to the bank for getting car loan. they had a systematic way of dealing people. And when i had a query on repayment options they helped me getting sorted out and followed up as and when needed. I want all other banks to follow such a practice rather than making people wander for a small piece of information.Great job.

name: Jerry Berg
review: This is a good card, the application process was pretty straight forward, and I received my card a couple weeks later. No annual fee is always a good thing in my book. The rewards program is extremely handy, as I gas up for work everyday. 2% cash back on gas adds up pretty quickly. If your a handyman, or just visit ACE on occasion, you get 5% back. I try to pay my cards off every month, and they offer a grace period before interest accrues, so that makes this a stellar card in my opinion.

name: Alan Brommelhorst
review: I've had the US Bank Premium Checking for about 4 years now, and I have absolutely no complaints. I really enjoy US Bank's customer service, and it is the first bank that I have been with where I love going inside instead of online banking. Now don't get me wrong, their online banking is spectacular. I just have never been with a bank that the employees remember my name each time I come in. I would highly recommend this account to anyone!

name: Bianca Hernandez
review: This is a card only for people with good credit. It's also only for people who shop regularly at Kroger stores. You can quickly earn points by buying the Kroger brand products (3 points per $1). You get 2 points for every dollar spent in their store or in Kroger Family stores. The best reward of this card is the ability to earn free groceries. This reward system is ONLY applicable at Kroger or its family stores. It's a Visa, so you can use it anywhere that Visa is accepted, but you will only earn 1 point for every $1 spent. If you don't shop at Kroger frequently, you can benefit much more from almost any other credit card with a rewards program.

name: Jacob Gilsdorf
review: I have had a great experience with US Bank over all. Everytime i go into my bank, they great me by name and welcome me to there location. Getting cash and making deposits is never a problem for me, and the application process is a breeze. There is a 6 dollar monthly fee, but the bankers do there best to get that lowered or removed for you. All in all 5/5 stars.

name: Keith
review: This was the second checking account account I opened in college for after leaving Wells Fargo. I have been very pleased with US Bank. One of the nice things about  the account is that they allowed me to set up a reserve line. If I ever have an overdrawn account, the reserve transfers money into my checking and I avoid all overdraft fees. I had one issue with unauthorized charges to my checking account. US Bank did a great job of resolving this issue. They immediately stopped charges to my account and contacted me. While speaking to them on the phone, they removed the unauthorized charges and sent me a new debit card. I did not have any disruptions with my regular payments through that account and the whole issue was resolved with a 5 minute phone call.

name: Alison Miller
review: I signed up for US Bank during my freshman orientation and have loved it ever since. I don’t really have anything to complain about except the costly overdraft fees. I accidentally overdrew on my account without realizing it and instead of pulling money from my savings account they charged me a fee of $25 every three days instead of seven. Like I said this is a great bank and that’s really the only issue I’ve had with them. It's nice because you don't have any monthly checking fees like most other accounts have.

name: JM Swiger
review: My first checking account, ever. I had signed up for it directly before I had went off to college; in fact, the banker was there during open house at the university, ready to sign me up and all. I've had it for four years now, and I couldn't ask for a better, easier, less hassling banking service. Everything is usually to the point and I haven't had to pay any extra fees, nor have I had to deal with the service in any way that would not be ideal. There are certain limits to using this account, but they don't hinder my needs in any way whatsoever.

name: Aaron Boczkiewicz
review: The US Bank Cash+ Visa Signature Credit Card is phenomenal!!!  My wife and I have had this card for about a year and we absolutely love it.  The interest rates are very good, there is no annual fee, and you don't have a rewards limit to what you can earn.  Having the ability to earn 1% on everything, 2% on gas, groceries, or drug stores, and 5% back on restaurants or department stores.  The greatest thing I love about this card is that if you have a US Bank checking or savings account, you can make payments that immediately increase your available funds, which makes using it for stuff you would be purchasing with a debit card a perfect substitution.  I wouldn't use anything else!

name: Juke
review: Aaronluckside, Do you mean that each time you pay off the credit card balance using a US bank account immediately offers you a higher credit line for the credit card? Could you please explain?

name: Rebecca Hampton
review: Signing up for this savings account was very, very simple. I just went into the bank and asked for one. They were very helpful to me even though I am young and probably silly to them. The interest rate is very low, but the account is free so I'm not complaining. The best part of this account is that I can easily transfer between it and my checking, even using a mobile app. Also, there is no minimum deposit or anything like that. This is by far the simplest, easiest way to have a savings account, in my opinion.

name: Louie Sorenson
review: This was my first real checking account when I went off to college. Being that I just moved into a new state, the bank officer worked with me to help get my account set up. I developed a pretty good relationship with one of the tellers, and he would always help me out if I got in a jam. They fees aren't too bad, but fees only happen if you make them do. The online banking was good for the time period, have not been to the site recently. Overall, I was pretty satisfied with them.

name: Matt Wells
review: I opened a student checking account when I was 16 and it served me well. I still use it to this day. I think I will close it sometime though as I am moving across the country and want a local bank. The student checking account is great for high school and college students. Beyond that, it seems pretty run of the mill.

name: Aaron
review: I am very pleased with the U.S. Bank Easy Checking account.  My wife and I have had ours for about a year now and haven't had a single problem with it.  Even though it shows a monthly fee of $6.95, and there has been months where we have had less than $1500 in it, they have waived the monthly maintenance fee for us.  They also waived our first overdraft fee we had on the account.  We are extremely happy with that because any money is good money, right?  The one complaint that I do have is you can only move money in-between accounts 5 times a month, and if you have automatic transfers set up each month those count towards the 5 times.  Overall I would rate as a 4 out of 5.

name: Travis Herrick
review: This card looks like a pretty good deal; the fact that they do not increase your APR for having a late fee is honestly quite awesome.  In general, this card is very forgiving of late payments, although the cash advance fee is quite high, to the point of being unacceptable and useless.  At least there is a 9 month 0% apr, but there also isn't any bonus for signing up, which is rather unexciting.

name: Tony Schmitt
review: For those individuals who have a Kroger store nearby and who shop there often, this is a good card to consider. The 0% introductory APR on purchases and balance transfers is always a nice perk. The gasoline benefit and the shopping points are also useful, but again only if you use Kroger regularly. I think that would be the primary consideration: If you always shop there, then this is a good card to use, but if not, then I would see no reason to apply for it.

name: Alexandra Slone
review: I've had this card for almost four years. I started out with a $300 credit limit, which apparently is a common amount for students. I have never applied to increase my credit limit because honestly, I just don't have a need to. I've never made a late payment, paid the minimum payment, or used over 60% of my credit. Due to this, my credit score has gone up. I had a few problems with customer service when I changed my name and tried to get that reflected on my account, but to me, that's understandable. Besides that, their customer service department has always been more than helpful. Also, I've never been charged any fees (particularly because besides a late fee, they don't exist), which I absolutely love. Fees are the exact reason that I haven't applied for other credit cards. I really love their online pay function, too. I've set mine up with autopay and it's extremely convenient! Overall, I'd highly recommend this card for students. If you're looking for rewards, though, this obviously isn't for you.

name: Elizabeth John
review: This card ruined my life . My credit was perfect and then after losing my job because I got pregnant I couldn't pay the payments . The interest accumulated and it's past the limit. I have tried paying payments here and there when I can and I was told they could make me a payment plan that I could actually afford and then told me no they can't. Well why did you tell me that? I am so furious I would like to advise anyone and everyone to avoid this stupid card because if you can't make a payment they'll just pile on the interest and penalties . Ugh big mistake with this one!

name: Renee Niemann
review: I think the .25 off/gallon for the first three months is enticing, but honestly, after the 0% 9 month introductory period is over, the only real perk to this card is the inflated point value to earn free grocery rewards. While that is a perk of the Kroger 1-2-3 Rewards Credit Card, I can think of other cards, like AMEX's Blue that offer better rewards with much lower interest rates.

name: Amity Quinn
review: I love U.S. Bank. I switched from First Federal in 2010 because of location, and have no regrets. There is always a U.S. Bank within the vicinity, and they have a 24 Hour Customer Service Hotline. Even the U.S. Bank located in the grocery by my house is open until 7 p.m. some nights! All of the employees at my home location know me by name, and are always looking out for my finances and making suggestions to better my credit. They have removed late fees and monthly "maintenance charges" for me. The only thing I do not like is that they require a monthly $25.00 transfer into my savings account, but not not penalize for insufficient funds, so it really is a minor inconvenience. Keep up the good work!

name: James
review: I have had a few problems with my Direct Deposit recently to where they were being held for up to 16 days. I went in and talked to one of the ladies and they had it sorted within 10 minutes. Always very pleasant and nice in my branch; and always very fast, in and out in not time. Would recommend to my family and friends.

name: Liz
review: I started an account with US Bank because it was near my home and there was a branch on campus where I was going to school. I have now had my account for 5 years and many headaches. A lot of their disclosures and information on programs is not very clear but when you speak to a representative they make you feel like a fool for not understanding. I have had a couple issues with overdrafts but instead of trying to help you they push you to apply for massive lines of credit even when you say you don't want it they continue to push. The other problem is any time there is a charge that is messed up or an overdraft or anything similar you have to contact the bank you started your account at no other bank can help you which can be a real problem when in different time zones.

name: Kaylee Ganser
review: I really like my US Bank Visa credit card, because it's easy to use and a generally good all-purpose credit card. I've had my card for about 3 years now, and I've never experienced problems with it.  The one down-side to the card is that it does not offer cash back on anything.  However, that's not a huge detriment to the card. My favorite feature about the card is that paying online is very simple if you already have a US Bank Checking or Savings account.

name: Abby Kim
review: The 25 cents/gallon discount for gas is nice, but I'd rather see a long term discount program for the gas purchases, even if it is a smaller discount. A Pavillions rewards card (sorry, not a credit card) I had once offered 3 cents/gallon discount at all times, and at every X points (can't remember exactly how many, but it worked out to be about every 10 tanks), that purchase would get 10 cents/gallon discount. This is sadly no longer offered.My BofA credit card offers a 1% cash back on all purchases, sometimes extra on gas.

name: mark johnson
review: I opened a checking account with US Bank as a freshman in college. Thinking that this bank would help me be on my way to great savings, I opened up a savings account too. Boy, was I in for a surprise. Not only does US Bank charge you a 6.95 monthly maintenance fee just for having a checking account! If you over draft this checking account, even if you have money available in your savings, US Bank will charge you a 12.00 overdraft fee. And, to make things even better, if you overdraft your account, have money in your savings, but it is an overdraft of over 5.00 and you are unaware of it for more than a week, US Bank will charge you $30! I think US Bank has collected more money from my checking account than I have been able to put in it.

name: Emily Rhoads
review: I have had a really good experience with U.S. Bank checking for the nearly 7 years I have been with them. I got the account at first because when I moved away for college, I needed a bank account other than my local hometown one. I was wary of getting in with a big bank, but I have had no trouble getting the hometown service I'm used to from U.S. Bank. I really enjoy their online banking and feel secure that they are keeping my information private. I like the amount of information you have to give before you can access the online account. The service I get from the tellers is great. I have had an occasional issue and they have always resolved it promptly.I only have two minor complaints - I get a new debit card far more often than I should for reasons that are never fully explained (I'm assuming some sort of breach of my account?) and that is irritating to be replacing it constantly. Also, when I was VERY young, my account was overdrafted and I was essentially made to get a credit card with them as overdraft protection. I was responsible with it, but this could have been a debt trap for many young people. Neither of these things will draw me away from U.S. Bank because I really have enjoyed the service over the years!

name: Hannah
review: I started an account with US Bank because my primary bank was not located in my city and I would have to drive to get to a bank. However, after using US Bank for about a year I went back to my other bank because my US Bank account was a pain. I mostly do all of my banking online, but their system is often down. Even when the site is up it is a pain to use.  It is difficult to navigate and confusing. When I went to transfer money between my accounts I could not figure out how, and still do not know how. I went back to my original bank and am much happier for it.

name: Jim Erekson
review: The additional 25 cents off at the gas pump for the first three months was the draw for this offer. We already redeem our grocery points at the King Sooper gas station for 10 cents off per hundred points. This means with gas at 3.50 per gallon, we may be able to get a fill-up down to 2.95/gal. After the three months is up, I'll probably switch again!

name: quintana
review: I am currently banking with U.S. Bank and I absolutely love them. I am never worried about hidden fees appearing on my account. I like that there are locations every where, so I am never really to far from accessing my money when I need it. Every time I visit a branch I am always greeted and treated very well. I don't see myself banking with any other bank other than U.S. Bank because I am a very happy customer.

name: Brandy Jankowski
review: I have had nothing but great experiences with US Bank. The one that stands out the most was recently when I went in to cash my paper US Savings Bonds. The gentleman who helped me was extremely kind and quick on his feet. For a task I was sure I would be in there for at least 15 minutes, I was out in 7. I have always been impressed with US Bank and will continue to do all of my banking with them, no matter what band wagon everyone else seems to be hopping onto.

name: Stephanie
review: US bank is a reliable, wonderful bank. I have almost never had any problems with them except a few rude employees, but I do not think it is fair to judge the company overall over a few moody people! Most of the employees are wonderful anyway! The application process was a tad bit long but only because they were very thorough in making sure I really understood what they were explaining to me. transactions and withdraws are easy, and fast. I trust US bank with my money.

name: jacob schwartz
review: I use U.S. Bank for my mortgage and have been 100% satisfied with their services.  It is very easy to submit my payments each month through the customer portal, and the rates are exceptional.  I would highly recommend U.S. Bank to friends and family who are looking for a trustworthy mortgage lender.  Very satisfied!

name: jacob schwartz
review: I've used US Bank Premium Checking for the past 7 years, and overall have had nothing but exceptional experiences.  There was one occasion where I had fraudulent charges to my account, and US Bank was very quick to redact the charges and reimburse me for the money taken from my account.  This is a very hassle free checking account, and perfect for everyday use.

name: Jack Yasger
review: I have had my US bank account for almost a year now. I am very satisfied with the account to this point. I have had no issues with US Bank. I had an issue where I lost my Debit card and there was an unknown charge on my account, and it was cleared up right away. They reversed the questionable charge and I had my new card within 2 days. I usually go inside the branch to deposit my checks and the staff is always friendly. My only complaint with US Bank is that the ATM locations are spread out and it is not always convenient to find an ATM to take money out.

name: Tanner French
review: I think that there is definitely a limited number of things you can do with this account, however that is why it is a student account and you are restricted to most things.  The main benefit I saw at most banks was that they would pay for my money order or cashier check fee of five dollars. The downfall was that I had to pay $2.00 for every deposited check as well. There were a lot of long lines at every bank in Portland, OR so I even contemplated of switching until I really started to use my iPhone for mobile banking, which was great.

name: Jed Fadely
review: At the time of the event I will describe I was working two jobs through two different companies. All of my pay came through my US bank checking account. After receiving my pay check from work I went to cash this check and specified deposit as cash. The receipt showed this and the note from the teller on the account for the transaction likewise reflected this. However after the deposit I went around town paying bills and getting groceries, upon arriving home I checked my online banking to find myself well over $300.00 overdrawn.Given the time of day I was forced to deal with this the next day. I had to spend three whole hours trying to get this situation resolved, even though I was able to show them the receipt and they were able to show me the note in the account for the transaction. The issue was apparently they could not reverse all of the overdraft fees or even positively credit my account due to their systems.After all was said and done my wife and I were able to get things solved but it left us with a very bad taste in our mouth. We closed the account a few months later and never looked back.

name: Diane
review: I have had a savings account with US Bank for two years.  I have this account linked to my checking account in the event I accidentally overdraw that account.  This feature has proven invaluable to me.  I appreciate that the bank took the time to explain to me how this worked and how it could save me money!

name: Diane
review: I've been a US Bank customer for two years.  I had an unauthorized transaction on my account a few weeks ago.  Customer service stepped in to help put a stop pay on the merchant but still charged me $35 for doing so.  The agent was cheerful and just following the rules, but I felt like I should not have had the charge against me.  They were however able to initiate the stop pay immediately instead of the normally required three days. This saved me several hundred dollars in funds that could have been held up indefinitely while I worked to resolve the issue.

name: Cheryl Rillo
review: I have had a US Bank card ever since I opened up a bank account and had my first job when I was 18 years old. I absolutely love US Bank and how helpful the company has been, but I have had a couple instances where everything is not handled in a proper manner. For instance, I got married almost 3 years ago. I have changed my name, but they still put everything in my maiden name. If I go to my main profile, I have changed everything to my married name, but for some reason, US Bank is holding on to my maiden name. I love the different credit cards they offer, and I would highly recommend this bank. The one thing that US Bank struggles with is that they need to make sure they have all their information up to date.

name: Cheryl Rillo
review: The rewards program with gas points is extremely helpful! I absolutely love it! I don't travel very often. In fact, I only fill up on gas maybe once every two weeks. The points add up. Even if it takes a couple months or a year to get there, it is still better than nothing. I love this card and everything it has to offer!My husband and I love to travel and drive all over the place. This card has been helpful in that matter being that we have family that live all over the place. We travel to Chicago, Florida, North Carolina, different areas in Ohio. We are drive-aholics. This card really fits our needs when it comes to traveling all over the country. If anyone has any questions on the card, feel free to respond to my post.

name: Erin Armknecht
review: I have been a US Bank customer for 7 1/2 years now, and overall, I have been quite pleased. Our checking account is free of hefty fees, aside from (understandable) overdraft fees should those incur. Both the website and iPhone app are user-friendly, which is one of the most important factors for me. I have no trouble monitoring my accounts easily from my phone.Customer service has almost always been excellent; we had an issue with an incredibly rude teller at one branch, but once we spoke to her manager, the issue was resolved. Everyone from tellers to branch managers to phone support has otherwise been friendly and helpful. Even when my husband's students collected more than $400 in pennies and we used the bank's coin machine to process and count them, the wonderful tellers had a great sense of humor and were really helpful. I'm certainly not one of the most important customers--my account balance is usually modest, but I'm always treated well.

name: Rbl SmartAzz
review: Hello Hub, I have been banking with US Bank for about three months now and thus far it has been pretty smooth.  There are some pros and cons though.  When I opened my account I had a block on my debit card and had to make counter withdrawals.  Even though I had money in my savings as an added precaution, the branch in which I opened my account places a 60 day hold on the account or a hold until the first direct deposit hits.  This was not something that was disclosed in my agreement at the time of opening so please be sure to check at your local branch.  Other than that the only other issues I have is with the app.  To deposit a check via the app it charges $0.50 per check.  This may not be much but other banks do not charge this fee. Every problem or question I have ever had has been resolved promptly and accurately.  I now hold a savings and checking account with this bank.  There are also perks.  Once you reach $1000 in savings you earn a $50 reward and once you save $1000 for a year you get another $50.  It may seem small but hey it's an extra 50.

name: Alexandria Kinsey
review: I have had this card for about 7 or 8 years now. While I was not excited about the APR rate, I have always been able to keep up with my payments. What I most appreciate about this card (aside from the Gymboree gift cards that I save up for Christmas time) are the regular convenience checks I get in the mail. I have turned to them when I have been in a tight spot a number of times and they have been incredibly helpful, especially if you can pay them off early.

name: Charles Baker
review: I got an account with US Bank about 10 years ago. It's pretty much what you could expect from a checking account, but they stand out in a few ways (at least in my branch). Firstly, when I needed to cash a cashier's check, they offered to call the other institution so it was processed right then and there, rather than wait 3 days. Tellers have always been nice.They also have very nice people working the phones at the call centers. They were unable to do some rather important things for me over the weekend, but they seem to know what they are doing and were very nice about it. Also if you get a credit card through them, their online banking makes it very easy to pay it off quickly.

name: Charles Casey
review: I signed up for a checking account with US Bank back on December 2012. I had heard horror stories about BofA so decided to try US Bank. I’m glad I did! My branch is in a small town, and the people working there are local. A nice representative spent as much time as I needed to set up the account. I also obtained an atm/debit card. Since then, I’ve made use of the debit card, which works just fine. Whenever I make a deposit, the staff smiles, knows me by name, and we chat. I couldn’t ask for a better bank. Even in bigger cities, I still get the same great service. No complaints!

name: Danielle Gallagher
review: This card has a good rewards program and is very convenient. I've saved quite a bit of money on groceries since receiving my card! The 9 month, 0% introductory rate is another added bonus. There is no annual fee, which seems common with many of the other rewards cards. I have never had any problems with the service, and don't foresee any problems in the future. I highly recommend it to anyone who buys Kroger products or frequents any of the Kroger family of stores. It can really make a difference by the end of the year.

name: Steve Thompson
review: I have had an account with U.S. Bank for over 15 years and I have always been pleased with their service.  I don't recall ever having any major issues with my account and their customer service has always been very friendly.  Since opening up my original checking account, I have opened up several other accounts with them for savings, lines of credit and loans.  They are easy to work with and when closing on any loans the loan officer is always very thorough with covering the terms of the loan.

name: Dave Smith
review: I have used the REI Visa since late 2011. It has been a pretty great card that I use for all REI purchases and some other purchases. 5% back at REI and 1% everywhere else is decent. Plus I got a $100 gift card to REI I for signing up! They also let me bump up my limit after two years.

name: Michelle Frisbee
review: I have been with US Bank for over ten years.  Pretty standard in terms of banking.  I have a basic account that was grandfathered in with no fees.  Tellers are always pleasant enough, although they don't recognize me on sight.  Occasionally, they do try to up sell me on a credit card with them, even though I already have one. Online banking is easy enough to pay bills, transfer between accounts, and generally keep tabs on your balances.

name: Anna Cross
review: The Kroger 1-2-3 Rewards Card is something that will be easy to use. It will be convenient if you are a regular shopper at Kroger's to get rewards without having to change any habits. This is a can't miss deal that would be great for a wide variety of people. I had other rewards cards in the past, but this one has way more deals.

name: Tatiana Joseph
review: I use this card all the time when ever I go shopping at Kroger and I think this card is nice to have in your purse or wallet, plus there is no annual fee you have to pay. So that is a good thing you don't have to pay a certain amount of money every month. And it goes by points, the more you have, the more you can save up and use them on other things you would like to have for yourself which I think is pretty awesome.

name: Alexander Jackson
review: I am generally pleased with my experience with this bank.  We have had our account there for almost a year now and have had no major issues with them.  The staff have all been very friendly and helpful.  Any issues we have had have been addressed and resolved quickly.  The only thing I don't like is that they will pay certain items even if it creates an overdraft.  To be fair this is true of all the large banks.  It is something I really dislike.  I am not talking about writing bad checks here - I am talking about when you have a company put through a payment you weren't expecting and the bank honors it.  Anyway - I have no complaints about U.S. Bank.

name: Jerm Bishop
review: I currently have and still use the Kroger rewards visa card. It was very easy to sign for at the time. I liked the fact that it had no annual fee, and I liked the points I earned as rewards. I got it at a rate of 15% which isn't too bad, but I'd prefer it to be lower. Other than that I don't have many complaints, it's been a very simple card without any hidden fees.

name: Joe Check
review: I have been a USBank customer for several years, in multiple states. They are convenient, friendly, and helpful. When I incurred an overdraft fee right at the beginning of the account (due to a boneheaded mistake--not realizing that my first deposit wouldn’t clear immediately), they waived it for me. My wife has since gotten business accounts and credit with them as well. I’m not generally a guy to patronize big multinational banks if I don’t have to, but I have been very pleased with USBank.

name: Marci Bushnell
review: I have a little experience with the Kroger 1-2-3 Rewards Visa Credit Card. For others it may prove to be a wonderful selection. But for me it was a nightmare. The rewards were hardly worth waiting for and customer service is impossible.

name: Fred
review: You won't go wrong with US Bank.  It's a bank account.  You won't get rich keeping your money in their savings accounts, but you shouldn't be investing using a savings account anyways.  There are higher rates of return elsewhere.  You should get an account with US Bank to keep your money FDIC insured and to take advantage of their free ATMs everywhere.  That's why I am still there.Over the past few years, they've slipped fees in my account secretly.  But once I see them on their solid online site, I call up and always get them removed.  It's a once a year hassle so that's why they get 4 stars instead of 5.Overall, their free ATMs and solid online baking outweighs their occasional secret fees.

name: Nicole Freedman
review: Over the holiday season, I accidentally overdrew my account. This is something I can imagine happens to a lot of people. I went into my bank and talked to one of the personal bankers who was very kind and helpful. She explained that because I had put money right back into the account that they would waive my overdraft fee. This bank has always been kind and courteous to me. The only complaint I have is that you have to pay for checking accounts.

name: John S Dunning
review: I like how the Kroger 1-2-3 rewards visa card has no annual fee and has a great points system. It will be good especially when you use it for shopping at Kroger's, since you will get money back. I also like the savings on fuel at Kroger's.

name: Amanda
review: I was with US Bank for about six years. When I first became a customer, US Bank had this awesome policy regarding waiting in line. If you ever spent five minutes or more waiting, they would credit your account five dollars. A few years after joining them, they began to refuse to honor this policy at some branches, even though they hadn't gotten rid of it. I began to consistently receive bad customer service and poor communication from them, and spent some time attempting to find a branch that had a staff I liked. The branch that finally inspired me to give up and close my account with them was one where I had an appointment to speak with a manager about some overdraft fees I'd incurred, and when I showed up for my scheduled appointment, was told the person I was meant to speak with was on vacation, and there was no one higher up than him. When I called customer service, my call was answered by someone reading from a book who clearly did not know English as their first language. Pretty bad experience all around.

name: Leslie
review: I have been a customer with this bank for over 12 years, and have had a free checking account with them. A few days ago while checking my account online I noticed they had added a fee onto my account. I went back through a few weeks and found they had added one for October and November, but had removed them. I called them to ask when this started, and was told that they sent notices with the June account information that a fee would be put on accounts that dropped below a certain amount. I was told I could rectify this by opening a credit card account with them. I was not willing to do this, and asked that they take off the charge as a one time courtesy, and I would be aware of it from now on. The operator had to get a manager to do it, but they did, which made me happy. Still, I am not pleased that they are going to start charging this fee for doing virtually nothing. I am now shopping around for a new bank.

name: Doug Miller
review: I got my first US Bank Checking account when I graduated from high school. My family used it to put my graduation gifts in. My parents wanted to do this so I could get a debit card and learn to be more responsible with my money, since up to that point I’d just cashed my paychecks. A few years ago, they added the monthly surcharge, and it was a bit expensive for the features that I got. I started using the account less and now mostly just use it as a savings account that I can make emergency purchases from if needed. I do this so my balance stays high enough to avoid the monthly fee. This works out because there aren’t many branches around me so I can’t go and take cash out as often forcing me to leave it alone.

name: Gary shaffer
review: I WANT a Harley Sportster. I needed another credit card that did not charge a yearly fee, yet, gave spending credits in the form of cash. Harley gives away a Harley EACH month to some lucky card holder ! I haven't won my Harley-YET..but I will ! In the mean time I pay off my balance to avoid the charges, while ringing up those cash credits for almost any kind of purchase I make with my Harley card. I highly recommend this card-especially if you want to win a Harley!

name: Lindsay Whitehead King
review: The Kroger 1-2-3 Rewards Credit Card looks like a pretty wellrounded card.  With no annual fee, and a points system for purchasesit would be a smart card to choose to get a little extra money backin your pocket.  Of course, you get the most rewards for shopping at Kroger, but that is no issue for me...I shop there anyway!  The intro rate of 0% for 9 months isalso a great way to make customers happy right away.

name: Katie Christianson
review: The bonus in points you get for signing up for the US Bank Flex Points card is awesome. Unfortunately, if you want to redeem the points for statement credit, the amount you get is ½ of what you would have gotten in travel rewards. Even with the ding, $200 extra bucks is very nice - $400 in travel would be better if I had the time to do it. Plus, they give you 4 months to spend the allotted amount, not 3 like other companies.

name: Brit
review: Being a college student who is going to school with academic loans I have to find every way I can to save on the food my roommates may eat while I am in class, LOL.  Seriously!  Since Kroger is where I do my grocery shopping anyway I may as well take advantage of their points system while I shop there.  Every little bit helps when you are just starting out and trying to keep your debts low for the future.  The Kroger 1-2-3 Rewards credit card has a relatively low interest rate for me and helps keep my expenses just that much lower.  Every little bit I save now helps.  Thanks for the card and points system, Kroger!  (Now if I can only keep my roommates from eating all of my ramen soup!  Is there a card for that somewhere?)

name: Amy Hagerty-Kuehl
review: I've had my US Bank Platinum Visa for over 10 years. I have 11.9 percent interest. I used to have a large limit, but due to a mistake on my part and not paying on it for a couple of months the limit dropped to $1000. They were actually very cool and didn't report it or raise my interest rate. Luckily my credit score wasn't affected. I was even able to get my husband added as a co-owner of the card. They said that they will raise the limit soon. I'm sure I could do it now, but we are trying to buy a house so I don't want any inquiries on my credit report right now. This card has been very useful and is accepted almost everywhere. I'm pretty sure I've had it longer than my husband:)

name: Lauren Abelow
review: This seems like a great credit card. I like that I get the most rewards just for going grocery shopping. And if I buy the Kroger brand products, which tend to be just as good for less money, I get 3x points on the dollar. The APR is very reasonable, and the late fee is a normal charge. Getting $5 back for groceries for every 1,000 points spent is awesome, but it does seem a little low (Amazon, for instant uses every point as $0.10, which would render this 1,000 points $10). But, $5 is better than $0, so there is that. Overall, I like to use my credit card points for something fun that I wouldn't otherwise get (plane tickets, a Kindle, etc) but for someone looking to save money in every day ways, this seems like the right card.

name: Kevin S
review: I really feel like the Kroger 123 Rewards card is good for people who do a lot of grocery shopping. By giving you the  3 - 1 rewards on Kroger items, and 2 - 1 rewards for buying in the Kroger Network (Its actually a pretty big group of stores... out here in CA I shop at Ralph's all the time) you can really maximize your money spent. The fact that they give you a $5.00 card for groceries for every 1,000 spent really solidifies this deal. Conversely I don't think that this card is one that you would want to use for other purchases, like for flights or dining out like the Citi Forward Card.  Overall I'm satisfied with the Kroger 123 Rewards card, it provides exactly the benefits someone who shops for a family needs!

name: Shawnie
review: I have been with U.S. Bank for about 9 years. I use this bank for my online checking account since there is no branch here in Detroit. In the beginning, I thought that I had made the wrong choice in choosing this bank as a secondary institution for my funds. There was an issue where my account was overdrawn due to my bills being set up to be automatically paid from this account. The fees were a little bit higher than other banks. One great thing about this bank is that I do feel secure about my information. I sent my ex-husband to the ATM to get some cash and he enters the wrong pin 3 times. My card immediately locks and I had to reset it over the phone (with the correct security question and answer) or get them to send a reminder in the mail, which took about a week. The customer service is very pleasant and patient when dealing with my issues and concerns. I believe as technology gotten better over the years, so has their banking.

name: Dennis Sanders
review: This is a great card. You earn points on all of your everyday purchases. With all these points I have been earning we plan to buy a brand new big screen television. How great is that to be able to buy a television for just paying all your bills.

name: Dennis Sanders
review: I am an existing US Bank home mortgage holder for the last 13 years. Due to the recent low interest rates I have decided to refinance my home and have contacted US Bank to get a quotation from them. The customer service people  have been professional in giving me a verbal estimate on refinancing quotes. The problem comes when I ask them to send me the information to my e-mail address. Despite promising 2 different times to e-mail me a quote, nothing has happened. It sounds like they send the request to their mortgage brokers who fail to act upon it. Considering I am an existing customer, have the highest credit score possible, and am trying to refinance a substantial mortgage you would think that they would react to earn the closing fees and retain me as a customer. Apparently not, so I am shopping it with other mortgage companies and giving US Bank a negative rating for such a simple customer service blunder.

name: Sean Hockin
review: The Kroger 123 Rewards card is an overall wonderful value for the customer. With the price of gas and food continuing to rise, it only makes sense to have a card that rewards you. It will help with the price of gas on an ongoing basis, but especially during the 3 month introductory period to get 25¢ off per gallon. It not only rewards  you in fuel savings, but also in grocery savings too. With the Kroger chain of stores spreading across the nation, your bound to find a store that can maximize your points, therefore maximizing your savings. I currently use the America First Visa card which gives you good benefits, but doesn't help with the cost of gas or groceries. Overall, great card.

name: Robyn Carney
review: I love US Bank. I find their customer service to be one of the best I have ever encountered. Any time I have any problems with my account, they are handled promptly and in a very friendly manner. I find the promptness with which they handle their customers very nice. Usually you wait forever in bank lines but with US Bank, its fast. I've never had to wait in line for more than 5 minutes. The branch near my home is very efficient when handling my banking needs and there are so many locations in my city. I have been a customer with US Bank for over 6 years and haven't looked to go to another bank. They have handled my bank loans, my checking account and also my child support in that time and no matter which state I lived in, Illinois or California, I found their customer service to be top notch.

name: Pee Swilly
review: I co-signed for a savings account for my cousin. He was under 18 and working at a grocery store that would only pay through direct deposit. So, I signed up with him for a savings account so he could simply withdraw his check every two weeks. All of the sudden, we get a statement and he's been charged hundreds in fees. We made it very clear to the clerk when signing up what we needed the account for. They never mentioned anything about how we could only have a certain number of withdrawals a month or we'd be charged hundreds of dollars. BEWARE BEWARE. We closed the account ASAP.

name: Jay Freiheit
review: With the high cost of food these days almost all of us are looking for a way to find some savings at the grocery store. The Kroger 123 Rewards card is a very attractive card for those who are fortunate to own it. You earn rewards points every time you use this card and accumulate them at faster rates if you use the card in the Kroger store (and at an even greater rate if you purchase Kroger brand products while there). This allows you to earn up to 3 points per dollar spent. At 1000 points you get $5 in free groceries. My wife and I usually spend from $50-$100  weekly the grocery store. Even if we didn't buy Kroger brand and only qualified for 2 points/dollar spent there, so that means we could accumulate up to 200 points a week at the store (on non-Kroger brand items alone). In 5 weeks we earn back $5, so over the course of a year that is about $50 saved by using this card. It's not amazing savings, but for a family that spends much more than us and used Kroger brand items these savings could be much greater. The rate is variable, so those with good credit scores will have it the best, so everyone must consider what is best for their own situation. Still, for a "store card" these rates are competitive. People with large families could save quite a bit of money with this card if they like to shop at Kroger. It's certainly worth it for them in my opinion.

name: Ana Benjamin
review: I have been a U.S. Bank customer for 5 years now and I have never had a problem with them. Their checking account is free, as long as you get a direct deposit for your paychecks. Their overdraft fees work just like most banks, but if you have your checking account linked to your savings account then it will just transfer the amount in their and you won't get charged with any fees. Their customer services is fantastic! I've had a couple of instances of fraud on my account and I was always immediately helped out. They freeze your current card, and send you a replacement one, and make sure that all the charges are put back into your account. The customer service reps are always friendly and courteous. I definitely recommend this bank!

name: Tyler Swope
review: I have been banking with US bank since I was sixteen years old. Setting up a checking account(from what I can remember) was very painless and went smoothly. In my early days, I did have some problems with overdraft fees, but that was my fault and should have looked at my account balance. Since then, I have not had any major problems with US bank. Whenever I lose my debit card, they are always quick and responsive to get me a new one. About two months ago, I got my first credit card with US Bank. The card gives a good rate, and signing up for it was hassle free. I have looked into auto loans from US bank and they seem like they would try and get me the best rate possible. The only complaint I have is sometimes the tellers can be in a bad mood, which rubs off onto the customers. Overall 4 out of 5.

name: Tyler Swope
review: I recently just signed up for the visa platinum card, and is the first card I have ever been issued.
