The rate given with the card is very good for a person just starting to build their credit. My first purchase made with the card was a Fender guitar that retailed around three hundred dollars. I have been making my payment every month and with online payments, it is very easy to get your balance paid. That reminds me, I need to pay my next payment by November 19th haha. Also, there is no annual fee for having the card, which as a customer makes me as delighted as can be.

name: John Lowlie
review: The Kroger 1-2-3 Rewards credit card is a decent card if you're an avid Kroger shopper already. It's a store card so it can have a high interest rate. Unlike most  store cards however the interest rate goes as low as 14 percent. My only other store card, a Khols card, has a set interest rate for everyone at 20 percent. Something else the Kroger card does that most don't is give you rewards for shopping with the card. Rewards points are common in a lot of regular credit cards but not in store cards so the extra savings was a nice surprise. Altogether this is a good card if you shop at Kroger and make sure you pay the monthly balance every time, it's just a little extra money.

name: Amy Hagerty-Kuehl
review: I have been a customer with U.S. Bank since 1997 or 1998. I always receive the utmost customer service and haven't been disappointed with them in all these years. I have 3 checking accounts and numerous savings accounts with them. There have been a few times where I was overdrawn by a couple of hours and they were kind enough to reverse the fees. They have actually reversed many fees for me when a few unusual circumstances happened to us. Their online banking is fantastic as well. They even have a new feature where you can scan your paycheck and it will be deposited or you can pay a person money via online. It just sends them an email and if confirmed correctly with their bank the money is instantly transferred. I don't ever see myself switching banks. They also don't seem to charge crazy and outlandish fees like many of the other major banks do. Very satisfied customer.

name: Camille Boyd
review: U.S. Bank is the best bank I have done business with.  I used to be a Bank of America customer but switched over when they started implementing needless fees.  I have had no problems at all with my account at U.S. Bank.  The locations are convenient and I always seem to find one nearby whenever I need to use one.  The ATMs are easy to use and super fast.  I feel safe using this bank and know that my money is in good hands.  A few of my friends use the same bank and have had no complaints.  We all agree this is a great bank!!!

name: turk812
review: US Bank has been a super institution to work with.  I primarily use them for all of my online transactions by using a checking account along with a debit card.  I have deposits made electronically into my account and then I can use my debit card to make purchases and in some cases I use the debit card to back up my paypal account, as well.  It works great.  I've never experienced one issue with them, and I've used them for well over five years now.  Also, it's important to note that I've never experienced any downtime with their website, which is where I log in to check all of my transaction history on my account.  It's never been down, it's never rejected my user name, and it's really easy to navigate.  I like US Bank for sure!

name: Jacoby Greene
review: I currently have a checking account, savings account, and credit card with US Bank. I haven't had any major problems with US Bank, and their customer service has been top notch each and every time I've used them. I originally applied for, and was approved for, the Harley Davidson Visa Credit Card, and immediately decided to open up a checking account. The checking account comes with a very useful cash advance feature, something I've never seen in any of my other checking accounts. Overall, US bank is one of best banks in the industry in my opinion. The fees are low to non-existent, and customer service is great.

name: Brandon
review: I have had a checking account, savings account, and credit card with US Bank for more than 5 years now.  Overall I feel that they have done a satisfactory job until recently.  Recently it has been very difficult interacting with customer service both in a branch and on the phone with their customer support.  I have not had a debit card for almost a month now after my last one expired despite calling several times and asking them to send me a new one and checking to ensure my contact info was correct.  This among several other trying interactions with them is why shorty I will be closing all my accounts and moving banks.  I am rating them at 3 stars because for years they did take good care of me and it seemed like their past performance should buy them something.

name: Danny Rodgers
review: The Kroger 1-2-3 Rewards card is a great value.  I thought this card was pretty amazing.  I mean seeing $0.25 of a gallon of gas in writing might not look like a lot, but it really does help quite a bit.  Especially when you fill up 2-3 time a week like myself.  If you do most of your shopping at Kroger, this card adds a huge advantage.  Getting the $5 in free groceries after 1000 points is something that would be easy to accomplish if you had a pretty good sized family.  Anyone that is a Kroger shopper, this card is a MUST!

name: Richard Thompson
review: The Kroger's 1-2-3 Rewards card seems like a good value at first. The various tiers of reward point accruals make it useful as a general use card, but grow in value the more you use it at a Kroger store and buy Kroger brand products. However, point redemption is only $5 per 1000 points accrued, meaning the maximum rewards you can see are $1.50 for every $100 spent, and that's if you use the card for nothing but Kroger products. If you buy fuel from a Kroger then the value of the card goes up, and the interest rates are reasonable, especially for a store card, and the 9 months of 0 interest are good. Overall a decent card if you use it almost exclusively at Kroger.

name: Cynthia Ravenshaw
review: I've been using this card about  a  month and I just love it. I get my fuel at Kroger, so I can take advantage of their fuel perks. Using this card to pay for food and fuel helps me to save even more. I regularly shop at Kroger stores and I love the additional points I get when shopping there anyway.  Particularly the points on Kroger brands. I often buy Kroger brands to save a bit extra (things like pasta sauce or soup, etc.). Earning grocery rewards is a terrific money saver. Kroger prices are very competitive anyway. This card helps you save even more. I highly recommend it!

name: Lily Yee
review: I got this card after I stopped using my citi student card. This card gets too stars from me since I had it over 3 years and never had a late payment. They won't increase my credit amount. When I open this card my credit limit is $300.Mind you, when I first opened this card I made like $5000 a year and now I make way more than that.  I still remember when this card was "dark blue" design. Like any student  card, this one has no annual fees or any real benefits. Every bank offers zero fraud liability, in fact I don't know a bank that don't. I feel that there grace period is a little short. Usually it is about 35 days. The only benefit is that I bank at US so I can pay my card off online immediately.

name: Rob Doe
review: If you are into home improvements or working on things similar to that as a hobby or something the Ace Rewards Credit Card is a major help because you are definitely visiting Ace stores frequently then, so why not take advantage of these great offers? With no annual fee it's basically free anyways. Getting 10% back on quarterly popular categories and 5% always on Ace purchases it'll be buying that new baby room for you. Not to mention the 2% back on gas and groceries which you're always going to be buying and 1% in Rewards everywhere else Visa is accepted which is EVERYWHERE. This thing is priceless. Even if you aren't into handiwork Ace has almost everything you could need for electronics accessories and many other things. It's a great store and this is a great card.

name: Kristin Maasch
review: The Kroger 1-2-3 Rewards Visa Card has a great deal where you save 25 cents a gallon for the first three months. With the price of gas, that in and of itself is a great deal. However, you have to purchase the gas at a Kroger Family of Stores Fuel center, which is a bit of a bummer, especially if you’re a road warrior and might not have a Kroger near you at the time. However, since this is a store specific type credit card the rewards seem to be better than your average Visa card. There are great point redemptions for buying at Kroger’s and those saving will really add up. This credit card also has a lower regular interest rate of your standard American Express card as well.

name: Laura
review: If you are a regular shopper at Kroger-owned stores, this credit card racks up points pretty quickly. I work at a Fred Meyer, so I spend a decent amount of money on Kroger products to start with. This card helps me get better rewards for products that I would be buying anyway. The cash advance rates and late fees are a little high, but if you're careful with your card and don't need cash advances, then there won't be any issue for you. I wouldn't recommend this card to anyone who doesn't shop at Kroger stores on a regular basis, because that's really the only reason to have such a card. But for this purpose, it offers pretty good rewards.

name: Lily Yee
review: This card is like a Safeway and Fred meyers but it is a credit card. You can get gas points and Safeway/Freddies and costco does the same. For me it is not that competitive.  I like to save money so I buy the kroger brand items a lot and it is great since I can get 3 points. To be honest some kroger brand things are subpar. 1 point for everything else is so common. It is not unique. I find that using a BOA rewards card gets me the same benefits. I moved a couple times so this card at times was useless. I mean it can be used at everywhere but I prefer to use it at kroger stores to get those benefits.

name: timothy bull
review: This is one of the best credit cards I have ever had. If you are a Kroger shopper then this is a card you should have for sure. For the first 3 months you have the card you get a 25 cent savings on gas at the Kroger fuel center. On top of that they have a points system where you get various points if you buy Kroger produce and you also accumulate points for every dollar spent anywhere you use the card. Every 1000 points you get $5 in free groceries. It may not seem like much but you accumulate points very quickly if you use the card frequently and you can easily accumulate enough points to get one to two weeks worth of groceries a year, and in this economy every little bit helps out.

name: Brandon Kendall
review: With most credit card companies, there's always a tactful art to dealing with customer service people. YOu have to ask the right questions so you don't get deceived by unscrupulous credit card companies. This was the exact opposite of my experience with the Kroger 1-2-3 card. The terms and conditions are very clear, and I use it to make all of my purchas at Kroger for those sweet, sweet rewards. Can not recommend it enough!

name: Jordan L.
review: I have been banking with US Bank's La Jolla, CA branch for nearly 15 years (they used to be under a different name).  The bank tellers are always friendly, helpful, and call me by my first name.  I did a home loan many years back and had a fairly positive experience, with a few hiccups.  But their service at the local branch for basic banking needs exceeds my expectations and remain loyal to their brand.

name: Jeremy Arotsky
review: If you're like me and don't have a Kroger near you, this card would be completely useless. That being said, this card offers decent perks for being a grocery store credit card. You probably shouldn't use this card outside of Kroger, the rewards become less worth it and it would seem like it would be better to have a regular gas card. You would also have to gas up at a Kroger gas station or none of it is worth it. These kinds of cards are decent at best, but you can probably find something better.

name: jose ortega
review: I have had checking, savings, line of credit and mortgage accounts with USBank in florida for the past 5 years; without concerns or problems.  However, since the banking reform act, the fees are escalating and the customer service is plummeting ~ at least it is in my corner of the world.  Even though USBank claims to record each customer service call, when challenged to review the recording to resolve a dispute, they informed me there was no recording ~ their mistake was never acknowledged or rectified on my account. I am in the process of refinancing my mortgage just to get it away from the bank.  I will continue to keep my savings, line of credit and secondary checking accounts with USBank, only because closing the line of credit would affect my credit score.  My primary checking accounts and any future dealings will now be conducted through a credit union.

name: Janice Krone
review: My U.S. Bank Student Checking Account has been great for me. I opened my account while I was in school and the customer service was amazing. Everyone was very helpful and explained all the details regarding the account. I use it as my primary account and I am able to pay bills electronically, which has been extremely convenient. I set up multiple payments that occur monthly, so even when I forget it's time to pay certain bills, US Bank automatically pays it for me. It also sends me email alerts letting me know when a payment has been sent, just in case I forget why money was taken out. I also lost my debit card once and it took them just a couple of days to get me a new one. I've been a customer for almost 10 years and will continue to be one.

name: Rebecca Howell
review: One of the things that I really like about this card is that I already shop at Krogers and feel 'close' to the store and my loyalty is being rewarded by them, especially if you consider the points system they use on the card. I also use the Kroger Plus card as well. I do use  Netspend Prepaid Card for online purchases and to protect myself from any online bank account thefts. The only thing I worry about with the kroger card is the theft issue. The prepaid card can only be used for so much and then that is that for the thief.

name: Jonathan Doebly
review: The Kroger 1-2-3 rewards is a decent card if you shop at Krogers. Compared to most store credit cards the point system is more than fair and the interest is rate is pretty good. My Khols card has a third more interest and the savings don't even compare. If you do most of your shopping at Krogers any way it is a great way to save some extra money, just make sure to pay it off at the end of the month and your fine. However compared to most point cards it's not the great and a bit limited. Most cards I've seen have a bit higher reward for every dollar spent and aren't limited to one shop.

name: Ben Matthews
review: The Kroger 1-2-3 Rewards Credit Card is a way to earn points that get redeemed for gift cards for money off your groceries.  Unfortunately it is not a good deal.  For Every $333 you spend in a Kroger store you get a $5 coupon towards your groceries.  If you do that math, that's only 1.5% back when you shop at a Kroger store.  While it's better than nothing and the 1% back most credit cards give, other cards give you a little less points and the option to cash out your points for more than just grocery store coupons.  I would avoid this card unless you really want that extra .25%. For example. if you spend $400 a month in groceries at Kroger a year, you'll lose out on $12 in rewards if you used the CapitalOne VentureOne card instead which gives you 1.25% back.  Not worth the hassle in my opinion.

name: Cory Bane
review: My experience with U.S.Bank has been rather pleasant. I only really use them for my primary checking account, but they make it very easy to manage. I especially like their online banking service. In about 4 clicks and a password you can view your account balance, pay bills, make transfers, and just about anything banking you can think of. I like this a lot because of the great convenience. If you utilize your online banking service with U.S. Bank, they also make it a breeze for you to link your bank account with PayPal, Ebay, and/or Amazon Payments.   The only problem I have had with U.S. Bank is their customer service. It is usually fairly good, but they aren't very efficient in returning my calls and/or emails when I have an issue that I need resolved. This is only my opinion though, I'm sure a lot of others have had great customer service experience with U.S. Bank. In my overall opinion though, it is a very good bank, I really like it!

name: Julianne Cordova
review: Kroger 1-2-3 Rewards Credit Card has some major advantages if that is the grocery store of your choice. You benefit as you shop for things you would already be purchasing. For each point you earn 1 point/ $1 with a max of 3 points/$1 with no earning or redeeming limit.For new card members you can cash in on even more saving during the first 3 months with the additional savings of $0.25 a gallon when you redeem 100 fuel points.If you love buying Kroger brand products you can rack up the points by earning triple points for every $1 you spend.Your bonus points are not limited to the Kroger store itself you can still earn double points for every $1 you spend shopping at Kroger family stores which includesKing Soopers, Dillons, Smiths, Fry's and QFC. (excluding fuel centers).Earn 1 point per $1 spent anywhere Visa Cards are accepted.Every 1,000 points earned gets $5 in free groceries. Rewards sent automatically every quarter.Even if you just limit your purchases on your Kroger 1-2-3 card to your grocery store trips you will be putting the savings back into your families wallet without changing any of your usual spending habits.If I were to get this card I would treat it like my debit card. Only purchase what is calculated in my budget and pay it off immediately to avoid paying 23% more on food I already consumed.As with any credit card they have great introductory rates and services. But know if you choose to carry a balance past the introductory terms you will be charged the full regular interest rate between 13.99%-23.99% on the balance total.

name: Niki Smith
review: The US Bank Platinum Visa card is an upgrade of the first credit card I was issued, and I've had no reason to change it. My credit limit has increased steadily over time, and has never been lower than my needs for it. I am able to pay it off through their website and receive an email every month to do so, so I've never been late or had any problems. I have used it while traveling and abroad with no problems. As a customer, I'm very happy that there is no annual fee. The card has been great for my credit rating.

name: Sheryl Papageorgio
review: One thing to keep in mind with the Kroger 1-2-3 Rewards Credit Card is that you don't need the card to take advantage of the fuel rewards program that they offer.  It's a standard part of simply using your Kroger card.  Looking at just the reward points, you'll get 3% back when shopping at Kroger, 2% back at any of the stores owned by Kroger (King Soopers, Dillons Smith's, Fry's and QFC), and 1% back everywhere else.  It's pretty good for a grocery card, but if you can get a better deal with another credit card just remember that the Fuel Rewards can also be redeemed with their standard store card which is not a credit card.

name: Chantel
review: Our family has several accounts with US Bank and have been happy with the service that we receive.  Opening the accounts was an easy process and the bankers are very knowledgeable.  We just recently opened a checking and savings account for our daughter at US Bank.They helped us understand which type of accounts would be best for our particular situations.  I like the online banking options and the ease of managing my accounts.  I also really like the online Billpay feature which allows me to pay bills quickly and with no stamps, envelopes, etc.  Overall, I am pleased with US Bank and would recommend them to others.

name: Janice Krone
review: The US Bank Secured Visa Credit Card is a good card for people with bad credit or as a first credit card. The only real negative thing about it is that it has a higher minimum deposit than others credit cards in its class at $300, and the annual fee is also a little more than others at $35. But one of the benefits about this card that others don't offer is that it pays you interest on the deposit, and it approved me within minutes of applying, which was extremely helpful. Another great benefit is that it has no monthly fee, and the customer support is fantastic. I definitely recommend this to most people who want a beginner card or to simply improve credit scores.

name: Corrina Hillegeist
review: The Kroger 1-2-3 Rewards Visa Credit card is one of the cards I use most for grocery shopping. It has a great low regular interest rate, and great perks. Among my favorites are the 3 points I earn for every dollar I spend on Kroger products, 1 point for every dollar I spend wherever visa is accepted, and the $5.00 in free groceries for every 1,000 points I earn to name just a few. I also like the  0% interest rate on purchases for the fist 9 months, and the low 3% balance transfer fee. I would highly recommend considering this card to anyone who does a lot of shopping at Kroger's markets. This card definitely deserves 5 stars.

name: ursula kafka
review: This is a great rewards card. With a 0% introductory APR, they're practically paying you to do your grocery shopping for the first 9 months. If you do a lot of shopping at Kroger, you'll rack up points very quickly. It's a similar set-up to other rewards cards, where you get rewarded more for buying their products, but 1 point per $1 spent anywhere else it's still worth using this card. The Kroger 1-2-3 Rewards Visa would be a good choice if you're only going to have one credit card. I just wish there weren't a 3% fee on initial balance transfers, that makes the switch a little more difficult.

name: Kayla Blodgett
review: This is the very first credit card I ever got, it started out as a student credit card and a 300 dollar limit, over the years the limit has went up and the interest rate down, although they still do not offer the greatest rates compared to other companies...all in all not to bad of a company, customer service has been helpful on a few situations, I'd recommend this card. Although I kept the US Bank Credit card I did not stay a customer of the bank, they helped me a great deal in getting my first student credit card that helped to boost my credit to an excellent rating and then visa uped my card to the platinum visa so for that I am thankful.

name: Sara Gee
review: I've used the REI Visa card for over 7 years now.  I shop at REI regularly and love having the high dividend that I earn from using this card.  Not only do I get 10% from REI regularly (just for being member) but I get an ADDITIONAL 5% if I use the card.  Also, I get 1% dividend on all other purchases.  I usually rack up a few hundred dollars per year this way.In the years I've used this card, I've had nothing but excellent customer service.  My interest rate is a low 9.9%.  Overall, I'd recommend this card, but it really only benefits people who plan to shop at REI.

name: Chris
review: The Kroger 1-2-3 Rewards Credit Card is a great card if you have a Krogers in your area. Krogers is the main grocery store that I shop for groceries at, so for me it was a no brainer to get their store card. Little did I know how amazing it is, and how much money it would save me in the long run. Since I use it weekly to buy groceries, the points adds up very quickly and I regularly find myself earning free food because of it. I love the card, and I will continue to use it whenever I can.

name: Michael M
review: The Harley-Davidson Secured Credit Card is an excellent card to have when you are trying to repair your credit. It offers no annual fee or no monthly fee to have this credit card, this is huge to me because I hate paying any unneeded monthly fees. Especially when you are trying to fix your credit and you need all the help you can get. You do have to make a deposit and the deposit is also your credit spending limit. This is a good thing, because you will never overspend and run up debt you cannot afford, you are trying to fix your credit after all. Harley-Davidson Secured Credit Card gives you protection against fraud, so if it is stolen, no sweat and is a nice feature to have. With good management and control of this credit card they will eventually offer you a unsecured card that gives you a credit line without depositing money. Do not be discouraged by the Harley-Davidson logo, this is one of the best cards on the market to help you repair your credit and I highly recommend it.

name: William Reyes
review: I like the Hobby Lobby Credit Card since I am a regular customer, and enjoy the perks it offers! I love the fraud protection in case the card gets lost, and that it offers travel accident insurance on top of it. I wish they would do away with the annual fee altogether, but it is a minor inconvenience. The interest rate is average, but if you pay your purchases on time, there won't be an issue. You also get 1000 points when you sign up, which is a helpful and attractive feature! You get points for every buck spend at the store, but also in purchases at other establishments. For every 2500 points you get a $25 gift card to shop at Hobby Lobby! This is about the same as the TJX store I have for T.J.Maxx.

name: Dolores Severance
review: The US Bank Secured Visa Card is not a bad card for those who need to build or re-establish their credit. I think the annual fee is slightly higher than other cards in this class. I find that the interest rate is about average. The Capital One Secured MasterCard has a lower annual fee at $29 but the interest rate of 22.9% is higher than the 20.99% on the US Bank card. I like that there are no monthly fees incurred with this card but I don't like that the minimum deposit is higher ($300) than other cards which only require a $200 deposit. Over all, it is not bad.

name: William Reyes
review: I have been a US Bank customer for 7 years now, and I am really impressed with their unbeatable customer service. I have the US Bank Visa Platinum Credit Card, and I find it really convenient, and it helps build a good credit score. I really liked the introductory 0% interest rate for more than a year, and the non-existent annual fee. I also love the $0 fraud liability because you can't never be too careful when shopping online, for example. Another great thing about this card is that I get alerts for suspicious activity in my card, and I can pay it anytime online. For all these reasons, I will continue to use this card.

name: Alexandria Ellington
review: The Fred Meyer Credit Card introductory APR of 0 percent is of course rather appealing.  The intro period also extends for a period of 9 months which is also very helpful.  The regular rate does fall into a decent range for an average to slightly above average percentage rate at 13.99-23.99 percent.  I am not familiar with The Fred Meyer Credit Card Company name so that could be an issue depending upon their history and viability.  This uncertainty may mean future increases in percentage down the road or a loss in potential benefits such as Travel and Emergency Assistance.  The Fred Meyer Credit Card does however, have a rather extensive reward system which is highly useful if taken advantage of.  All in all, I think the Fred Meyer Card represents a good value with little to no risk.  A good choice if you are looking to expand or increase your credit score.

name: Jason Mercer
review: I think this card is pretty good for a person that does a lot of crafting and shopping at Hobby Lobby. Earning 5 points per dollar at Hobby Lobby is a great deal. However the interest rates and the chance of an annual fee make this pretty much a generic credit card if you shop anywhere but hobby lobby. I have had a similar card with Amazon and it was great earning points at Amazon because I shop there a lot. So if you think you will be doing a lot of shopping at Hobby Lobby then this is the card for you.

name: timothy bull
review: I love this card. I am a frequent traveler to South East Asia, specifically Korea and I get great reward miles of 1 mile per dollar spent and double reward miles for trips to Korea. You automatically get started off with 15000 reward miles once you make your first purchase which is a big incentive if you are using the card specifically for travel miles. The rewards miles work with any Skyteam member such as Delta or Thai Air and are redeemable for upgrades and even free flights and flights to SEA can be very expensive so the miles really help out.. Another great thing about the card is there are no foreign transaction fees which every card has and that means my money goes farther when I am traveling abroad.

name: John Peterson
review: The Fred Meyer Credit Card does offer some very attractive things like a 0% APR starting rate for the first 9 months then a fixed rate depending on your credit score is after that. The Fred Meyer Credit Card also has some major down sides at least in my eyes, its geared toward those with excellent credit which in this economy is the elite which means your changes of getting the card is slim to none. Also the Fred Meyer Credit Card attempts to lure you in with a points system were you get one point for ever dollar you spend, what they don't tell you is until you get at least 10,000 points you cant really use them for anything.

name: John Peterson
review: The US Bank Secured Credit Card is almost near perfect for those of us with less than perfect credit. It has many advantages like your credit history will not be checked in order to get the card, all you have to do is pay the deposit of 300. Another advantage this card has over other secured cards is it allows you to add more money over time to higher your credit limit all the way up to 2,000.  One of the best features is there is no monthly fee like many other credit cards, simply pay 35.00 a year and your golden.

name: Ariyana Smith
review: For a person who participates in a lot of crafts and constantly finds themselves in need of items at Hobby Lobby, I think this rewards program is one of the more generous I’ve come across; however, I don’t shop at the store all that much and as such wouldn’t benefit so much from these particular offers. I would also hesitate to get this card because of the slightly above average interest rates. For someone with good credit like mine, I can find better offers elsewhere. Overall, I’m sure this Hobby Lobby Credit Card  5 points: $1 reward system is a great offer for someone who always find themselves buying home decorations, but it isn’t particularly suited to my personal needs.

name: Reylin Bates
review: The Fred Meyer Credit Card is a really good card to have especially for those of you that get gas a lot, which is most of America. I like that you can save up to 1.25 on gas at Fred Meyer Fuel Centers during your first three months. The only thing I dislike is that it is only during the first 3 months. It would be sweet if it was always like this. In order to get this discount, you have to have at least 100 fuel points. It's fairly easy to rack up points. It is 1 point per dollar. The max is 2 points per dollar. I would compare this to the NEA credit card except I like that one a bit better because you 200 bucks after spending 500 bucks during your first 3 months. Both cards are good though.

name: Steven Gimenez
review: The US Bank Secured Visa Credit Card seems like a good starting card for people with no credit or bad credit. The one thing I do not like is that the annual fee is rather high for an introductory card. The deposit is also $300 whereareas it is usually $200 on newcomer cards like this one It's rates are pretty good considering it is a new comer card. FDIC insured is an A+ in my book! Overall I greatly like the benefits of the card. The interest rates are attractive, as well as the actual design of the card. It is a great card when first starting out!

name: Ben
review: The Hobby Lobby Credit Card offers an effective 5% cash back when you shop at Hobby Lobby, which I've never seen in California. This is really similar to the Bed Bath & Beyond Credit Card, which offers 5% cash back for Bed, Bath & Beyond purchases. Both cards also offer the standard 1% return for shopping anywhere else. However, the initial bonus offering, 1000 points for your first purchase, cannot be redeemed instantly like the Bed Bath and Beyond reward. Unless you have a hobby that can be found at their store, the Hobby Lobby Credit Card feels limiting and I would look elsewhere for a rewards card.

name: Edward David
review: For a smaller store like Hobby Lobby, the Hobby Lobby credit is alright. It gives you an opportunity to earn back for your continual shopping at the store. The initial bonus is pretty sweet giving you 1000 points which is half the way to a $25 gift card. After that you get 5 points per dollar spent at hobby lobby which is actually very high compared to other stores. Purchases elsewhere are the standard less lucrative 1 point per dollar spent. Sadly they do not have an introductory APR rate but still this car is pretty good if you love Hobby Lobby. Get that money back!

name: Adrienne Dowling
review: What I really like about the Fred Meyer credit card is the rewards you get. 1 point per $1 spent is pretty great but getting 2 points on every dollar spent at Fred Meyer stores is even better. I currently have a Best Buy Capital One card that offers 2% cash back anywhere and 5% cash back on all Best Buy purchases which seems pretty equivalent to the Fred Meyer card. What I am not thrilled about is the $35 late fee. I have actually been charged a $35 late fee on one of my credit cards when I was "late" and I was pretty livid. I had actually paid the bill but their system didn't recognize it until 2 days later!

name: David Bishop
review: The US Bank Secured Visa® Credit Card is a viable option for all of those out there with bad credit who are looking to build it a little bit. While the interest rates may be a bit higher than what you may hope for, for a secured card they are not outrageous. There are no monthly fees or one-time fees with US Bank Secured Visa® Credit Card, so that is a nice thing to have as someone with bad credit. Also, the basic fraud protection is about what you would expect with any Visa card. Overall a decent secured card for those who have to go down that road.

name: Shoshi Jenkins
review: I think that the Hobby Lobby Credit Card is a pretty decent card. Earning 5 points for every $1 at Hobby Lobby is pretty decent. Every $500 dollars that you spend there gets you a $25 Hobby Lobby gift card. The 1 point per $1 spent everywhere else is pretty average compared to the cards I have used in the past. I don't like how it has a $29 annual fee based on your credit. There shouldn't be one. It's a good card for use at this store, but if you want to use it elsewhere I recommend looking at a different card.

name: Kraig Lasher
review: This card is potentially very good depending on if you are accepted for the lower end of the interest rate.  It reminds me much of the Chase Sapphire Preferred Visa cars I once had.  That was the only card I ever had that offered one point per one dollar spent.  Colorado State University Select Rewards Visa Platinum Credit Card.  Any other card I ever had was one point per two dollars spent, so that is a nice perk.  The initial bonus I had with the Chase Sapphire Preferred card was much higher however.  I do like that the Colorado State University Select Rewards Visa Platinum card allows you to redeem points at only 1,500 points accumulated.  It should not take most people very long to reach that and it is nice to use your points before you have been building them for three years.  This appears to be a good card overall and I would be interested in applying for it.  If I was accepted at the low end of the interest rate as opposed to the high end that is possible with it, I would be happy to have it.

name: William Reyes
review: I like that the Colorado State University Visa® Platinum Credit Card has lower interest rates than other cards with the same "excellent" and "good" score rating requirements. I also really love that it has a higher amount limit than average (my First National bank credit card only had a $10,000 limit with excellent credit). It is very nice that it comes with fraud protection as standard feature, ideal for people who do most of their shopping online, so they are protected when malicious people charge things in their name. Overall, I think this card is balanced, and it has attractive features, however, I wish it came with a 0% introductory rate for at least 12 months, and also have some rewards system set up for cash back purchases.

name: Jordan Webb
review: A quality credit card is the US Bank FlexPerks Cash Rewards Visa. I think that this card is worth it because of the generous rewards program it allows for and the 15 month introductory period for the 0% interest rate, which is longer than most other credit cards. However, after this period the rate is pretty high, especially for individuals with excellent credit. Additionally, the late fee and overlimit fees are pretty high, which make me wary of using this card without keeping an eye on it. I do think I would get enough use out of the first 15 months of the card to justify applying for and using it.

name: Jessica Trivalia
review: I currently have the Staples card that earns me a 5% discount on every purchase. Using the OfficeMax card along with the MaxPerks membership seems to be a little bit better of a deal at 7%. Along with the 1000 point bonus for new members, I think that is a fairly good incentive to get this card and drive a little bit further to go to OfficeMax instead of Staples. I never carry a balance but the 0% intro rate is attractive. I do not like the variable interest rate that can climb as high as almost 24%. That seems excessive and unnecessary and throws up a big red flag to me personally. Also the balance transfer fees and cash advance rate are extremely high so I would never ever use those services. For using this as a standard credit card, I would never sign up, I will give it a shot just to use exclusively at OfficeMax because that seems to be a fairly good deal.

name: Jalisa
review: Seeing as how I work from home this OfficeMax Credit Card is a very attractive deal to me. I love getting money back for most of my purchases, and I tend to buy from OfficeMax a lot, but I just haven't had the chance to get a card with rewards for them. I like that they offer an 1000 point bonus on your first purchase, and they don't limit you to how much you have to pay on the first purchase. It's also nice that this card works in places other than OfficeMax. Most definitely will get this card next time I get the chance.

name: Johnathan Cline
review: I recently refinanced my car loan through U.S. Bank and was incredibly satisfied. The loan officer that worked with me in the branch was very thorough. He spent quite a bit of time communicating with me to make sure the loan went through, and showed wonderful customer service. He is the sole reason that I went through with the loan, and his extremely good customer service skills are a reason that I will remain with U.S. Bank and will try to get other business of mine to them if possible.The application process was very easy and I felt that everything was disclosed clearly. I knew exactly what I was getting into when I went through this loan process, and felt very comfortable doing this. We did run into some problems along the way, but my banker went above and beyond to make the loan happen. I even got a lower interest rate than originally quoted when I inquired!

name: Michael Latimer
review: The Kroger rewards card was always my favorite card. My grandparents had it when I was about 14 and my Grandma always bragged about how much it saved her on gas, so when I turned 18 I finally decided to get one for myself and boy was she right. The application process was very easy and the custom service was extremely nice anytime I had an issue they solved it almost immediately. I cannot stress enough how much the gas rewards help me though. I drive everywhere it seems in a week, taking my sister to work, going to college, picking my little brother up, and saving that extra money on gas helps me do what I'd like to do on the weekends. This card is just incredible, thank you Kroger and thank you Visa for this amazing card.

name: Jay
review: U.S. Bank has been a really good bank since I started banking with them in 2000. The customer service is excellent when you go into a branch office, and they try to make you feel a friend. Most of the time, they go out of their way to use your name when talking to you to make you feel welcome and a person, not a number.They have also been good to clear up any issues of lost funds that were out of my control over the past several years. Mostly, it has been good experiences. However, there are some changes that they have made that have left a dry taste in my mouth. Their visa rewards card program stopped right out of the blue, and this was something that I was able to accumulate several dollars with just by making purchases. That's lost money that they no longer offer. In addition, they made several changes to their checking system where you have to have at least $500 deposit in an account each month or they will charge you a “monthly maintenance fee.” This is a change that they made out of the blue as well. There's no such thing as free checking at U.S. Bank anymore unless you do this, this, and this......Overall, though, they've worked with me and have been very friendly and cooperative.

name: Marin Hartfield
review: US Bank really has left me with no complaints. The sign up process was very easy, went in with the needed documents, came out with a checking account AND a fifty dollar gift card with in about twenty minutes. Once you have your checking card, you really have no problems. I love that I can access my checking account on my phone, and even make transfers from checking to savings, (they limit this to six times a month). I also get five free uses of other ATMs which is AWESOME. All the people I have came into contact, counter employees and bankers have been more than pleasant and always very helpful. US Bank has been perfect for me in college, and they have US Banks everywhere I have been so far which is always nice if I need to make a little stop. My only complaint is they do charge overdraft, but who doesn't? Also, if you put the money back in with in two weeks they take the overdraft charge away, which is awesome.

name: Lynn Larsen
review: I applied for this card when I shopped at the store out in Ohio where I used to live. I remember calling the company and asking if I could still use it since a Kroger's is no longer local to me and the gentleman that took my call was very friendly and efficient, knowledgeable and helpful. Silly thing to worry about maybe, but I wasn't sure if the store name on the card had anything to do with it, but they were very reassuring on the phone. I'm so glad I got it and had saved money on store purchases out there at the time. I am still very pleased with it and is used for emergencies.

name: Chris H
review: I love US Bank. When I needed my first bank account, they helped set me up. When I needed to make a CD to save some money, they made it easy. And when I needed to get money out of that account, that was smooth, thanks to the great folks at US Bank. When my check card expired, despite being in a totally different state, the banker that I talked to helped me order a new card. And when I needed to get a credit card to start establishing credit, US Bank got me taken of, right away. The customer service line is always helpful and friendly, the branches are everywhere, and accessible. This is my bank, and will be, for a long, long time.

name: Hank Lin
review: U.S. Bank offered great services, and it is very convenient for college students. One of the options that I like about U.S. Bank is that for college student, if you open an account with US bank, they will not charge you any monthly fee. For the other account holder, US bank will charge a monthly fee of 7.95 per month. Also, US bank has corporation with many universities in the Midwest. If you are a college student, and your school has affiliation with US bank, you can get debit card with your photo on it; also the card could be used as your student ID as well. Moreover, if you had points on your student account, the check card could be used to pay with your student, too. One more thing, if you can such a student ID card, I bet you could find a US banking center right on your school campus, which really saves your time. All in all, US bank is a great choice for college students.

name: Michelle Williams
review: U.S. Bank is fantastic. I have been a customer for over 10 years and they have been quick to resolve any issue I've had. There have been a few instances where I overdrafted by a few bucks and had a charge, which they eventually dropped as soon as I deposited money. There have also been times where they suspected fraudulent activities and have called me to make sure I am the one using my card. When I was in college my Debit Card was stolen and it was my only source of my money, I did not have a credit card at the time. They were extremely helpful and responded quickly to get me a new Debit Card as soon as possible. The entire process only took about 2 days.

name: brittany
review: I originally began banking with US Bank because I transferred a balance to a credit card from them. I enjoyed that there was no interest for 12 months; however, after that year was up, my interest rate skyrocketed to 22%. It became so difficult to pay off my card because my minimum payments were as much as my interest payments. Backing up a bit, I opened a checking account with them because I loved my credit card so much in the beginning. This experience was so-so. I got my account fee waived at first because I had just opened the credit card as well. After a couple months, I got charged 7 dollars a month just to have a checking account. Needless to say, I wasn't satisfied with their services and ended them both.

name: William B
review: We've been spending a lot of time at Ace Hardware recently to help my mom with her new house. I finally decided to get an Ace card to start taking advantage of the points. So far, no complaints whatsoever. I understand other cards do give you rewards for more than just the place it came from, but since I'm using the card only at Ace, it makes sense that the rewards are directed towards the store. So far I figure I've saved around $20 which isn't too bad at all. I pay it off each month and that's that. Overall, I've had a great experience with not only Ace Hardware, but the card (and the reward points) as well. Very glad I got it.

name: Ok Frutiger
review: I got this card back when I started going to college and needed something that wasn’t always pulling from my checking account. I turned to US Bank as I had a savings and a checking account with them. They were really nice helping me determine whether or not this was the right card for me. Since then I have never had any issues with the card or the bank in general. They are very good at sending reminders to pay the balance and the amount you can get approved for is amazing for a broke college student. My campus also had a branch which made it that much easier to deposit money, pay off the balance, and ask any questions I had. I have never had any security issues either and would highly recommend this card for any college student looking to build credit.

name: Duncan Luss
review: I’ve never run into issues with this card, I absolutely love it. Everything is clearly spelled out when you sign up, and the website explains everything else. It’s so easy to pay it off online and the customer service line if there’s a problem is the best. I just got this card when I started college to establish credit, and I haven’t gone back since. They just make it so easy. I had a US Bank on campus when I first got my card, and this made it much easier when I needed to pay in person. They protect your identity and want to keep you as a customer, they want to make you happy.

name: Belinda Martinez
review: I got my very first credit card with them when no one else would give me a credit card many years ago. Now, I have my mortgage through them and they have always been really flexible when I have something come up and I need an extension. For example, when my dog became really sick and needed over $3,000 one month for care, during a time when my husband was unemployed, I reluctantly called and told them the situation and they were pleased to give me an extension. I now do my main banking with a credit union, but I feel like US Bank is the better of all the others (ie Bank of America, Wells Fargo). They seem to really care about their customers which is very hard to find.

name: William Reyes
review: I have been with U.S. Bank for a few years when I arrived in Omaha, Nebraska, and they had a special back then giving $75 when opening a checking account. In fact, when I opened my account they gave me a checking account AND a savings account. I found this really convenient because it gave me the opportunity to start saving and putting aside money for the future. The customer service was unparalleled; Juan, my usual Spanish speaking representative has helped me in many occasions with any questions about transfers, overdraft fees, etc. All of my checks have been free, and I have had nothing but the best service with U.S. Bank. I have recommended the bank to many people and all of my core family now has a bank account with them.

name: Mary Cole
review: Since Kroger is the only supermarket I get food from, the Kroger 1-2-3 Rewards Visa gives me incentives for doing what I normally do anyway -- shop for groceries at one of my favorite stores. The best part of this card is that I easily earn the maximum reward of 3 points/$1 because I buy Kroger generics almost every time there is a choice between a brand name and a similar Kroger product. In addition, this is a Visa card that has all the benefits of a traditional Visa -- like travel insurance and zero liability for fraud. This is the main credit card used in my house because any purchases we make earn us our useful food rewards.

name: Ryan
review: I have been banking with US bank for several months now. A very pleasant experience. I'm currently in Las Vegas and there is always a branch nearby. I do most of my banking online, but when I do go into my local branch they are always the friendliest people. Their student account is particularly nice, for me at least. No minimum balance, and no monthly fees. I did have one small problem with them however. I signed up for an account through their online process. It takes significantly longer to do this as opposed to just going into a branch. Other than this I have had no bad experiences with them.

name: Rebecca Coffman
review: US Bank is a great banking institution. I have never had any serious problems with them in my 10 years of using them. One time there was some suspicious activity in my account, and they immediately notified me to get a new account set up. Their online banking is really convenient and easy to use. You can even make deposits online with your smartphone, but I have never tried it. I don't go into the actual branch very often, but every time I have, they have been very helpful and solved my problems promptly. I would definitely recommend this bank for their service, dependability, and because there are branches all over the US.

name: Nil Patel
review: This card is a great starter card for people that aren't really interested in rewards points. It helps build credit and can be very useful by not having to carry cash. The interest rate is standard and only requires a small deposit. The great part of it was that US Bank actually paid me interest on that deposit, which many other cars don't do. I was approved for the card within 5 minutes, and the customer service representatives were very helpful and straight-forward about the terms of the card. I have yet to experience a problem with this card and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to a friend or family member.

name: Deadra Concini
review: As an avid Kroger shopper having a visa card that helps me save money on monthly grocery bills was an absolute no brainer! The benefit is that you get rewards which can be used to buy products at a Kroger market and that really helps my wife and kids get by and allow us to buy a few more luxury items each month! I get points toward Kroger from just about every place I shop at and that’s really the best part of this card. The apr really isn’t too bad and I am very happy my family and I made this switch. If you ever shop at a Kroger than I highly recommend this card too!

name: Derrick Bailey
review: Sorry Capital One but this card is badass. A secured card with no annual fee!!! This in itself is totally awesome. Stack on top of that a 25 day grace period and free online banking and you got yourself a deal. Plus not to mention they give you a free Experian credit score monthly. Only thing not to like is the 22.99 APR but pay off your balance every month and you won't have to worry about that. Have 12 months of good payments and U.S. Bank can move you to an unsecured card. Like I said i was denied a Cap One secured but U.S. Bank gave me a thumbs up. Only thing I don't like about this card is the application process. After your application it will say you weren't approved at this time which makes people think they were denied. Don't fret. You probably have been approved give it a week and a half and your account will be debited. Then seven days latter...whaaa laaa you have your card. U.S. Bank does need to fix that process.

name: John Talbert
review: I have had this card now for about three years.  It is one of two cards that I own.  I have been very satisfied in the features of the card as well as the customer service offered.  This past Christmas, I had to return a purchase I made to a national retailer, using this card.  During the return, the clerk evidently copied my card number and other information and made a fraudulent charge to my account.  I was notified within two days of the issue.  The bank worked to cancel the transaction and immediately credited my account for the full amount lost.  I would highly recommend getting this card.

name: Matthew Magee
review: I transferred a balance to this card when I received an offer for 18 months interest free.  Since I'm trying to pay off my debt, it seemed like a good deal that would save me a little money. They've been pretty good to me and it is easy to make payments (which is a big deal for me - don't make it hard to take my money...). I like the iphone app too; which allows me to make a payment when I'm away from my computer. That's super helpful.  I have never had a reason to call them - so I can't speak knowledgeably about their customer service; but perhaps that says enough: I've never had to call them...

name: Nil Patel
review: This bank has been nothing but amazing for me. I originally signed up  because they were located inside of a grocery store that led them to be open from 9 am to 9 pm EVERY DAY of the week, including Sundays! This was a huge plus for me because I usually didn't get out of work until about 7:30 PM, and all the banks in my town were closed by this time. A few years later, I opened a credit card with them. This process was so easy and informative. The banker made sure to outline every condition of the credit card; we even acted out hypothetical situations where people have made mistakes before. He knew it was my first credit card and he did not want me to make a mistake with it. Customer service and problem resolutions with this bank is top-notch. I have and will continue to recommend this bank to friends and family.

name: Maile Lanfranco
review: I initially signed up for this card to ensure I had overdraft protection on my student checking account with US Bank. I didn't really use it until I had to pay over $400 for books one month. I didn't have the money and had no idea where I was going to get it from. I Forgot about my credit card and used it, knowing I was getting a tax refund withing a couple weeks. I was so happy I had this card, it really saved me. Also, there is an amazing 24 day grace period before interest starts accruing. I paid my balance in full when I received my tax refund and didn't get charged a penny in interest. This card is great for any student who has limited or no credit because the limit is manageable and US Bank's customer service is amazing. Would definitely recommend to any friend!

name: Stephanie Russell
review: I have been a customer with U.S. Bank for roughly 6 years and have never had a problem with them. They gave me a credit card when no one else would, and helped me establish good credit-something I will be forever grateful for. Whenever I have had an issue with my account, they clear it up promptly and courteously.

name: Ching Stream
review: I got an offer for the Kroger 1-2-3 Rewards Visa  card I guess because I shop at Kroger quite a bit.  I already have a Visa card but decided to give it a try for the perks. The perks are great because you earn points to spend on their products.  You don't have to wait on gift cards and who doesn't need groceries or gas discounts. Also the beauty of this is you still accumulate points even if the purchase isn't at Kroger. This in combination with my Kroger plus card helps me out on my monthly grocery bill.  I’m pleased with that.

name: randy kent
review: I became a client of US bank when they purchased a local bank. The local bank was in the small town of Laurie Missouri. I had chosen the local bank because I wanted the personalized service typical of local banks. When US Bank bought the community bank I was prepared for the worst. Big surprise. They honoured my free lifetime checking. I visited the branch soon after the name change to get a safe deposit box. Low and behold they had one!! The branch manager helped me and in 30 minutes I had my box. Later when I needed some personalized service the bank manager handled it just as quickly and also gave me their home phone if I had any problems.  This is truly a bank that I appreciate.

name: samantha mischker
review: I have been banking with US Bank for over 10 years and haven't had (many) problems with them. Phone customer service is very helpful and knowledgeable and the only issue I've had is when I needed to visit in person. Once, I needed to convert 5 dollars into pennies for a school fundraiser. I was hoping it would be free, but didn't plan on it and was prepared to pay a fee. When I approached the cashier I was told their fee for exchanging money would end up being $5. I was exasperated, and thought it was a joke, but she refused to exchange the money. I stated very clearly 'So you expect me to hand you 5 dollars, and I will have no pennies in return?', and she said 'yes'; that she could not change their policy. I followed this up with a call to the branch manager, mostly because I wanted to share how ridiculous it was, and he apologized and said it was a lack of training about their policies to the employee. If you do use US Bank, and have questions or are not clear on what their policies are, or something seems terribly wrong, ask for a supervisor or clarification. Hope this was a one time thing that happened only to me.

name: Brittany Steffey
review: The employees at every branch of the bank are very friendly, but their fees are exorbitant, and they're not very up-front about them. They often don't communicate very well with customers in general – they raised the cost of my checking account from free to 16.99 a month without notice, and only refunded part of the money when I challenged it. I originally chose them because they don't support mountaintop removal mining, and have some good environmental and community development practices, but, apart from the good in-person service, they seem to be like every other big, profit-seeking bank. Starting an account is fairly easy (an employee will take care of most of it for you while you wait), but does take quite awhile. They do offer a great rewards credit card option to checking account holders, which is one big reason I stay with them. The card offers a lot of cash back on certain categories.

name: Ivan
review: This is the best bank in my neighborhood and their customer service is really good. I have a checking account with this bank. I also use it for direct deposit for my job. I have never had a problem with them. This bank is also the first bank I have had an account with and I have no plans on changing banks. When I first joined they did everything to help me and explained everything really clearly. They also offer different financial services for all your needs. I really recommend this bank to whoever has one near where he/she lives. You will love having your money in this bank.

name: Allen Kenda
review: US Bank is honestly a bank I can't see myself moving away from right now. They're a really fine bank with a lot of the little things that matter. Whereas it's a really mechanical process to walk into most banks, US bank really makes you feel at home when walking in to one of their branches. I use the Tacoma WA branch, and every time I go in I feel like they're there to help ME, not to make a ton of money. We all know they are, but the people caring about you are a nice touch. Combined with having a few problems with overcharges from companies and US bank handling the issue quickly, it's really quite splendid. I have to go in there soon, actually. I don't dread it at all, because I know that it'll be an enjoyable experience with people that actually care about my continued business.

name: Lucas
review: U.S. Bank was the first bank I opened a checking/savings account with. They were very professional and courteous when I went in there shortly after my 18th birthday. They were very informative and helped me choose between the many different account choices they offer. Anytime I have ever had to contact their customer service, I have been treated with generosity and respect. One time I overdrafted and didn’t notice it for quite some time (I was out of state). The bank manager personally worked with me to stop and remove the fees. My only complaint is that there are no locations currently where I live. I still keep my bank account with them because I travel a lot, but I wish they would come down here to Texas. I recommend this bank to anyone who lives close enough to them.

name: Allen Kenda
review: This card is pretty good, honestly. In a tight spot, It's what helps get through a few days until I have actual money instead of just a line of credit. It's pretty awesome that It's tied into my US bank account as well, making thing way easier and requiring less annoying micromanagement on my part. Seriously, micromanaging this kinda thing would probably drive me crazy, and would only get worse as time went on. It looks really cool too. I mean hey, who doesn't like a shiny card? Looks good in the wallet, makes purchases easy, and is tied up into one neat little package.

name: Caitlin Rowland
review: I decided to get a Kroger 1-2-3 Credit Card because I shop multiple times a week at Kroger. The rewards offered are a GREAT incentive to have one of these cards. I use it to save on fuel, which is a huge help since gas prices are so high and I drive 130 miles a day for work. The card is easy to use and any time I have had a question or concern, the customer service offered to me has been amazing! I definitely recommend the Kroger 1-2-3 card for those shoppers that are frequent flyers with Kroger stores.

name: John Jameson
review: I recently went to a local U.S. Bank to apply for a loan. As soon as I walked in I noticed the facility was in shambles. Paint was peeling of the walls, the carpet reeked and looked like it was growing mold, the air was stale and there wasn’t an employee in sight. I had to tap on the bullet proof glass to get the attention of a teller who eventually called over a loan officer for me. The loan officer in question didn’t really seem all there. He rarely made eye contact, consistently went off on tangents, and in the end he didn’t even let me apply. On the whole I give US Bank two big fat thumbs down.

name: ben paulsen
review: The Bank of the Rio Grande provided me with some of the best customer service I have ever had concerning savings accounts. They were open and honest at all times through the process. There were no hidden fees or hidden costs to surprise me at the end of signing up for the deal. The application process was easy to follow and for a younger customer such as me it was very easy to set up one of my first bank accounts. I would tell my friends and family to use their services if they were looking to set up a savings account.

name: David
review: I was a loyal customer at U.S. Bank for 5 years, and recently took out all of my money and closed both my savings and checking accounts with them. A recently instituted policy really irked me and drove me away from their institution. About a year ago, U.S. Bank sent me a letter informing me that they would start charging monthly maintenance fees on my checking account. I have had active accounts with them since I was 16 years old, and now all of a sudden they want to charge me a fee for the privilege of holding my money? When I went to the bank and asked to see a manager in order to protest this new fee, I was told that there were two ways in order to have it waived: have direct deposit of at least $500 per month or a monthly balance of $1500. I am a full-time student and do not currently have a job with direct deposit and I do not carry a high enough balance every month to waive the fee. When I told the manager that I would be unable to continue doing business with them on account of the fees, she tried to get me to downgrade my checking account into a very bare bones student account. No thank you. There are plenty of other banks and credit unions out there who are not willing to lose long-time customers to frivolous fees.

name: Nick
review: U.S. Bank is the primary bank where I maintain my account. While opting for a savings account from their broad range of available options, I chose the Goals Savings Account. It has no monthly maintenance fees and also offers unlimited and free U.S. Bank ATM transactions. My checking account also gives me great features and benefits and it simply required a minimum opening deposit of $25. They do have a monthly maintenance fee but you can avoid it if your average account balance is $1,500 or more and also in case your combined monthly direct deposits amount to $500 or more. Overall, it is a great bank which lets you manage your account effectively and helps you feel financially secure.

name: Steven Dison
review: First off, let me just say ... I love US Bank. I switched from Regions Bank because I went to work for US Bank, and therefore needed to have an account there. My working there didn't quite work out, but I kept the account because of the great customer service. Their website is incredibly easy to use. Their mobile app actually lets you deposit checks by using your camera on your phone. That's pretty sweet! I don't even have to come into the local branch most times. They are such a great bank, I don't have to. I even had fraud on my account once and they dealt with it swiftly. Just a great bank.

name: Kevin Burrell
review: I used to love U.S bank back when there were no monthly fees. After the recession and bank crisis, they have gone way downhill. I used to have 2 accounts with them, but after a couple of reoccurring errors and fees charged to my account that I didn't authorize, I decided it was time for a change. I switched to a credit union and it has made my life that much easier. I like the idea of having a big bank like U.S bank, but at this time in my life, with just a little savings, a credit union is all I need! I would recommend this change to anyone in a similar situation that wants to switch.

name: Jen
review: I have been a member of US Bank for about 7 or 8 years now and have been pretty pleased with their service. I have both a checking and savings account and have taken out a couple loans. I like being able to do all my banking online and never have to deal with any fees. Getting a loan from them was very easy too. All it took was stopping in the bank, talking to one of their loan managers, filling out a few things, signing a few other things and I had my loan. Overall, the customer service has always been very good and pleasant to deal with. So far I don’t really have any complaints with US Bank.

name: infinite read
review: Having a checking account from U.S. Bank is quite easy. I keep money in my account, I don't let it go negative and I try not to cause any problems. In exchange, U.S. Bank handles all my transactions, does not charge me any unknown fees and does not give me any problems. It’s a win-win situation. They have plenty of branches near me, so it’s very easy to deposit a check or to pull out money. Their tellers are always very friendly and willing to help with whatever situation I bring them. I have a low impact banking relationship with them, but that’s what makes it so easy.

name: Jennie Lopez
review: I got this card as my first credit card, I needed something simple that would help me boost my credit up as I had no credit at the time. I was surprised that my limit was as high as it was, $500 because of it being my first card and because I had no credit. What I love most about this card is it has no fees. I found it really easy to use, check my statements and keep up with. I also really love the rewards, it took me a while to save up enough points but it was nice when I finally had enough points I was able to cash them in for cash back and that's always a perk in my book. I would definitely recommend this credit card to anyone who is starting out with their first card or who is trying to establish their credit.

name: Steven Dison
review: The US Bank Platinum Credit Card is fantastic. I like how it's connected to the rest of my US Bank account, so that I can easily pay bills for it. It's incredibly easy. It also has a respectable interest rate that is lower than most of the other offers I get from credit card companies. I don't know what I'd do with out my US Bank Platinum card! On a side note, I even like the look of it. I know it's fairly superficial, but it still makes it even better. Who wouldn't want a platinum card? Then again, I wouldn't mind a black one, but platinum is certainly up there in terms of quality and elegance.

name: Miesha Burnstein
review: Just last month my wife introduced me to the Kroger 1-2-3 Credit Card.  I found out I save a ton more on fuel (something I'm going to be buying all the time) and even get points for buying groceries.  I seen this as a win win situation since I will always have to buy gas and I will always have to buy groceries.  Since I buy these things at least every week, the points build up extremely fast, which I in turn use the rewards on more gas and groceries.  It's a circular cycle that saves me quite a bit each month.  I'm disappointed she never told me about it sooner since it's her money as well!  Oh well, better now than never!

name: Jessica Robbeloth
review: The US Bank Visa Platinum Credit Card is my one and only card. I use it for everyday: grocery shopping, eating out, and for those bigger ticket items. I love that there is no annual fee for this card and by making my low monthly payments on time, I'm not charged outrageous interest charges. Visa is accepted everywhere and I've never been denied when using this card. I also love the convenience of doing my banking online. When I see an inconsistency on my billing statement online, I know that I can just pick up the phone and call the customer service and they will quickly help me. The customer support is so helpful and always alert me of suspicious activity and protect me from fraud. This is the only card I need and I tell my friends whose wallets are full of other credit cards to just get one like mine.

name: Fritz Coltrane
review: I typically use my Chase and Discover credit cards, but I decided to sign up for a Kroger card since I shop there all the time. The incentive to save money on fuel also convinced me to get the card. So far, I am pleased with the services that it offers, and everything is simple and easy to use. The rewards points are generous, and I am able to save on my groceries and gas. I am always getting coupons in the mail, which is great because I can actually benefit from the coupons. Customer service is also great as well; I have had no major problems so far. Payment is quick and easy. Overall, I have no complaints. If you shop at Kroger often, then this would be a great card to get!

name: Stephen Samuels
review: I have to admit I was a bit surprised to see a Kroger credit card.  I then realized I shop there for gas all the time and the rewards promise extra points for gas so I gave it a try.  The card has good rewards for those that use Kroger a lot both gas and food.  If you are not a Kroger shopping it is a bit of a waste of time for you to be using this card as you won't have much access to the best rewards this card has to offer.  The customer service is decent when you need assistance but not outstanding.  Overall the card is good for a specific purpose of saving money at a particular store but don't expect much more than that.

name: Barabara Fabiani
review: This is definitely one of *the* cards to get if you are thinking about switching to a rewards based card. Already being a US Bank customer, I had seen advertisements promoting applying for this card pop up from time to time, but never gave it much attention until I started realizing I was giving up possible rewards by not using it. It is so easy to collect FlexPoints with this card. Just by replacing my regular card I had used to buy fuel with this one, it took no time at all to get a nice amount of points banked up. I also have integrated it better into my normal shopping by just reaching for this card instead of my debit card as I normally would. The fees and rates themselves are not much different from what I'm used to seeing from other cards I have, but none of them reward you with a nice vacation the way this one will. If you get this card and use it regularly, you will not be disappointed.

name: Randall G
review: US bank was one of the first banks I joined. I joined because my parents had decided I needed to start up a bank account to save my own money instead of constantly asking them for money and just holding it in a jar in my room. It was pretty straightforward to join, as well as really easy. I had a problem with my card on the first week of joining, in that McDonald's declined it for an unknown reason. It was easy to call up customer service and get it resolved, but it was a fairly long wait time. Overall, I was pretty satisfied with US bank, and only stopped using them due to moving to a place that didn't have one within 20 miles.

name: joan gordon
review: A year and a half ago I relocated to a small Village in Northern New Mexico. U.S. Bank came highly recommended, and it was the closest, at 7 miles south. The folks there could not be nicer, friendlier and they are very very knowledgeable about the area. I am looking to buy a place eventually. The family of my gal at the bank has lived in the region for 12 generations. And she has been a terrific asset to my house hunting, and a bit of a Welcome Wagon into my new home. It is truly a Community oriented bank. I work online and having Online Banking was a big deal. In point of fact, U. S. Bank is the first bricks and mortar bank I have used in eleven years! I am very pleased. And to make it an even better welcome, I was invited to put my art up in their lobby. I am also able to easily transfer funds to my son's account in California.

name: Brian
review: I had a car lease with this bank and made all the payments on time. I followed all their instructions on returning the vehicle to the dealer. They kept sending me invoices for the lease payment. I kept telling them I no longer had the car. Then they claimed the car dealer didn't submit a timely payment to them. That was not my fault. Next thing I know, they report me to a credit bureau for late payment. Even after they received a payment from the dealer, they wouldn't release me from the report of the credit bureau. I had a credit rating over 800. Who knows what it is now. But I fulfilled all my obligations with them, and they treat me like I was in the wrong. And now they expect a lease termination fee. Robbers! Unethical!

name: CJ Strike
review: The cash rewards Visa card has been my card since early in college. It has worked well over the last 8 years or so and I am always happy to find a reward waiting for me since I use the card a lot for daily and weekly things like groceries and gas. If you are in school or just out this is a great card to get you started and it's tied to US Bank so you can even manage it online along with your checking and savings accounts.It’s not the most amazing card ever, but it’s a solid card for new card holders.

name: Seth Johnson
review: I was a customer coming to U. S. Bank from my prior Downey Savings account. When it became U. S. Bank, I instantly noticed that customer service turned to awful. I had some fraudulent charges show up on my account so I had to contact them immediately. I went through several different representatives before I could find one that helped solve the problem. They also started charging me for checking and savings. Without even asking me, they would deduct the cost each month from my account. One time, that brought me into a negative balance which was associated with fees. I also had an issue with a Payday Loan Advance I took out with another company. This company turned out to be a fraud. I told U. S. Bank that I needed them to block the debits coming from the fraudulent company. U. S. Bank informed me that there was nothing they could do. This is ridiculous! Someone is stealing money from my account fraudulently that I did not authorize and U. S. Bank can do nothing about it. I closed that account in a heartbeat and switched to a new bank. I would never recommend U. S. Bank. They are complete garbage.

name: Mike
review: I have been with US Bank for quite a few years now. So far they have been a good bank to deal with.
