Opening an account was very easy and their online banking is very simple to use and is very handy. I have a checking and savings account with them. Their customer service is very good and helpful. I once noticed some purchases from my account that I did not make, so I called them and they took care of it and were very helpful. They replaced the fraudulent charges and I had the money back in my account the same day. Overall, I have been very pleased with US Bank.

name: Caleb Parton
review: This was the first bank that my family and I used when we first moved to Oregon. Opening an account with them was very easy and simple. We had just moved from a small Midwestern town so getting a debit card was something new to us. They clearly explained how everything worked and found it all to be pretty simple. The only issue I really had with them was when I got a check from Canada it took them a long time to process it and get the money into my account, whereas other banks had done it much faster. My family and I eventually moved our finances over to a credit union to save money on checking and banking fees. But if you're interested in joining a bank I would recommend U.S. bank.

name: Smita Mutalik-Desai
review: We have been US bank customers since 2009 and have been very happy with them so far! We decided to open an account with them because it was minutes away from our place. It has very convenient timings. The best part is that it is open even on Sundays! The online banking service is also very good. The bill payment reminders are a great help, making sure we do not end up paying a fine. Also, transaction alerts help us know if there is any fraudulent activity going on with our account. They have good customer service as well. We were once victims of an online fraudulent activity, so my husband called up the customer service to report it. In a matter of minutes, our cards were cancelled and we got new cards within 48 hours. Overall, a great bank!

name: Lisa Baer
review: I never thought that I would get this credit card, but Kroger is my grocery store and they offered a LOT of incentives when I applied for this Kroger 123 card. I got a gift card (to Kroger, of course!) cashback on gas (I think about.10 cents per gallon was taken off my total) and I got a lot of free offer coupons on NICE things like vegetables, fruit (!) and tons of little staple items that belong in your pantry. I continue to get great coupons and I get.10 cents off gas probably about 1 or 2 times a month and overall, I'm pretty happy with it. I use other credit cards (wisely) for clothing, travel, and other things, but this is a good card for my groceries, especially considering that I shop there and only at Kroger for food! I recommend this card not as an all in one kind of card, but a speciality card that works very well for specifically food.

name: Sierra Rois
review: I've been using a U.S Bank Credit Card for five years now and I have had very few issues with it. The monthly minimum is very low and manageable. The interest adds up to a couple additional dollars a month. My card is accepted every where. I don't use my card often enough to really receive reward benefits, but that does not bother me much. I use another card a little more and get benefits from that. The customer service is extremely helpful. I've had to call them a few times from companies double charging me for things. Everyone I've talked to has done what I asked and continued to communicate with me to let me know my problem has been resolved. I plan to cancel a few of my cards at the end of the year but my U.S Bank one won't be on that list. The card is too valuable to dispose of anytime soon.

name: Chad Gerald
review: I have been with US Bank for two years now and overall have been very satisfied with them. They have a branch close to my home and it is open decent hours, they have a lot of ATM's and they make things easy for you. The employees are nice and they have a good helpline if you are having trouble or you just don't want to go in their office. The only problem that I have is that I had a mistake on my account and ended up getting some overdrafts and they would not cancel any of them out to help me out. However, other than that I have been very happy with them. I recommend if you do have an issue with your account that you go in person versus using the toll free number. They seem a lot more willing to help you in person than over the phone.

name: Julia Norgaard
review: I had a checking account with US Bank for over five years, but I finally decided to close my account down due to the lack of quality service I received from my bank. Please do not misunderstand me. Those who work for US Bank are genial and they will do everything within their power to help resolve the problem. Unfortunately, US Bank's general policies prevent simple problem resolution and this contrasts with the simple application processes. In addition, there’s a lack of transparency. I never received any notifications of any changes in the accounting procedures and I was always surprised by the various changes on my next trip to the bank. With all my complaints, I still believe that US Bank is better than a few of the larger banks.

name: Holly Hudock
review: As customers of US Bank for many years we always had a good experience going in and seeing the tellers. I remember a certain time we had to go in because we had incorrect charges on our statement. US Bank was more than happy to walk us through the process of getting the charges reversed so that we got our money back. I no longer use US Bank but still keep two credit cards with them because we still love doing business with US Bank. They are a great bank to use if there is one in your area.

name: Sarah Neil
review: We LOVE US Bank! Every branch we have dealt with has been very friendly and courteous. We had an issue with our card and within minutes of calling customer service it was resolved. We also recently moved and had to visit a new branch. We walked in and were greeted promptly. The music that was playing was upbeat and even though there was a wait in line to deposit my check, I was feeling so happy to be at the bank this day. We have appreciated their cheerful service and always look forward to going to the bank for all our needs! Thank you US Bank for providing EXCELLENT SERVICE far and beyond what would normally be expected!

name: Trish
review: I have been using the US Bank card for almost 2 yrs now and have been quite impressed with their cash rewards! I travel a lot for official purposes and have quite a good gas consumption and the US bank card really helps me save my bills with its cash rewards. They gave me 25% annual bonus on my previous year's cash rewards and I happily grabbed it. However, their customer service definitely needs some revamp. Getting to the customer service agent was a challenge and it was frustrating being on hold for a long time. Other than that they were quite professional and helped me even in setting up the Bill payment option through their website. This feature has really lessened my pain as I get reminders and never miss any payments or bills. Overall, a decent card to have in your wallet.

name: Joe Weider
review: You know what?  I feel bad for anyone out there who needs to build up their credit score but either hasn’t yet come across the Harley Davidson Secured Credit Card or just overlooked it because of its motorcycle branding.  I mean, the Harley Davidson Card is the best secured credit card on the market, in my opinion.  Here’s why:Background:- Secured credit cards are generally recognized as the best credit building vehicles because they report to the major credit bureaus and tend to have lower fees as well less strict approval criteria than other cards targeted to people with no credit or damaged credit.  The reason for that is you’re required to place a refundable security deposit that acts as your credit line, preventing you from spending more than you can afford to pay back and shielding the issuer from risk.- Nevertheless, most secured cards charge tens of dollars in annual fees, and rewards are virtually unheard of in this card segment.-The biggest priority for secured card users is to minimize costs in order to save as much money as possible for when they can actually get attractive rewards and low rates (you often have to pay an annual fee to get the best terms, even when you have excellent credit).Harley Card:- The Harley Davidson Secured Credit Card does not charge an annual fee, which means it offers free credit building.  It’s the only secured card issued by a major bank (as opposed to a credit union) that does not charge an annual fee.- The Harley Card also gives you some rewards on each dollar you spend.- U.S. Bank (the issuer of the Harley Davidson Secured Card) will automatically review your account for a potential upgrade after 12 months of responsible use.- You can place a deposit between $300 and $5,000.  The ability to essentially give yourself that much available credit (remember, your deposit equals your credit line) means you can boost your credit building efforts at will.Who should use it:Secured cards are generally best for people who haven’t had much experience using credit or who’ve made mistakes in the past.  For those in the “inexperienced” bucket, it’s important to note that you might want to check out a good unsecured card for newcomers (such as the Capital One Cash Rewards for Newcomers Card) or a student credit card first and only apply for a secured card if you don’t get approved or want some forced spending discipline.  If you have “bad” credit, a secured card is likely your best bet.  The only caveat is if you need an emergency line of credit (for example, to pay car bills in order to get to work).  The Harley Davidson Card, like most other secured cards, won’t help in that regard because you’re putting down the money for your credit line.  The Capital One Secured Card could be of help because it’s a partially secured card, which means the credit line for which you’re approved might exceed your deposit.  Otherwise, you’re stuck with an unsecured credit card for bad credit.

name: Jerrica
review: I opened an account with U.S Bank when I started college because it was the official bank of my college. It was my first bank account. So I do not have anything to compare U.S Bank to, but I have never had a major problem with them. The clerks have always been very helpful. I've been to different branches of U.S Bank all over Illinois and at each one of them I received the same generosity and helpfulness. I have had a couple major financial/banking issues since I opened my account and each time the clerks have been very useful in helping me fix it.The only drawback that U.S Bank has is that they often do things without fully informing me or explaining to me why it was done. One of the bank tellers when I opened up a new account asked if I needed checks. He told me he would send me a set for free, but I found out later he took out money from my bank account to print them. Then another time my bank account was completely closed and I had to open a new one. No one informed me it would be closed before it was and when I went in no one really had an answer about why it was closed. But they helped me set up a temporary account until I could get cash to open a new account. It is also really hard to find branches in IL. They don't have as many branches as bigger banks so I often have to travel way out of my way to find one.Despite the negatives, I think the customer service you get with U.S Bank is worth the few issues.

name: Debbie Webb
review: For many years I avoided credit cards. I had heard horror stories about how easy it was to get out of control with them. While shopping one day I picked up some information on the Kroger 123 card. I had a regular Kroger shopper card that was giving me some discounts on groceries. After reading the information and then researching online I found the Kroger 123 to be very practical. I signed up and recieved one. Within a month or so of using it I began to see a good discount on groceries at the Kroger store. I recieved points for each purchase that convert to gas and grocery discounts. I also learned that no matter where I shopped I got points for purchases. Those rewards have helped us stay on budget. I always pay my bill on  time so I do not have to worry about interest. Another great feature was being able to get cash in an emergency. I had an un expected expense and Kroger 123 was a life saver!

name: Alex Alexson
review: I decided to get this credit card because I am a frequent customer at Kroger. I buy nearly all of my groceries there, so I thought it would be a good idea to get a card that gave me extra points for shopping where I always shop. I also purchase gas at Kroger, and the 25 cent savings on gas during the first three months was a major incentive to me. That is really a great deal, especially when you have to drive a lot like I do. I get double points on all Kroger purchases, which is simply wonderful for me. I am also very happy that there are not any fees with this card. If you shop at Kroger, this could probably be one of the best cards you'll find.

name: Danielle Fetters
review: I became a US Bank customer a couple of years ago when my previous bank merged with US Bank. At first I was unsure about whether I would like the new bank. However US Bank quickly made me feel right at home. Their employees are always friendly, greet you by name and will even have managers step into help customers when the line gets too long in their branch offices. Recently my husband and I were victims of theft when someone used our debit card to charge a bunch of season passes to local amusement parks on our card. US Bank immediately froze the card, gave us a new account and put the money that had been taken from our account back in while they investigated the charges instead of making us wait to get our money back!I totally recommend US Bank to anyone whose looking for a large, professional bank with a small bank feel.

name: Amanda Campbell
review: I banked with US Bank for a short time when I was a college student. I still had the bank account from my home bank but had moved to a bigger city so I wanted to try a more local bank. I opened a checking and savings account. I didn’t understand clearly the rules of the savings and checking accounts and ended up accruing all kinds of fees which made me overdraft in my checking account. I ended up owing US Bank a lot of money simply because of fees that I did not know about. It may have been because I was so young and did not understand banking like I do now but I was not happy. The application process for an account was very easy and I even got a bonus for signing up.

name: Ryan Hannigan
review: Recently we had to get a surgery for my youngest son. Rather than try to take a loan after the surgery we did some shopping for a loan to cover what insurance wouldn't pay. After looking for a few days, we spoke with a representative from U.S. Bank. The gentleman was knowledgeable, courteous and understood our needs. We were able to get a loan basically for what we were looking for. The whole process took two weeks, but that had a lot to do with double checking some of our data and some of that had to do with my wife's employer not filling out a form correctly. The bank didn't deny the loan based on the issue, they merely called us and verified the issue and we got it resolved. Oddly, we only had the account open for a month as, within a couple of days after my son's surgery, I received an inheritance from a passed away uncle and we were able to pay the loan off early. While we didn't have a great deal of dealings with the bank aside from the application process, I would rate the bank above average overall, but great in customer service and problem solving. They could have simply denied the loan based on the employers error, but they followed up and checked the information. It was greatly appreciated.

name: Aaron Sass
review: I opened an account with U.S. Bank about four years ago because of convenience. The nearest branch was a little over a mile from my house. At first I was happy but as time went on there were a lot more things to complain about than to praise. I've never liked a bank charging you a fee to have an account with them. Unfortunately U.S. Bank happens to be one of those that do. Although it's not a gigantic fee, it's still a fee I'd rather not pay. I've since switched banks and I'm much happier with the one I currently do business with. My experience with U.S. Bank wasn't terrible. There were just a bunch of little things that I didn't like. So I switched.

name: Traci Carson
review: I got this card mainly because the grocery store I do the most shopping at is Kroger. The rewards are pretty nice, I rack up about $15 in free groceries every few months, and I remember when I first got this card, getting the extra money off gas for the first three months was really nice. The interest rate is a little high, but I've seen higher on credit cards. I never have to worry about it because I always pay my bill on time, so there's never any reason to worry about the interest rate. I had to call a couple times soon after I got this card with questions, and the customer service representatives were all very nice and helpful, so I don't have any complaints.

name: Allyson Melander
review: I recently switched over my bank to US bank as I was having some trouble at my old one. Once doing so I was offered to pick up this card and I decided to take a chance at it. I was approved for the card, and I have been using it since I have received it. So far I have not had any problems at any store with the card. I tend to buy whatever it is I need to buy with the credit card, and then pay it off at the end of the month in order to try and establish better credit. The fees for this card have been really nice and low for me. I have contacted customer service once or twice, due to an error while accessing my card online, and they were really helpful and fast about it. I did not have to wait on hold for longer than five minutes. I would really love to recommend people to get this card if you can, because it is really nice and the fees for it are pretty low for a credit card.

name: Enrique Daking
review: It's an OK card. I use it because I buy my groceries at Kroger. I think the rewards could be better, but I have to buy groceries anyway and Kroger is the closest store, so it just makes sense to use this card to earn free groceries. I almost always buy Kroger brand products to save money, so it is nice to earn triple points on those purchases. I'm single so I don't buy many groceries, but I still earn about $10 in free groceries every 3 months. I wish the interest rate was better. I really only use this to buy groceries though, so I often pay off the bill every month before I start getting charged interest. I haven't had any difficulties paying the bill online. I also see in the description that the card let's you save money on gas for the first three months but I never used that reward aspect.

name: Kimberly Beck
review: I opened a US bank account because I had used a small town bank that I miss very much. My husband and I needed to find a national bank that we could use in MN, IL, and OH. We've dealt with many problems with them and have not been satisfied yet. I had the honor of having a big problem with them after my landlord decided to cash 3 months worth of rent checks all at once. When I had thought he had already cashed them.  First of all if you get overdrafted they will make sure any deposits that are made the day of your overdrafts come in after the withdrawals so they can charge you the 35.00 overdrafts first. You get 3 of those a day plus a negative balance fee of 35 each day you are overdrafted and it can add up very quickly. When you are trying catch up from your paycheck it ends up being about a 140.00 a day for each day you are overdrafted. If you try to fix that to catch up you have to make sure you go to a full branch and that they tell you to pay all the fees and get your account back up to positive, when in the first place all your deposits were eaten up from all the overdraft fees. They told me they can fix the account by giving me some of the fees back. I went back in and they hadn’t fixed anything.  It becomes a vicious cycle and the president of the bank won't help you a bit. We get paid monthly. It adds up very quickly and it took us about 4 months to get out of the whole ordeal to a balanced bank account. Unfortunately we still need a bank that will work with all three states that we travel to many times during the year or we would be long gone from them.

name: Maxine Ashley
review: U.S. Bank was the first bank that I had ever done business with. I opened my first checking account with them when I was 18 years old and I am currently still with them today. I like the fact that this bank is not pushy when it comes to offering new promotions that they are having. I can just come into a U.S. Bank, do my business, and leave without wasting any time talking about nonsense. I also like the fact that the tellers are very knowledgeable and are able to answer any question that I have for them. They are also very friendly, which is a plus. I am definitely a U.S. Bank customer for life!

name: Mike Water
review: I recently applied for and got this credit card based on the recommendations of people on this board, and I'm so happy that I did. I had a smattering of other cards that I rarely used that kept low balances. Now I have transferred all my credit card balance to this card, and it's much easier to keep track of. The low interest rate is obviously the big selling point here, but I've found that the customer service is surprisingly good for a 'big bank'. I wish there was more ways to deal with the ins and outs of this card online, but for now the service is adequate enough that I will continue to use the service. I would recommend this card to just about anybody who can get it!

name: Crystal Dydell
review: I used the US Bank Platinum credit card for over 4 years, and I started using it mainly to get my credit up. My credit limit was about $1,000 and my interest rate was right around 10%, which was great for starting out without any credit. It was approved quickly, and my monthly payments were extremely low. I was able to use this card to get my credit up in no time. It is very easy to pay off each month, especially if you do a lot of banking online. Another nice benefit of the card, is they would email me once a month with special offers for using this card. For example, one of them was $15 off any purchase at Best Buy, or $3 off a purchase at Starbucks. Each month it was a different offer, some of them were great. I would definitely recommend this card to anyone that is looking to get their credit back up, or just to use to pay off some gifts.

name: Mike Kaduce
review: I don't even own a Harley Davidson - let's get that out of the way right up front. My brother applied for this and since a Harley store opened up right by our hometown, he has been getting a lot of use out of this card. So he insisted that I apply for one also and as long as I won't be using the points for myself, he asked me to let him use any rewards that I've accumulated. Since I was looking for a new 'hassle free' credit card anyway, I said okay, why not. No annual fee on this, you can imagine that would be a big deal since I'm not even using the rewards. Other information like APR and late fees are pretty run of the mill. It's a standard credit card with extraordinary awards if you are a Harley enthusiast. If not...maybe someone in your family is. :)

name: Chad
review: US Bank has been great for me, I highly recommend them. I have been a customer with US Bank for over 10 years, and I can't remember any problems or complaints I have ever had. The cashiers are extremely friendly and helpful, and I love that they aren't pushy when it comes to new deals or promotions. Any problems I have ever come across have been dealt with immediately and in a very satisfactory manner. I signed up with an auto loan through them a couple years ago, and it was incredibly simple. Took a few minutes for the application process, and then they even set it up to be automatically taken out of my checking account. It couldn't have been more simple. I never plan on changing banks.

name: daniel
review: I got my very first checking account from U.S. bank when I was 17 years old, so of course I’m going to have a bit of that nostalgia factor going on with these guys. The only reason I’m not banking with them now is that they just don’t have a lot of branches in the area where I live and I need more access to my money. There isn’t anything bad to say about them other than that. They just don’t have a bank on every corner like some others do, so for a checking account that you might want to withdraw directly from on your way to work it’s not really user friendly. When you go to another bank’s ATM you get hit with fees so it’s really not worth it. But, if you happen to have one in your area go for it. They treated me well and I’m sure they will do the same for you.

name: Crista Lavelle
review: I’m not quite sure why I had so many issues with the US Bank Cash Rewards Visa Card, I just know we had a lot.  We used this card for my start-up company just to build our credit and gain some cash rewards.  What we received was a false bill, junk mail out of our behind, and a cancellation process I can’t even begin to describe.  When statement time came around, we received our bill for the card and it was $10,000 over what we spent on it.  We were blown away by how much it was.  I knew something was wrong because there is no way we could of spent that much.  I ended up talking to customer service and it turned out that they mixed several cards up and even had a breach.  It took 2 months to get this straightened out and through that time we weren’t able to use our card.  This was a very long and terrible process and I don’t plan on using any US Bank cards any longer.

name: Ty
review: I purchased my home and got a mortgage with a small bank. They turned around and sold it to US Bank. That is the only service I have with them, but I have had no complaints. I haven’t had to deal with customer service at all and there haven’t been any other issues with them. They send me the monthly statement and I pay. I have no reason to complain about the level of service. They have provided me with timely billing and have always processed my payments on time. I would definitely recommend their services when it comes to home mortgages.

name: Alex Alexson
review: I got this Harley card because I am a Harley fanatic! I love their bikes, and it might not be the best idea to get a credit card just because it has your favorite brand name on it, but I could not resist. The good thing about this card for me is that you get triple reward points when you spend money at Harley dealerships. This is great as I am always getting new accessories for my motorcycle. Double points are also given for gas, which keeps me on my bike and on the road more often. I do have to say that this is a bit of a gimmicky card, but I do think it is pretty good regardless of the shallow marketing gimmick. That being said, there are much better cards out there.

name: Cordia Vanderkar
review: I recently applied for the US Bank Travel Rewards Credit Card, and I'm extremely glad that I did. The deal at the time was if I purchase $2500 worth of items within 5 months, I would receive 33,000 flex points. I was able to spend that much within 2 months, just putting my purchases and bills on the card. It is extremely easy to use, and offers a huge variety of rewards, with little to no penalties on late payments. I strongly recommend this credit card, as it makes buying items more enjoyable, knowing that you will be rewarded with the Flex Points. Can't wait to use my Flex Points for a trip to Hawaii!

name: Frank Thomas
review: I actually got this card because my father insisted that I do!  Its pretty funny, as he's a Harley man, and had a card of his own, but wanted me get one as well so that he could use my points.  In the long run, it actually worked out pretty good for me!  I needed a second credit card for emergencies, and those "just in case" moments, so I agreed.  The rates for this Harley Visa are not that fantastic and some of the fees are a bit high, but other than that, the service has been good, and the online system is very simple and user friendly.  I would only really suggest this card to anyone who wants to use it purely for the Harley points, as there are for sure better cards with better rates out there, but all in all, this Harley Visa card is Ok...

name: SHEILA KENNEDY
review: I have been with US Bank for a long time now. They have been nothing but wonderful. They have been helpful every time I have had an issue or any questions about any of my accounts with them. They are always professional and courteous any time I have gone inside to make a deposit, or open a new account. I am not a patient person for the most part, although I do try. I am somewhat technically challenged and I have called customer service more than once for some small thing. It really is obvious when they point it out, and I finally get it, but they have always been right there to walk me through the whole process. I even accidentally left my ATM card in the machine one day, and they called me and waited until I came down to get it back. I felt really embarrassed, but they said it happens a lot, and were more than patient and understanding about the whole thing. I would highly recommend them to anyone wanting to open an account. I live in a small town, so I see most of them every day, coming to get lunch or doing normal day to day things, but for me, they really give me the customer service experience and satisfaction I am looking for. I feel as though my business is appreciated, no matter how big or small. I am not just a number or a deposit. When I had a few problems, they worked with me to get them resolved and get things back on track. There were there to listen and help find a solution to my problem. Now that things are back on track, I will be a loyal customer for a long time.

name: AC
review: I have been banking with U.S. Bank for about eighteen months now, and it has been a very satisfying experience. No matter which branch I go to, and I have been to quite a few in various cities, the customer service is helpful and friendly. They do quite a good job of hiring good employees. The online banking option is incredibly helpful and ridiculously easy yet also safe. I love the online and paperless statement option - it's so much easier than having to deal with paper statements that are mailed to you. The only real problem I have with U.S. Bank is with their mobile banking app, specifically the app for the Android. It's so slow to update that it's basically pointless to use. It'd be faster and less painful to just call a local bank and ask for your information. Other than that, I'm satisfied with U.S. Bank's service.

name: Shannon Johnson
review: Well, it's a decent rewards card. That's about all there is to say. You get rewards points to spend at different places. You earn more if you shop there. I haven't had any problems with the card or the service. A previous review said the payment system id mindboggeling but I don't have an issues. Use the card, pay the bill, use the card, pay the bill, etc. It's an okay card.The interest rate is a bit steep but at this point they all are. I would recommend this to people who do most of their shopping at Kroger.

name: Grace Choi
review: There is a reason why US Bank has been rated as best bank for checking and savings by Money Magazine. I can personally attest to this as a customer who has had an account with US Bank for many many years. Being able to remotely make deposits to a free checking account with very minimal fees is very convenient. There is no reason why I would ever want to change to another bank. US Bank is easily accessible while travelling and there are usually several locations in any major city. I plan on continuing as a US Bank customer for many years to come.

name: Josh May
review: US Bank has been phenomenal to work with and I have never had so much as a single issue with them. When they say they are going to do something, they get it done swiftly and properly, and expect little follow through from my end. Their service has been helpful, friendly, and smooth. The calls I've made to customer service were quick and simple, and I felt like they were truly on my side and not just in it for my money. Of the many banks I've worked with, US Bank has really exceeded my expectations and kept me quite content. I'd highly recommend them among the many banks available.

name: farah hamoudi
review: I have had an account with the US bank for a long time by now. We can say it is a very good bank that is trustworthy and has very honest people who appreciate their customers. For example, my money was taken by a gas station twice from my Bank Account and I checked the next day and I was charged for a mistake that I did not really do. I went to my bank and told them about everything and they discharged me from it and put all the money in my account because it was not my fault it was somebody else`s. They are also one of the fastest Banks with checking your balance. They submit everything on your account website and tell you what you spent and how much you have. They also give you a day to pay your money before they charge you for it.

name: Taylor Phillips
review: I just recently opened a checking and savings account at US Bank, and so far it's been nothing but good experiences. Unlike a lot of banks, this bank has a way for you to avoid fees by transferring $25 dollars from your checking account to your savings account every month. That may sound tedious, but it's definitely not! The transfer is automatic and you can instantly transfer the money right back to your checking account. The signing up process was so easy. I did it online and so it took a couple days to be approved. It also took about a week to activate my account, because I needed to wait for my check card to be sent to me. It took a long time for me because I chose to do it online, but my boyfriend signed up in the bank and was able to assess his account within the same day. All in all, I’ve had a very good experience with this bank so far.

name: Justin
review: I have been banking with US Bank for 8 years. They got me when I was a freshman in college and came to my campus and I’ve been a loyal customer ever since. I’ve had a checking and savings account with them, as well as a credit card. There are branches everywhere I need one and every time I go, I get great service. I went in once to open up a bank account for my business and all their bankers were busy so the GM of the branch came and helped me personally. I couldn’t be happier with them and plan on getting my next car loan through them when it’s time to purchase next spring.

name: Dee Wilson
review: It is safe to say that I have NEVER had any issues with this bank! I had banked there for 7 years, started banking there by accident (small town, few banks to choose from) and I went into their bank instead of the one my family banks at. Needless to say, I love US Bank better and that was a happy accident! The staff is top notch. If there ever was a problem with my account, the clerks all made it their mission to find out what was wrong and go beyond their normal call of duty to solve the issue for me. One time my account was missing 200 dollars after my payroll check was direct deposited in, I had no idea about it until one of the clerks there called me up and asked me if something was wrong since I have never been overdrawn or anything. Turns out, while inputting my check, someone missed a couple of digits and didn't put the right amount. They apologized despite it being a silly mistake that was fixable (thank goodness I had my check stub to prove that the deposit was more than what was on the computer!). They will work with you no matter what your issue is. They also have no problem with exchanging large amounts of coins in wrappers for cash, at least they have always been extra happy about me bringing in those pesky coins. They always greet me like old family and have the best overall “customer banking attitude” that makes things right when they go wrong. They work with you on every aspect of banking. I would recommend it to ANYONE and EVERYONE!

name: Elouise Nollet
review: I have this credit card from U.S. Bank. It was sent to me with a pre-approval of several thousand dollars and a very low interest rate. I accepted the offer with the plans to consolidate some of my credit cards and husband’s credit cards. After accepting the offer, I was informed that I was not eligible for the interest rate and that the credit limit would only be $500. The interest rate was some competitive and customer service is friendly. I kept the card for emergencies only, but it is seldom that I use it. It is the lowest limit I have and they won’t raise it for some reason. Overall, they are an easy company to deal with and it is an average card.

name: Nancy Lake-Spurlock
review: I have been a US Bank customer for over 6 years now. I started the account because most of the grocery stores I shopped at had branches inside, my employer's checks were drawn on a US Bank account and because they have extended in-store hours, including Sundays. They were convenient, courteous and the accounts were free. I was so impressed with them that I encouraged my youngest daughter to open her first bank account there, as well. She is also still a customer. That being said, things have changed quite a bit over the last two years. They have instituted rather major fees on accounts with little notice and have closed many of my local branches. I am responsible with my money and qualified for the fee waivers. However the branches that are left for my area are in rather seedy neighborhoods, so I have to drive out of my way to go to a branch I feel safe at. Also, I was rather upset that the tellers kept pushing my young student daughter into applying for a high interest credit card. I was able to deter her when I was with her, but the one teller kept calling the house to try to sway her into accepting. I understand that they have a job to do and that they make commission, but I feel that they were deliberately pushing this high rate card because she was young and more likely to screw up. That upset me. Other than that, I think they are average in customer service, average in rates and above average in the ease of their online banking. They also offer consumer loans online, have 24 hour grace and will work with you on any issues provided that you are a good customer.

name: Lakenya Melbert
review: US Bank is the best bank I have used.  I know where my money is at all times and I know that it is safe and secure along with all my other personal information. At times, when the online banking was down and I had to turn to customer service, they helped me a lot. That is the thing about US Bank, I hardly ever HAVE to call customer service, they are awesome. The representatives are very generous and helpful. They will go that extra mile to make sure you are satisfied. The US Bank branches physically are always nice and clean, the wait is never too long even on known paydays and the staff at my closest location greet me by name! How cool and friendly is that? I hold accounts at 2 other establishments but, US Bank is my favorite!

name: Brad Perry
review: If you are frequent shopper at REI, this card is a must. You get 5% back on all REI purchases! The 5% is given as "REI credit", not cash, so you will be using the rebate for more purchases at REI. I got a $100 REI gift card with my signup - a $50 gift card seems to be the default award for signing up. But, as an REI member, I got a $100 teaser in the mail frequently. Who could pass up $100 of free stuff from REI! Outside of REI purchases, you get a 1% rebate on all other uses; but, again, the rebate is still "REI credit", not cash. Therefore, I have this card strictly for REI purchases. The amount of gear I buy from REI makes this 5% rebate really worth it.

name: Jason
review: I decided to give US Bank a chance when I could no longer afford the maintenance fees from my previous bank. I was an unemployed student at the time and needed a checking account with a debit card attached without monthly fees trickling out of my account. The application process was straightforward and simple; the new accounts teller guided me through everything and made sure everything was setup correctly.Customer service has always been strong at US Bank. The tellers are always courteous and thoughtful. I feel like a preferred customer—it’s like they wait just for me to come in. I’m usually prompted for questions or concerns regarding my account and banking needs but never to the point of botheration.The only mark against the bank is when it introduced maintenance fees accounts with them—but luckily I was able to easily meet one of the guidelines to avoid them, which was setup at the branch by a very helpful associate. Other than that, I’m completely satisfied with US Bank and will remain a loyal customer.

name: Frank Avalos
review: I had nothing but good experiences with U.S. Bank when I had my account with them. The employees are always friendly and they have some pretty decent rates on loans. I had opened the account with them long ago, but honestly can't recall a single negative experience with them that wasn't solved rapidly. The employees are some of the friendliest and very cheerful representatives I have ever had the pleasure of talking to, very helpful and courteous individuals who always seemed to have my very best interest in mind. I can safely say that it is definitely a wonderful place to bank.

name: Mignon Parreira
review: This is a basic and straightforward mileage credit card. I have never had any problems with their customer service or online interface. The website layout is not very sophisticated, but it does the trick. This card is linked to your Skypass account, and at the basic level, does not offer many more advantages. I have yet to redeem miles, but they have been accumulating and I do not believe they expire. This card is beneficial to anybody taking multiple Korean Air and Skypass related flights, as they will receive extra points for booking them. Upgrading to their Visa Signature comes with an annual fee, but also some benefits such as two free Lounge Passes every year - so that may be worth it for some people. I constantly receive the offers to upgrade and have not as of yet.

name: Carmen Milne
review: This bank is great for a student checking account. It has a great one hundred percent free checking program for students. And in some cases your college may even have that bank in your school making it easy to stop by and talk to the friendly staff. Every branch I have been has been extremely nice and the ones at home even know me by name. They are also located it seems almost everywhere. I'm never worried about not being able to find a US Bank which is nice not to worry about. So if you need to pick a bank or want a switch I would definably think about this bank.

name: Jack
review: ThIS US Bank branch is in a grocery store here in Logan, UT.  I transferred my direct deposit to US Bank about three months ago, when they gave the incentive of $100 bonus through direct mailing.  Upon my encounter with the staff, they were friendly and helpful, and the branch was never busy.  It took me about 20 minutes all together to set up the account, which I think is worth the time given the $100 incentive.  The only reason I gave a four star review is because they seem to be âreactiveâ instead of âproactiveâ when honoring their request.  I have received $100 two months after transferring my direct deposit here for two months, which is four months altogether.  They said two months only in the fine print.  I am a very detail oriented person, so I consider them not 100% straight forward with their policy.  I donât know if they would give me the $100, if I forgot to ask.  However, other than this one issue, I had no problems with this bank, and they are responsive to the issue if I know to point out to them.

name: Celine
review: I've had a checking account with US Bank for almost four years, and overall have been fairly satisfied! No minimum balances, unlimited ATM withdrawals, easy to check your balance anytime anywhere. There are locations EVERYWHERE in the city I live in. But I moved away from home to go to college, and there aren't many branches in that city, which is disappointing. But I'm still able to get pretty good use out of my account! They recently started sticking a $2.50 charge to send my account statement via paper every month, and didn't tell me... The customer service has always been very friendly and helpful though! Never had an issue with a teller!

name: Kelsey
review: I have banked at U.S. Bank for several years.  The bank is O.K. But I am sure there are better.  While most the bankers can be very nice and have great customer service, they seem to rip you off.  Every mistake you make costs $8-30 dollars.  Sometimes I feel like they just take my money.  I like that they have cheap savings accounts and checking accounts.  I also used their accounts when I was young to save money.  I did like that.  All in all they are a decent bank.  I would recommend them but just be careful is my only warning.

name: Aimee Malone
review: I've been a member of U.S. Bank for about nine years.  They’ve always been easy to work with, and it’s nice having a nationwide bank because most places I go, there’s usually a nearby branch.  I haven’t had any problems with them, and every time I’ve been into a branch, I’ve been helped quickly.  I used to have one of their credit cards, but I decided not to keep that; the due date changed every month (because it was based on a certain number of days instead of on a monthly due date) and I had a hard time keeping track of that.  That’s the only complaint I’ve ever had, though.

name: Diana Morgan
review: I have over a dozen credit cards, but the US Bank Visa card is my favorite.  I also have my home mortgage with US Bank, so after about a year of making mortgage payments on time, I decided to apply for their Visa card.  I actually didn’t think I’d get the card because my credit isn’t that great.  But miraculously, I was approved for a credit limit of several thousand dollars, and an interest rate of just under 10%.I think the reason for that approval and the high credit limit was due to my excellent mortgage payment record from the previous year.That was three years ago and since then, I have basically cut up all of my other cards (because of their high interest rates and unusually high monthly payments), and just kept the US Bank Visa card.  It’s really all anyone with an average income would need.The customer service at this bank is extremely friendly and helpful.  They seem to go out of their way to help you with any sort of banking problem.  The interest is low, in comparison to other cards and the minimum monthly payments are the lowest I’ve ever seen.  For example, if my balance is $4,000, the minimum payment is only $80.00.I’d definitely recommend the US Bank Visa card to anyone who’s looking for low rates, low minimum payments and great customer service.

name: Paul
review: The bank is situated on mall property, with its own parking lot linked to the rest of the mall's lot. Despite a sign near the bank stating that those parking spots are for bank customers only, that rule is never enforced, so anytime there is any work to be done inside the bank, it is difficult to find nearby parking. They also don't seem to staff their drive-up windows as well as they could, since they might have three lanes open yet only one person actively working to take care of customers in the area. This just isn't a very good bank, at least for this specific branch.

name: Eric Robison
review: I opened an account with US bank when I started college as there was a bonus where I could deposit up to 50 dollars and they would match it.  Since then, I have been thrilled with my overall experience.  They have been friendly every time I go in to cash checks or inquire about my account.  My savings account was eligible for a $25 check card as a bonus last week and I had not received it yet, so I called in, they were friendly on the phone and confirmed it was on the way.  I received it in the mail the next day.

name: Josh Pozner
review: I joined US Bank a little over a year ago and so far haven't been impressed or annoyed by the customer service.  I only opened a checking account, and have found some trouble getting through to customer service when their are charges on my account that I need to get cleared up.  I was on hold for at least 30 minutes when I tried to call in during hours that the branch was closed.  Even after I was able to get someone on the line, they couldn't help me with my problem; I had to go to the branch the next day to get it sorted out.  I also got denied when I tried to apply for a basic student credit rewards card even though I had a credit score of over 700.  This annoyed me because I was told by customer service that a good credit score would almost guarantee me that card.  Overall, I have had ups and downs with the bank, but will be sticking with it mainly because of location in my current situation.

name: John Fore
review: Overall, US Bank has provided the services I need to manage my finances. However, there have been times when I had an account with them, and they've moved my transaction order to charge me more overdraft fees. After talking to the bank manager for a while, who was very helpful, they decided to refund half of the amount. There are plenty of locations to avoid ATM fees, but I feel other bank services refund those to you anyway. I might consider changing over to a credit union soon. I feel like I could be getting more services offer to me compared to the amount of money that I keep in the bank. Every time I've needed to discuss an issue with the bank, they have always been very helpful and reachable. I wish that US Bank offered more free checks to their customers. Anyways, to summarize: mediocre services, good customer service, lots of locations.

name: Brett
review: I recently received the US Bank Cash+ Credit Card from US Bank. After I reviewed plenty of other options I decided that the US Bank Cash+ Card was the one for me. I am 23 years old and have a job that requires me to do a lot of traveling. The Cash+ Card allows you to choose two categories each quarter that you will receive 5% cash back on, and one category where you receive 2% cash back on. There are only three categories for the 2% cash back; gas stations, grocery stores, and drug stores. I already have a Discover Card that allows me to receive 5% cash back on gas for this quarter so I chose to have grocery stores be my 2% category. There are twelve 5% cash back categories to choose from including items such as hotels, airlines, stores, and restaurants. The card also offers insurance on rental cars and luggage insurance for free. To date there are only two things that I donât like about the US Bank Cash+ Card, the first item being the website. Like I said earlier I also have a Discover Card, which has a more user friendly website. Discover Card also instantly shows your pending transactions, where the US Bank Cash+ Card may take a day or two. I also didn't like the application process since it didn't have automatic approval. I have only had the US Bank Cash+ Card for a few weeks, but am amazed at the rewards especially since there are no limits.

name: Brandon
review: Last year, I headed off to college, I needed to set up a for my parents to send me funds just in case I had an emergency. This branch was extremely helpful in setting up the card helping me and my parents though the process. It has come in handy a few times in the past year. Everybody there was extremely helpful going though all the paper work and explaining, we had to talk to a few people. They were also very forgiving. They were even willing to show us how to do all the banking online so my dad wouldn't have to figure it out! I'm extremely glad I have this option when it comes to finances.

name: Amanda Green
review: I have been a customer with US bank since 2007 and the only problem I've ever had with this bank is that in 2008 someone somehow got a hold of my account info and charged my account a fee of 45 dollars. I called the 1 800 number to report a fraudulent charge on my account and the person I talked to said that they would refund the money to me the next business day. It was a Friday when I called so that meant that it would be Monday when the refund would take place.  On Monday I did see on my account that they refunded the money back, but 2 weeks later I received a bill in the mail stating that I now had an overdraft charge because of that fee. So I called the 1 800 number and explained everything to them, and they apologized for my inconvenience and told me they would fix it and I would not receive another bill from them.  About a week later I received another bill and this time instead of calling this number back, I went to one of the branches to talk to someone in person about this. The teller was very nice and he told me that he would get this all straightened out and also told me I would not receive another bill. So I waited another week to see if I would get another bill and sure enough I got another one.  I went back to this branch and this time I talked to a different teller about the problem and at this point I was so frustrated that I told him to close out this account. So he told me that it's not a problem and said it would take up to 72 hours to be closed.I waited until the time was up and went back to check my account online to see if the account was closed. When I looked on my online account though I could see that this account was still opened and I noticed that the overdraft fee charge incurred interest which meant that I owed more money that before.To make a long story short It took me 5 months to finally get everything straightened out and a completely different branch to help me.Ever since then though I have had no problems and the customer service is great at the branch that I go to now.

name: Amanda Green
review: I use the US Bank platinum visa card because I bank with US Bank. I like to use this credit card when I don't have any other way of making a payment.The interest rate is 13.99% which is'nt bad compared to other credit cards that charge 20.99%. The only mistake I make when using a credit card , is that sometimes I charge more than what I can pay back at once. So with that said I usally end up paying the minimum payment or a little bit over that amount. Overall this is a good credit card to use and it is very convenient.

name: Rory
review: I opened checking and savings accounts at US last year because of my former employer's relationship with them. My work took me into a branch a few times a week, and the service was fantastic. I wasn't thrilled with my previous bank, and it didn't take much to get me to switch.All in all, I've been happy. Lots of branches, with good hours (as far as banks go, at least). The online banking is good. I was disappointed with their iPhone app, but they recently did a major upgrade that was a huge improvement. It's not as good as Chase's app, but it's very useable.I've avoided fees by having direct deposit for my pay. Their "START" savings account doesn't have a great rate (but what account does these days?), but there's an interesting perk. Once you hit a $1000 balance, they send you a $50 Visa gift card. If you keep the account over $1000 for the following year, they send you another $50. I'm just about to get my first $50. It's not as good a perk as some banks offer, but it's something.

name: Shaun
review: I joined U.S. Bank about a year ago and since then it has been a battle trying to get things straightened out with them. My wife and I opened a simple checking account so we gave them our marriage certificate. We told them that my wife is in the process of changing her name so either do not add her on the account or add her with her new married name. The teller decided to add her maiden name and when my wife went back with the proper paperwork to change it, the process was long, tedious and involved many other people to help with the change. If only the teller did not add her name in the first place the mess would not have taken place. Then they asked us if we wanted printed check books for our account for a fee of $28.00 We agreed with the promise that we will receive it in the mail within a week. Three weeks later, still did not receive the checks, we went to the bank and spoke to a manager. He apologized and promised he will waive the fee. On the bank statement next month, it showed the charge of $28.00 for the checks even though we still did not receive them. Finally we gave up on getting the checks and ordered them from Walmart. Lastly, I went to close my account because of all the frustrations. The teller kept pushing me to sign up for savings account and that I will get a reward of $25.00 or so. I should have closed it right then. I went ahead with the savings. Now I have fees and other charges that are coming at me for an account I didn't even want in the first place and will be very happy when it's completely closed.

name: Nora Atanay
review: I began using US Bank about six years ago. I started using them because their locations were very convenient to my new home address and they offered free checking. Everyone working at US Bank is very friendly and helpful; however, my free checking account now has a monthly fee, which really bugs me. I hate monthly fees! My employer doesn't offer automatic deposits, so there is no way for me to avoid these fees unless I suddenly have the money to carry a minimum balance (not likely). I love that I can easily find a branch location or one located within a grocery store. The tellers are always anxious to help me find new ways to save money and I always get great customer service.

name: Raptor Ackbar
review: Overall US Bank has treated me quite well, for such a large multinational conglomerate.  My checking account is free regardless of the balance (as long as it stays in the positive anyway) and even provides me a very small amount of interest.  While overdraft protection is considered a scam by many, I would rather pay a small amount to my bank for over-drafting than a much larger amount to someone I wrote a bad check to.  Granted, I've not written a cold check in years, but it's good to know that if I miscount my balance there's some protection there.

name: Ashley Walls
review: I recently relocated to Tennessee and made the switch from Wells Fargo to U.S. Bank. So far, I am incredibly pleased with both the actual banking experience and the customer service provided. At my previous bank, I incurred numerous unexpected fees because of incorrect information I received from the bank's customer service employees. Shortly after I joined my previous bank, it began charging me monthly checking fees when I had previously had none. I had no such surprises with U.S. Bank. The bank's policies were thoroughly explained to me at the time I opened my account. The staff was professional, extremely knowledgeable, and clearly career bankers. I feel greater peace of mind after having switched to this bank, and I plan on using their reliable and friendly service for any future loans or other services I may need in the future.

name: James-Mara Mason
review: My husband and I have been with US Bank for two years. Let me just say, I am more and more impressed with this bank the more time goes on. I have two experiences to share:The first was about a years ago. My husband and I were browsing the Target.com website, when we found a really great deal on an Xbox360. We thought about making the purchase, but I decided to check the online banking before we went ahead. On the website, I noticed a single $100.00 even charge at Target, as well as a $1.00 charge. This was under my card number. Before I could make it to the phone to call US Bank, my phone was ringing. US Bank called and asked if we were the ones making the $100.00 purchase (the customer service agent stated the card was swiped, not input, therefore we knew it wasn't us on the website). The customer service was WONDERFUL! They stopped the purchase, and sent me out a new card during the phone conversation. I received it about a week later.My other experience was just last week. I was buying a vacation for myself and my husband, and after I had already purchased one hotel room, I decided to cancel and re-book as I found one cheaper. I had canceled the first hotel room, but the refund had not yet gone through when I tried to purchase the second. On the website, I was having issues, saying that the card was being denied. I called 1800-US-BANKS (yes, their phone number IS that easy to remember!) and immediately they resolved the problem, turns out they were going to call me anyway to verify the purchase, I just beat them to it!!I love this bank for it's checking service. Every branch I've ever gone into has been a pleasant experience. The tellers are trained to tout their latest products, but they are a business, so I do understand that. My only gripe is that I tried to get a S.T.A.R.T savings account online, rather than in person at a branch, and the website denied me. When I spoke with a teller, she told me that was "strange" as that is not something they "approve or deny." Both parties on the account must be present to open a savings account linked to a checking.

name: Tamara Raiton
review: I have been very pleased with US Bank. I changed to this bank after years of banking with Bank of America. I have found them to be honest, and courteous. I picked this bank because it seemed to be everywhere including this small town I am currently living in, in Tennessee. The only small trouble I have had was with bill pay and the bank paying something too early before my direct deposited paycheck went in. When I called and they checked  and saw there was a mistake made they were quick to fix it and credit me the money that had been deducted. I have never had problems with their ATM's either!!!

name: Steve Griffith
review: Everyone needs to carry a credit card these days, it appears, and the Quicken card is as good as any for basic needs. The interest rate is competitive, the points are nice to have, and since it's a Visa you can use it practically everywhere. My card has taken me to Las Vegas, Denver and Memphis, among other places, and I've never had a problem. I particularly like their the Chase website, which makes managing payments and purchases quick and easy. You can even download your transactions into Quicken software which is an extremely helpful feature, and I make all my payments online. I recommend this card.

name: Julian Bender
review: I got this card mainly because I was offered a $100 gift certificate if I signed up for it. The fact that I also get an extra 5% back on REI purchases was icing on the cake, but my itself wouldn't have been enough for me to get it. I really only use it for purchases at REI or other particularly large purchases - since I get 1% back on non-REI purchases, but that's not normally enough to motivate me to use it. Still - extra money from or at REI is always nice. Once a year REI members get 10% back from all purchases made in the last year, and this adds another 5% on top of that. It's like getting free money every March!

name: Marcel Szczesniak
review: I received my US Bank secured Visa card around the same time as my Capital One secured Mastercard and while most of the fees and benefits are the same between the two cards, US Bank was a little more stringent about the initial deposit necessary to open an account with them. Unlike Capital One's Mastercard, which can be started with a small $49 deposit, US Bank requires $300 minimally.  US Bank does pay a small amount of interest on your deposit with them, but the goal with any of the pre-paid and secured credit cards is not to hold them for a long period of time, rather, you want to use them to rebuild your credit and establish a good reputation with the cardholder as soon as possible. US Bank excelled at keeping tabs on my account and within nine months, I was offered an unsecured Visa through them. My interest rate to start on that card was quite high, only a couple of points less than what had been the going rate on my secured card with them, but they did perform regular credit reviews as promised and that card is now one of my lowest interest cards.  Customer service has been above average, but I think I actually received more personalized  and faster service when I was carrying their secured card than I do now. Contacting customer service involves the typical listening to the robotic voice explain all of the menu choices and then pressing a series of numbers until you finally connect with a human, but once you make it that far, the representatives are quick to address any issues and are extremely polite.Regular reporting to the big three credit reporting agencies make this low-annual fee card a great deal for anyone trying to build or repair their credit record.

name: Jen Schumaker
review: Overall my experience with US bank has been very satisfying.  After leaving my previous bank (Wells Fargo) with nothing but frustration and disappointment, US bank was a very pleasant change.  One of their shinning moments in my eyes occurred when I had once overdrew from my checking account.  It happened to be an emergency situation where I needed some cash, and had not realized the ATM I was using had a 5 dollar fee added onto it and because of this fee I had overdrawn from my account. Instead of charging me for over drawing from my account, someone I received a notice call from a kind lady at US bank letting me know that my account was negative but I received no fees of any kind.  This was very nice.The more recent negative experience I had was when a check was returned.  I had deposited a check in one of their ATM/bank machines.  Five days later while I was attempting to check out at the grocery store I was informed I had inefficient funds.  Needless to say I ended up finding out after making a phone call that my check did not have a signature on the front so they had sent it back to the payee.  I received no emails, texts, calls or notifications which caused a bit of a hassle.Other then this recent incident I have no complaints about US bank and would recommend it to anyone looking for a national bank.

name: Jason W
review: I set up my US Bank account as a secondary account I have at another bank. It's kinda tough to keep all my money at one place since what has happened recently. I just wanted an account that was going to be simple with minimal fuss because I knew I wasn't going to use it much. The Easy Checking account is the one I picked with the guidance of the banker. He seemed pretty knowledgeable and didn't try to sell me things I didn't need which I really appreciated. He was also real honest about the fees I would pay if I didn't keep the minimum balance. I go into the bank about once every other month to keep the account active. The people at the branch are nice and always greet me when I walk in. Overall, I'm pretty happy. If my main bank ever does anything to upset me, I would transfer all of my accounts to US Bank.

name: Tyler McLain
review: Overall, I've had a very pleasant experience with US Bank. There are always enough employees on staff to give me quick service. I love free checking! My checks are free and were delivered promptly to my place of residence. I've never had to spend more than five minutes at any location because of the lack of lines. Also, they are very personable and go out of their way to make sure their services can meet your needs. I've been a US Bank customer since 2007. The only thing that I would recommend to you is to watch out for the overdraft fees. If you aren't careful, you might find yourself with a huge bill because of several small items that you purchased with your debit card went over your limit. They provide you with an option to opt out of that service. I would highly recommend that you do so, so that you save money in emergency situations.

name: Mona Verona
review: So I had this bank for my checking account for over ten years. Over that time, their fees kept going up and up and their services kept going down and down. When I was charged a whopping $30.00 for an NSF automatic payment that turned out NOT to be my fault (long story I won't bore you with here), I decided it was time to leave. It took me over a MONTH to get that issue resolved and every step of the way I was stonewalled by intentionally obstructive tellers and "customer service" people. I started with my own branch and had to work my way up to corporate to get anyone to even LISTEN to me. "I'm sorry, ma'm, but our computers are never wrong." "I'm sorry, ma'm, but that isn't my department." "I'm sorry, ma'm, but the person you want isn't in today." "I'm sorry ma'm, but our records show accurate information." "Blah blah blahdy blah blah."  The ENTIRE experience from start to finish was infuriating, frustrating, and positively Kafkaesque. They'd screwed-up my account, grabbed my money, and then fought me on giving it back. I guess their CEO wasn't rich enough. Avoid huge corporations like U.S. Bank and go with a personable credit union; people who know your name and will actually listen to what you have to say and DO something about problems you may have!

name: Jeremy Paul
review: I have been with US Bank for 3 years now. I started with a checking account, and then moved up to a student credit card and have had 0 problems with them! The tellers are really nice people at my local branch and are willing to help me out with anything, even trivial things. They check and re-check each check and money you deposit. Their online banking website is easy to navigate and very easy to use, much easier than some other banks' websites that I have seen. They are willing to help with any questions and their customer service is great.

name: Billy Paongo
review: I received this credit card while I was in college. It had a very low credit limit compared to my other credit cards. I have kept this credit card active, and it still has a lower credit limit than any of my other credit cards. The interest rate is competitive, but the rewards are not. I feel as if the reward items are overpriced and it takes a long time to save up the reward points needed. Once you do have enough points to trade in, the process can be done very easily on their website. I recommend this credit card for someone who is establishing their credit.

name: Stefanie Tse
review: I was offered this credit card when I was 18 years old as a college student.  My credit limit was initially $300.00 and my limit has increased dramatically over the years.   I am now 27 years old and have a credit limit of 14,300.  My interest rate has gone up and done over the years and right now it is pretty high, at almost 20%.  Other than the higher interest rate, I think that it is one of the superior cards.  I have enjoyed rewards from it.  I have earned thousands of points using this card and was able to receive cash bonuses in return.  I would definitely recommend this card to a friend.

name: Nez Leechz
review: Starting out as a young, poor college student can certainly be frightening. I was really lucky to have a U.S. Bank on campus that was ready to help me figure out how to pay for books, food, and loans. The U.S. Bank College Visa® Card is perfect for helping beginners navigate the world of credit by helping students to establish a solid credit rating. I've always enjoyed the convenience of U.S. Bank, as well as their Zero Fraud Liability advantage. I had my card stolen once and as soon as I called, the customer care representative took care of everything right away! Definitely a solid choice.

name: Adrian Półtorzycki
review: US Bank’s Platinum Visa card is truly one type of a card. As a user of this card I found it to be very useful and practical. The high amount that the card lets me use as credit is very useful. Another good thing about this card is that for the first few months there wasn’t any due date so I didn’t have to worry about paying it off on time along with my other cards, cards which I think are in no doubt less superior to this one. With this high amount I could finally replace the old tires on my car, I did not have that amount to spend at the time and I chose to pay it off with this card.

name: Coco
review: I had banked with US Bank since college, I chose them over my last bank because of the many convenient locations they have in the town I lived in. I had the free checking account with them for many years and was happy (not thrilled) with my banking experience. Their online banking was glitchy, at some point I had to recreate a whole another log in ID because my old one got lost in the system somehow but I wasn't allowed to use the same ID, it was beyond my understanding of what really happened.The real problem came when I went overseas in 2008, I left some money in the account assuming it'll still be there when I come back. I double checked with them that there will not be any fees for inactive accounts before I left. In 2011, I started to notice monthly maintenance fees charged to my account, I panicked... since there isn't anything I could do being overseas to help that. I emailed their support and they told me they no longer provide the free checking and my account had to be over certain amount to waive that fee. I explained to them my situation, being overseas and wasn't aware this change had taken place, I had received no letters or emails regarding this. So there I was, being overseas, slowing watching my account drained bit by bit every month. I don't blame them for getting rid of the free checking, given the economy that the time, but charging to existing customers without notice is what made me pretty unhappy with them. I closed my account immediately when I returned in 2012.In short, they are just a bank, not outstanding and no longer competitive. My advice would be to shop around before opening an account with them.

name: Ryan Bissett
review: I moved to Ames, Iowa last August when I became a student here at Iowa State University, and the University has a partnership with US Bank where your student ID Card doubles as an ATM card, so I signed up for an account. The signup process was painless and everything was made clear to me and my mother when we were signing up. After that was done, I've had no problems the entire year. Online banking makes it easy to check my account information, there are ATMs all over campus, and every time I've had to go into the bank itself the employees were friendly and helpful. This is the first bank I've used that isn't a small regional bank and the experience has been very smooth the entire time and I highly recommend US Bank.

name: Rebecca Hampton
review: Whenever I go into the bank I am always greeted with a smile and treated with respect. I'm not good with numbers and tend to have a lot of banking issues... but the people at US Bank take it all in stride. I use US Bank for my student loans, and although my interest rates aren't as low as they could be at Wells Fargo, I feel much more comfortable sticking with a bank I have been with for years. It is also very nice that I can use my university ID to access my account at ATMs on campus. It is little conveniences like that which make me happy to continue using US Bank.

name: Lisa Huard
review: Ridiculous bank. I was a customer for 2 years and I ended up paying them in the end because of an error on their part. Not sure why they wouldn't work with me on it, but they were going to close my account asap if I couldn't get it paid. I went back and forth with the rude customer service people but in the end they wouldn't budge. It was a charge from something I had no idea about but that didn't matter. I let them close my account and I will never do business with them again, the banking experience wasn't that great anyways.

name: Dallas Robinson
review: I have been a customer with U.S. Bank for about 7 years.  I opened a checking account with them when I got my first job in high school, and I have continued to use them throughout college.  It is a great bank.  The application process lasted no more than 15 minutes.  It is very easy for my parents to put money in my account from Minnesota and have it show up instantly in my account in Ohio.  Online checking is also great.  I can check my balance at any time from either my computer or an app on my phone.  Additionally, the few times I have overdrawn my account, U.S. Bank has been quick to alert me.  Rather than charge me a fee, they have allowed me to simply add more money to my account to cover the difference.  Due to customer service and ease of use, I would say my experiences with U.S. Bank have been top notch.

name: William Smithers
review: Right now I'm looking to get a new car and in the process I've been shopping for car loans.  I admit I'm being a bit old fashioned about it and am going straight to the banks to ask about policies and rates and such rather than researching everything on the internet.  And while I do try my best to dress well and be polite, I admit I can be a jerk and a fool at times.  But I don't think that excuses the rude behavior I experienced when I went into my local branch of this bank.  It wasn't busy when I went in so I got in the teller line to find out who I should talk to about a loan.  The teller asked "are you too stupid to read?" and pointed at a sign that said "loan officers" or something like that.  I was kind of shaken by this and rather than thank her I said, "okay," and went over.  The person there sat and read a magazine at me and shushed me when I tried to ask a question about loans.  When I asked to speak with a manager, he got up, went over to someone behind a glass partition and spoke to them.  I could see them point and look at me for a few minutes as they spoke and then the guy came back.  I was told, "no, the manager will not speak with you," so I left.  I don't know if they were having a bad day or if I did something to precipitate it but it was the strangest experience I ever had going into a bank.  They're supposed to be a good bank and a few of my friends have had great luck dealing with them so maybe I'll try working with another branch before I give up on them entirely.  The experience kinda hurt my feelings, though.

name: Kathy Hancock
review: I find the checking account services to be more than satisfactory. It is easy to apply for a service charge free bank account that allows free checking given you provide your own checks and a check advance option to avoid those horrible overdrawn account fees.
