Logging in to check your balance or phoning in to check your balance, which is available as a toll free service with either your account or Social Security number, handily keep you on top of your own financial situation and let you avoid fees. Additionally when I had a problem with charges to my checking account the matter was quickly resolved well under the time margin they had given me. All I had to do was get the names involved and date of my first notice of the matter and my word on it that I did not want the product or order it and come in to sign a paper on one occasion for the bank officer to take care of the rest.

name: Hollie Lichtenwalter Secrest
review: I have been with US Bank for 7 yrs and love them! I love US Bank because the bank has a small town feeling while being a large bank. The tellers are always nice, greet you by name and seem sincerely interested in how you have been doing.  I love the free checking accounts, though I wish they had a checking that also was interest baring. We have been very satisfied with their customer service any time we have had to call in. I love their online banking which allows me to check my account balance and see all account activity anytime I want. They also have apps for any of the IOS and Android systems.

name: Brandy
review: I have been banking with U.S. Bank for several years now. I like the convenience of their banking hours and locations. I also like their service. I have had problems with account fraud and they took care of it immediately. The only thing that I don't like is that I can't just call their 1-800 number to solve some issues. They want you to speak directly to the branch manager for some issues. I don't see the need to do that. Other than that one issue, I would recommend them to anyone. They have been a very good bank overall.

name: Sam Hellings
review: The person I spoke to to set up my account was nice and a pleasure to talk to, I have no complaints about that part of U.S. Bank. I chose them because they had a branch very close to my house. It soon seemed to always be closed, though. It was weeks until I realized they'd closed! Their website still claims they have a location there, years later. I now have to drive out of my way to do business there.Their online banking system needs serious work. It doesn't even tell you what kind of account you have anywhere, or what kind of limits and penalties you're subject to. That shouldn't be a huge issue, except that they discontinued the type of account I had without saying anything.I get as many credit card offers in the mail from them as statements. They also call about twice a year to offer me a credit card. When your bank calls, you make sure to pay attention, right? What they do is force you to interrupt them or be rude to turn down the offer. Very unprofessional.

name: Theresa Mills
review: I have been a customer of US Bank for nearly 10 years. The customer service associates have always been kind, both in the branch and on the phone. They are flexible and offer you guidance when needed. If I call to ask about a transaction they are able to provide me with the information I'm looking for. They have been able to offer me products that other banks do not, when I am in need of money. Their checking account advances are not only affordable but very flexible with the amount of money they allow you to borrow. They are very helpful and I hope to be a customer 10 years from now as well.

name: Felicia Geerman
review: I first received this card when I opened a student account with my bank in my first year of college. I wanted a simple and good card to charge my textbooks on. I easily obtained this card. It received an excellent limit for someone first starting out with credit and who's learning how to be responsible. It even comes without fees. A great perk about this card is it's a part of a rewards program that gives you the opportunity to earn points while using the card. For every $2 you spend, you receive 1 point back. When you receive enough points, you can even receive cash back if you wish.

name: Kristina Brooks
review: Although U.S. Bank is not my highest ranking bank due to experience, they rate average for me.  The customer service was good, there was nothing great - we would frequently have to wait up to 24 hours for an answer to resolve a problem.  I did like their extended hours on Saturday at my local branch.  There are other banks I've worked with that were better but for a good, steady bank - they are average.

name: Mitch Schoey
review: I needed to start a savings account so I did a little shopping around online for my best option. I was disappointed to realize that interest rates are super low everywhere you go (giving me almost no incentive to even start a savings account). I was happy to find this bank because I came across their "Goal Savings" account. It allowed me to avoid any monthly maintenance fees, and also gave me the opportunity to save more easily (automatic transfers from a checking account). But the best part about the account for me was the $50 incentive they offer after you reach $1000, and then another $50 after maintaining $1000 for a full year. a $100 return on a $1000 was a great opportunity (especially considering savings account rates are only 0.20 on average, if that!). I had to open a checking as well in order to qualify for this deal but it was worth it. The checking account has been easy and simple to maintain (no fees). I can't speak for the in branch staff because I opened the accounts online and have done everything else either over the phone or by mail. But I can say the whole online process was super easy and the telephone bankers have been helpful.

name: Matt
review: I have been with U.S. Bank for many years and have always been very impressed with them. It is always an easy, stress-free time with them. They also deal with problems very quickly and professionally, no matter which branch you go to. A few months ago I was on vacation out-of-state when my debit car and I.D. got stolen. I quickly went to the nearest branch, which was very close, and had my account closed. I reopened another account, which didn't take long, and they even sent me free checks. Everyone always seems to be friendly and easy to work with, and there are plenty of branch locations nearly anywhere you go. U.S. Bank will most likely be my bank for many years to come.

name: Jose Witt
review: I really enjoy shopping at the store so having this hard goes hand in hand. I’m an avid outdoors adventurer and no matter how much gear I have I always buy more. This card allows me to get a 1% rebate on all purchases and 5% on purchases at REI. The dividend comes once a year and it’s like getting a surprise! I usually select the option of cashing out my rewards to pay the card off. I’d rather do that and buy more stuff with the card, earning more cash. Paying online is easy and it’s accepted everywhere. This is the card I don’t leave home without!

name: Vincent Michaels
review: U.S. Bank Platinum Credit Card has been nothing but great for me. I will have had the card for 6 months starting in June. The card gives me a pretty good credit limit. It is not too high and it is not too low. It is great for emergency uses, and the fact that there is no maximum or minimum for spending works out great for me. Customer service is very polite and prompt. They will make sure that they help you with anything that you may need help with. The Bank is also great with staying on top of fraudulent activity with accounts. What I mean by that is, they watch out for your account to make sure no one has hacked your account or has stolen your credit card. If they believe something fishy is going on with your account they will immediately freeze it and contact you. That is both good and bad, because when that happened to me it was actually me who was spending and no one had stolen my card, so it just made it a hassle for me, but hey, better safe than sorry. I would recommend this card to anyone out there looking to purchase it.

name: sabina
review: I got referred to US bank by a friend, who told me they offered Second chance banking. The sign up process was very quick, and my new debit card arrived within about 2 weeks. What I really love about US bank, is their convenient locations. Traditional branches are big and spacious, and have several tellers working at the same time to get your in and out quickly. I love the ability to transfer funds from Savings into Checking and vice versa by calling the automated system, online, or by physically going to a branch. When I lost my debit card, I was able to call in and get a replacement in only a week. US bank offers the option to avoid monthly checking account fees by setting up an automatic transfer from checking to savings. Transactions are seen within a day, and the available balance is clearly shown. I am satisfied with this bank.

name: LisCins Marketing
review: I have to admit that I prefer this card over most of the ones in my pocket. it gives me the freedom and flexibility I need from a card without some of the troubles. They offer online management as well as great customer service and security features to keep your account protected. The perks that come with it rock as well like extra money on your divined at rei, which you can either use at rei or get cash and  use for anything you want. Its like getting twice the rewards sometimes. All in all I would recomend this card to a friend.

name: Liz Adams
review: I've been with US Bank for several years now. The benefits of this bank are the location, it has branches throughout my state and several in store branches with long hours. On the few times I've needed to go in the staff is generally friendly. They have a lot of questionable policies for example despite the fact that when the new legislation came I opted out of overdraft protection. I still have consistent issues with over drafting. I had told them to decline my card rather than let me over draft yet somehow I end up in the negative with an extra fee. If I call and complain they remove the fee's but its very frustrating. I set up text notifications with them which has been disastrous. They come at odd hours of the night and are always inaccurate. I got a message today saying I had a negative balance but when I signed in my balance was in the positive. This sort of thing happens all the time. Overall I'm disappointed with US Bank when I've called their customer service line the reps are always rude. If it were not for my husbands direct deposit we would have already changed banks.

name: Joe Weider
review: I honestly have no desire to go to Mexico right now, what with the whole drug war situation going on, but it certainly is a popular destination for many.  If you fly to Mexico regularly and always fly Aero Mexico, then the Aero Mexico Credit Card could be helpful in lowering costs, depending on what exactly it offers.  As far as rewards go, the AeroMexico Credit Card gives you, 15,000 miles after your first purchase, 2,000 bonus miles and a free companion ticket each year you renew your account membership, two miles on each dollar spent on Aero Mexico, a 10% discount on Aero Mexico airfare, and 1 mile per $1 spent on everything else.  The miles per $1 spent aspects of the Air Mexico Credit Card’s rewards offerings aren’t very special, but the bonus miles, free companion tickets, and 10% discounts certainly are…if you’re a loyal Air Mexico passenger.  If you aren’t, what good will these perks be.  When it comes to rates, the Air Mexico Credit Card does not offer any low introductory rates on purchases or balance transfers, though this is to be expected from a card with attractive rewards.  Such a card could have a fairly substantial annual fee to offset the lucrative rewards, but this isn’t the case with the Aero Mexico Card, as it does not have an annual fee in the first year and only charges $45 each subsequent year.  10% off airfare and free tickets are obviously worth $0-45, so I would certainly be interested in the Aero Mexico Rewards Card if a brand-loyal frequent Mexican Airlines flyer.  If not, I’d look for alternatives.  This is the same advice I’d give to anyone considering an airline-specific credit card because people who do not fly only with the airline affiliated with their card won’t see as much benefit as often, nor will they be able to mitigate the threat of rewards devaluation.  So, let’s talk options to the AeroMexico Rewards Credit Card.  If you want travel rewards, I’d go with either the Chase Sapphire Preferred Card, which gives you $625 in airfare/hotel nights as an initial bonus, or the Capital One Venture Card, which basically offers 2% cash back across all purchases.  If you don’t travel all that often, I’d go for cash back rewards, either via the Capital One Cash Rewards Card (1.5% across all purchases) or the Blue Cash Everyday from American Express (3% at supermarkets, 2% at gas stations and department stores, and 1% on everything else).  If you want low rates, there’s both a Chase Slate Card and a Discover More Card offering 0% on purchases and transfers for 15 months along with no balance transfer fee.  Any of these cards would be better than the Aero Mexico Credit Card for the average consumer.

name: Joe Weider
review: The “Cache” in Cache Credit Card refers to the store by that name, but what you have to figure out in deciding whether to apply for the Cache Card is whether it’ll lead to you garnering a cache, i.e. a treasure trove, a store of valuables.  Let’s start with what the Cache Credit Card offers.  In return for the good or excellent credit it takes to get it, the Cache Card gives you 5% off all purchases at Cache or Cache Luxe stores and on cache.com, 5 points per $1 spent at Cache and Cache Luxe stores, 1 point per $1 spent everywhere else, and 1,000 bonus points after your first purchase.  It doesn’t offer 0% intro rates on either purchases or balance transfers.  It’s therefore pretty clear that the Cache Credit Card is a good option for people who spend a fair amount every month at Cache stores.  Everyone else wouldn’t get enough value from the card to warrant application.  Before anyone applies though, its important to note that the Cache Credit Card is a No Preset Spending Limit (NPSL) card, which means that you won’t ever know what your spending limit is and might incur credit score damage at no fault of your own as a result of the way issuers report credit utilization for these cards to the credit bureau.  If you were on the fence about whether or not to get the Cache Credit Card, this might be the deciding factor.In terms of alternatives, the Blue Cash Everyday Card is a good option because it gives you 3% cash back at supermarkets, 2% at gas stations and department stores and 1% on everything else.  The Chase Sapphire Preferred Card also gives you a $500 bonus for spending $3,000 during the first three months.

name: Joe Weider
review: If you’re in the construction industry or love to do home projects, an Ace Credit Card could be for you.  Before we get ahead of ourselves though, you shouldn’t just apply for an Ace Card because you sometimes shop at Ace or have been meaning to tackle this or that.  You should get it if Ace purchases represent one of your biggest expenses.  Why?  Because the Ace Credit Card’s rewards are primarily Ace-oriented and you want to have rewards credit cards that allow you to maximize your perks, both in terms of overall value and how often you benefit.  See, the Ace Credit Card offers 3 points per $1 spent at Ace stores (plus an extra 2 points per $1 if you spend above $12,000 in a year), 2 points per dollar spent on gas and groceries, and 1 point per $1 on everything else.  You also get a $10 bonus for opening your Ace Credit Card.  Unfortunately, you can only redeem Ace Credit Card points for Ace store credit and points are redeemable at a rate of only 0.2% (12,500 points = $25 at an Ace store).  Given that these rewards are uncompetitive as well as limiting in terms of redemption and since you also don’t get a 0% introductory rate on either purchases or transfers with the Ace Card, it’s hard to imagine a scenario where the ACE Credit Card is a good choice).Therefore you need some alternatives.  If you want a card that gives you a good cash back rate across all purchases, the Capital One Cash Card is a good offer.  If you want a card offering extra on gas and groceries, the Blue Cash Everyday Card is not only more rewarding than the Ace Credit Card, but it’s also more straightforward.  A number of cards also offer 5% cash back on rotating spending categories, which may include home improvement.

name: Joe Weider
review: If you’re looking to give back, the Children’s Wish Foundation is certainly a worthy cause.  But whether the Children’s Wish Foundation Cash Rewards Credit Card is a worthy credit card is another story altogether.  Any credit card can be a charity credit card both in the sense that you can simply donate your rewards personally or sign up for one of the charity giving programs that most credit card companies now offer.  That means the Children’s Wish Foundation Cash Rewards Card is not the only option people looking to give to this particular cause have at their disposal and it must therefore be held to a higher standard.  This card offers a $10 statement credit after your first purchase and “1% cash back each year on everyday purchases like groceries, gasoline and movie tickets.”  You also get 0% on both purchases and balance transfers for 6 months, which I guess you could use to keep more of your money in the bank for longer and donate the interest revenue to charity.  Still, the Children’s Wish Foundation Cash Rewards Credit Card is obviously not that good.  It doesn’t even appear that these rewards are automatically donated to the Children’s Wish Foundation; perhaps U.S. Bank, the cards issuer, simply gives a portion of the profits derived from the card to the charity.  Either way, there are better ways to give back.For example, you could open a card like the Chase Sapphire Preferred and donate the $500 initial bonus you get.  You could also get a card like the Capital One Chase Credit Card, which gives you 1.5% cash back across all purchases, and donate on an ongoing basis.  Capital One also lets you customize the entire front side of your card so you could put a Children’s Wish Foundation picture on the front and get the same branding as the Children’s Wish Foundation Credit Card.  The point is that there are a number of cards that will allow you to give more back to the foundation than the actual Children’s Wish Foundation Cash Rewards Credit Card, so take a pass on it.

name: Joe Weider
review: It hasn’t been the best time ever recently to visit Mexico, but if you do business south of the border or have family there, you may want a way to lower the cost of this travel, and the AeroMexico Credit Card just might be that way.  With the AeroMexico Credit Card, you get 10% off AeroMexico flights, 2 miles per $1 spent on AeroMexico flights, 15,000 bonus miles and a free companion ticket after first use, 2,000 bonus miles and a $99 companion ticket each year you renew your account, and you get one Club Premier Mile for each dollar you spend.  For a card that doesn’t have an annual fee during the first year and only a $45 one in subsequent years, the Aero Mexico Credit Card seems to offer a lot of value.However, there it’s important to note that this isn’t the only AeroMexico Credit Card in town.  There’s also an AeroMexico Visa Signature Card.  It offers 20,000 first use bonus miles instead of 15k, 4,000 bonus miles annually instead of 2k, and 15% discounts on AeroMexico airfare instead of 10%.  However, it’s annual fee beginning in the second year is $80 and it has the No Preset Spending Limit Feature, which means you’ll never know exactly how much available credit you have and your credit score might incur undeserved damage because of misleadingly reported credit utilization.  If you decide the added rewards are worth the risk, that’s your choice though.  Either of these AeroMexico credit cards would certainly help frequent AeroMexico flyers save, but only they should get it.  If you don’t fly with this airline a lot you wont be able to benefit from your card often enough or avoid rewards devaluation.

name: Joe Weider
review: Most schools have one alumni credit card, maybe two.  Baylor has four.  There’s this one (the Baylor Alumni Association Visa Signature Credit Card), the Baylor Alumni Association Cash Rewards Visa Platinum Credit Card, Baylor Alumni Association Select Rewards Visa® Platinum Credit Card and Baylor Alumni Association Visa® Platinum Credit Card.  Like their names, these cards are all pretty similar.  They require good or excellent credit for approval, are issued by U.S. Bank, offer 0% on both purchases and balance transfers for 6 months and don’t have annual fees.  With the exception of the Baylor Alumni Association Visa® Platinum Credit Card, they all offer some rewards as well.  So how's a Baylor alum supposed to choose?  Obviously rule out the ugly duckling card that doesn’t have rewards, but what then?  Unfortunately, I would also discount the card listed on this page.  If you didn’t know, VISA SIGNATURE CARDS HAVE NO PRESET SPENDING LIMIT.  I put that in all caps because many people think that NPSL cards don’t have limits.  That isn’t a reason to get the Baylor Visa Signature card though, it’s a reason to avoid it.  This card will have a limit, it will just change on a monthly basis and U.S. Bank will not clue you in on what it is.  You aren’t alone though, because they won’t tell the credit bureaus either.  By opening the Baylor Alumni Association Visa Signature credit card you then resign yourself to never knowing if you have enough available credit to make a big purchase and the potential for credit score damage.  In terms of the remaining two cards, I guess the 1% cash back and $10 intial bonuses that the Baylor Cash Rewards card provides is preferable to the 1 pt./$1 spent offered by the Select Rewards Visa, but neither will give you as much value as the best rewards cards on the market.  I’d therefore suggest opening the Capital One Cash Card, throwing a Baylor Bears-themed picture on there for free, and calling it a day.
